title: The most convenient transport from airport to center of Bangkok,
review: This is the best transport to avoid traffic jam from Suwannaphum airport to the center of Bangkok You can get off at Phayathai station and hop on BTS to other destinations or you can get off at Makkasan station and get into MRT to you desired destinations Cost is reasonable It's quite punctual most of the time Make sure you study your destination so you know where to get off

title: Most convenient way to get to AP
review: Best way to and from Survanabhumi  No traffic clean fast cool  Make sure to have your token ready at exits though

title: Brilliant.
review: Too easy affordable fast comfortable and clean  45 baht each beats a taxi stuck in Bangkok traffic A very impressive and efficient service

title: Quick and straightforward
review: Very convenient to get into the centre of Bangkok with an interchange to the Metro possible at Makkasan station I paid less than 40 Baht for a ticket and the carriage and journey overall were fine  necessarily becoming more crowded the closer to the city the train went    At Suvarnabhumi airport the station is located in the basement surrounded by several stores and eateries and the walk from passport control to the platform is well signposted and covered throughout Announcements on the platforms at the airport station and through the carriages’ PA system are made in two languages including Thai   Even at Makkasan rail station  where you can change to the Metro at Phetchaburi station  you’ll be walking on a long but shaded footbridge which is wide and descends for most of its length

title: First
review: Less money and first you can get airport  I always take airport rail  From pays thai to suwanabumi airport just cost 45 baht

title: Easy access to and from airport
review: I learned there are two different train systems requiring two different types of ticket and separate payment The airport link uses tokens Make sure you don't put the token close to your phone so it works when you exit The train was clean and efficient Token machines have an Engligh option You need to pay in cash with bills no larger than 100 baht

title: Avoid the traffic jams to/from the Airport
review: using the Airport Rail Link is a convenient way to get tofrom the Airport You can avoid the road traffic and get to your hotel quicker by using the Rail Link The Airport Rail Link is connected to the MRT at Makkasan Stn and the BTS at Phaya Thai Stn Note there is another fare when you connect to the MRTBTS lines

title: Clean, Convenient, Cost effective, Regular Schedules
review: Connected to Airport Rail Link from RMT Found it to be Clean Convenient Cost effective and met my schedule needs Traveling Solo with one carry bag but there were ample space & luggage area for the larger luggage

title: Cheap n convenient
review: The railway is very convenient Ticket fare is cheap Paid less than 100 thb from airport to national stadium station (MBK)  Highly recommended as the traffic is congested if u travel by taxi and will cost easily 450baht

title: Taxi first then rail
review: I took a taxi from the airport my first time through It was very expensive but I was in a hurry The second time I took the train It took the same amount of time as the taxi but at 16th the cost   The train isn’t as nice as the sky train or as pretty but it runs on time it’s inexpensive and it’s clean I highly recommend researching it’s use before traveling to Bangkok so the organized taxi pricing can’t be used on you Airport taxis don’t go by meter Nor can the price be negotiated Minimum prices are set by the airport taxi company and prepaid for one stop then the car returns to the airport I was quoted 1300 baht to Sukumvit Road The actual metered price was 13 that (I took a taxi back one early morning)

title: The Best Way to the Airport
review: Spend 400500 Baht for a taxi to the airport but take the slightly longer ride in a train for only 7080 Baht It's clean and efficient and not overcrowded

title: Easy, cheap and fast transportation to center of Bangkok
review: When arriving at Suwannabhumi airport take airport link to main interchange at Makasan or Phayathai to connect to MRT or BTS to most parts of Bangkok Easy quick hassleless way to reach your destination hotel right in middle of Bangkok Only thing is you need to lug around your own luggage but it helps to avoid traffic jams in a taxi

title: A neat way to travel
review: I took the rail link from the Airport and there is a total of 8 stops The last stop connects to BTS while another connects to MRT Great way to reach your hotel I thought the frequency was a bit long even at 9 AM and the travelling time from end to end is about 30 mins The end seats have a small space for luggage   There is a counter for those with no coins or having large notes So go ahead and you will get your ticket either way  Ease and cool way to travel and they could have made a through connection

title: Best ever service
review: I am experiencing excellent for the service when we can take train right from the airport to the center of the city and back   It's very convenient and very good price Talking about 40 bath per person to or from Central City and airport

title: Perfect for a solo traveller
review: Cheap avoid traffic jam suit to a solo or couple travellers Convenient connection with MRT and BTS

title: Brilliant service
review: Excellent service to and from the airport Signs in English everywhere and the ticket counter people are extremely helpful in pointing you in the right direction Trains very clean and air conditioned We had to take this train then the MRT for 1 stop in order to get to our hotel and then reverse to get back to the airportall for 105 baht for 2 of us  No complaints at all

title: Convenient from airport to city
review: Try to get hotel near to airport rail link station as it’s so convenient and fast to reach the airport and cheaper than taxi avoiding unnecessary traffic jam

title: Meh!
review: The train travels at a rather slow pace but compared to other transit methods it's the best If you are in a hurry to reach Suvarnabhumi this is your best option

title: Best airport to downtown transport.
review: Most convenient and cheap transport from airport to downtown Took a taxi from airport to my hotel arriving in Bangkok and it cost way too much I used airport link from downtown to airport and it was less time and third of what I paid for taxi

title: Suvarnabhumi Airport to Bangkok City Center
review: The airport link train is fast with 2 airport stops (International and Domestic terminals) and 7 city stops to the terminus It is good because it takes about 15 minutes and is unaffected by traffic or rain Several of the stations are linked to either the BTS sky train MRT underground train lines or to bus stations Easy getting on and off with luggage Low cost

title: Quick / Convenient
review: Cheap quick (30 minutes  end to end)  Clean & modern system   Easy to navigate the stations   A little confused with the ticket machine as they will only accept one notecurrency  So make sure the note is large enough to cover the fee  Other than that no dramas  Simple & efficient  Great experience   Easy to find in the airport  Follow the signs

title: Holidays
review: I use the link to go from airport to city centre  It is very economical safe and quick Staff are always eager to help if you have any problems and it is always clean

title: What time not to use sky train.
review: The sky train is a fantastic transport system that is making Bangkok less polluted A green environmentally friendly way to travel that gets you around Bangkok quickly It also connects to the underground airport and main train station I have a car and leave it in Nasa Vegas car park as a Sky Train station is just a 100 metres away Do not use the system between 6am and 9 am as the locals use the system to get to work If you have heard the expression pack them like a tin of sardines it is no exaggeration

title: Easy access to the city
review: If heading to the city of Bangkok take the airport rail link to phaya Thai station (8 stops and end of the line) then get off and take the BTS to the city So cheap too45 baht for one person one way Air conditioned carriages too

title: Convenient.
review: Get off the plane go to basement of the terminal    For 35Thb it will take you to the heart of the city avoiding the traffic and from any of the stations along the way it will be easier to take a taxi to your destination

title: best way to and from Suarnabhumi airport
review: definitely the best way to go reach the city Connection with BTS the elevated rapid transit system and  MRT underground metro Quick and convenient

title: cheap way to get out of airport
review: excellent way to get out of the airport to the city you can choose express trains where it gets you to the end station (phaya thai) with minimal stops

title: Absolutely awesome,
review: Is very convenience to travel with save money and time will use it againVery good service easy to travel

title: Very Easy
review: A great way to get into Bangkok Easy to use and cheap Just follow the signs downstairs You can hop off along the way to access other trains and the Subway

title: Fast and cheap
review: Is a great way to transfer from Airport I have been using this mean of transport as no traffic jam clean and cheap (About 40 baht)

title: Great option into town daytime
review: If you are staying anywhere within a mile or two of a stop take this train A dollar or two is great opposed to 20$ and 1 hour plus taxi  Always taxis at the stations

title: definitely!
review: if you're staying on sukhimvit take the link to Makasan stn It's more convenient than transferring earlier on the link  from Makasan stn just take a grab car taxi or cheap motorbike taxi

title: Easy to access airport
review: Very easy and tragic free to reach airport But the country is famous for cheap taxi So less people’s use this transportation

title: A very fast gateway to the city of Bangkok
review: Fast efficient and low cost This is a brillaint way of getting from the airport to your hotel The airport link connect with the rest of the BTS service when you can get to just about anywhere

title: Perfect link to join uptown Bangkok quickly
review: I took this line a couple of time and it's by far the easiest way to go uptown for a few baths I do recommend it

title: Best transport to/from airport,
review: It's the most convenient mean of transportation to and from Suwannaphum Airport to the center of Bangkok There are numbers of transfer station to both MRT and BTS to take you to different places in Bangkok It brings you above all local traffic conditions into the city Just make sure you study the route to your final destination carefully on where is your connection station It's the most comfortable transport if your destination is on it's route

title: Direct to Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: economical direct transport to Suvarnabhumi Airport Access via BTS my advice is if you are a light traveler such as one roller or backpack this is the way to go to or from Suvarnabhumi Airport

title: Good one
review: Best transport option for Suvarnabhumi destination Hassle free and always on time  Will be good if it is also available for DMK (Don Mueang) Airport

title: Best way into town
review: Low cost easy convenient Best way into town from BKK Staff are helpful You get a nice view of the city on the way in

title: One of the faster ways to get from the Airport to Bangkok
review: Very fast train and this is a sister railway to Seibu Railway in Japan Very easy to use and cheap as well

title: Good if you have long layover
review: We were having layover of About 13 hours we boarded and reached the destination very fast and convientely

title: Much easier to get to Sukhumvit on this than taxi.  Cheap.
review: At BKK airport basement catch train to Makasan  Then BTS To Asok  Then walk to your hotel if quite near (ours Soi 18)  Same day we did this (Friday 15 June) at 1425hours our friends landed at DMK at 1630hours and took a cab to the same hotel  With traffic jams the journey took almost four hours

title: Comfortable ride into the city!
review: This is the best and cheapest way to get to the city from the BKK Airport Ride is quiet and comfortable though the line is always crowded and the frequency of trains are around once every 10 minutes

title: Good service
review: We got very very good service from my birthday date by KTong KTae and KNut And great with very fresh food and good taste  Perfect

title: Excellent Service to the Airport
review: After a week of travelling by taxi in Bangkok constantly stuck in traffic jams it was a pleasure to hop on to the beautiful airconditioned Airport Rail link to travel to the airport Takes the stress out of getting there on time and having to negotiate with taxi drivers And such great value

title: Amazing
review: Easy fast and cheap the airport rail link can take you to the airport without traffic and worries

title: Fast and clean
review: Train was fast and clean To get from the airport to Siam square just follow the signages to the airport rail and pay 45 baht per pax Stop at Phaya thai station (45 min) and change to BTS takes another 15 min to reach Siam station Most convenient and affordable Seats available if you take from the airport which is the first stop Airport rail link gets crowded later on

title: EXCELLENT, SIMPLE TRIP AIRPORT TO CITY !
review: The Airport Rail Link terminates at Phaya Thai station affording easy access to downtown Bangkok Cost THB 45less than $A2 Rail staff are friendly approachable and eager to assist

title: WORTH & CONVINIENT RIDE
review: From Suvanabhumi Airport to NOVOTEL Pratunam Platinum Hotel   AIRPORT RAIL LINK is the FASTEST & BEST ride It is just 5 mins walking distance from NOVOTEL Hotel For people who plan to stay at INDRA Square Amari Hotel Baiyoke Sky Tower airport rail link is  5 MINS walking distance Travellers should get down at 2nd last stop A7 stop also known as RATCHPRORAP Station forall the above mentioned Hotels Pls use this RAIL LINK its worth  CHEAP & CONVENIENT

title: Super easy from BKK direct to the city
review: Please avoid the taxi drivers in general they drive like there are no rules   Get the train inside BKK terminal and go direct into the city and it even connects to the other metro trains This makes Bangkok easy

title: Quick and easy
review: A fast and cheap alternative to taxis  Links up with the BTS if you need to get closer to your hotel  We were in Pratunum and only 5 minute walk to hotel

title: fast and reliable
review: Easy even for unexperienced travellerscost 50 baht and connects you directly with bts skytrain at phraya thai station

title: Convenient way to get to the City
review: The train is usually crowded  We travelled from the Airport to Phya Thai Station Because the trip start end were at the final destination points of the train there was no issue with handling luggage This is the fastest and cheapest way to travel to the City when considering traffic jams in the city areas Thaya Phai  station has lifts and elevators As such taking luggage was not an issue

title: This train is a godsend!
review: If you know Bangkok traffic then you would appreciate this train service to and from the airport It’s fast predictable convenient not expensive and air conditioned No problem with traffic at all too

title: Fastest way to get into the city
review: The airport rail link is the most convenient form of transportation to get into Bangkok City The tickets are reasonable and the trains are clean and spacious

title: Best and cheapest
review: Our first time in Bangkok and our first time doing a train to the accommodation (we would catch a taxi ) it was easy to get to the city and a short walk to the accommodation

title: Cheap, Fast and Convenient
review: The best transportation options to reach downtown city Fast on time and very cheap Less than 100 baht per person from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Phaya Thai (the last station) It takes only 30 minutes Running from 600 am till 12 midnight

title: Convenient and reasonable priced.
review: A cheaper and convenient way to go into the city from airport Great that they have this service  One just need to take this train to Phaya Thai station and get off there and straightaway change to take BTS to anywhere of the city that can be reached by BTS that's it

title: Best way to reach the center
review: This is the cheapest way to go downtown from the international airport The system is very easy to understand

title: Fast and Effective Route to the Airport
review: Got on the BTS at Sukhumvit and transferred to ARL at its terminus in BKK  From hotel checkout on Soi 8 to airline checkin at airport was less than an hour compared with previous 25 hour  450 baht taxi ride Total cost 33 baht BTS 45 baht ARL Air con all the way

title: Excellent
review: It's easy accessible safe and reliable way of travelling from the airport into the city we only had to change on one station to get out next train to Phra Kanong  A must mode of transport in Bangkok especially if you don't want to miss your flight

title: Bangkok trains are great
review: MRT train takes you from airport to city center where it can interchange with BTS train  Clean reliable  air conditioned and well priced  Use the trains as much as as possible

title: Gets you from point A to point B!
review: The Airport Link is so helpful to get into town from the BKK airport but unless you’re staying close to the line it’s not always convenient   You can easily connect to the MRT at Makkasan to the BTS at Phaya Thai or to the Saen Saep canal taxi at Ramkhamhaeng or Makkasan   Train runs from 5 am to midnight every day The train is slow and only runs every 1015 minutes Make sure to use the helpful interactive timetable on SRTET's website to time your arrival appropriately and preview the cost of your commute

title: Cheap
review: The best way into Bangkok unless you have lots of luggage easy transfer to the other train lines so cheap runs every few minutes

title: Alternative Option to airport
review: That was great experience My friend guide me to go airport with BTS and link with Airport Rail Link It was faster and the cost is cheaper than taxi You don't need to worry for traffic in Bangkok I recommend you to try

title: fast, efficient and economical
review: Best way to get to the city from the Airport when not carrying heavy luggages Better than taking taxi as it is faster efficient safe and economical and the plus point is that they have friendly staff to guide you at the station

title: Efficient
review: THe Bangkok airport rail link is by far the easiest and most efficient way of getting from the airport to central Bangkok

title: The best way out!
review: The best way to get out of the airport at BKK is the airport rail link its cheap convenient and not crowded as the airport is the first stop and last stop from in and out of the city The Ac ran a bit warm on my trip but as i found outAC's run a bit warm everywhere in this country all in all its a good ride for the price you pay

title: Easy to find - follow the signs to the lower level in the airport
review: A cheap and convenient way to get to central Bangkok Check out the BTS map beforehand and plan your journey to your accommodation this will save you a taxi fare and loads of hassle

title: Efficient
review: Fast efficient and cost effective way to get from the airport into the city Much better than a taxi

title: what can I say. Great thing
review: always a wonderful experience Sometimes hard to get a seat ) overcrowded in the evening if you travel TO the airport So take first stop Phaya Thai to increase your chance of a seat )

title: Great
review: The best and the fastest way to go from the airport to your hotel Very good connected with other ways of public transportation Cheepclean and out of dirty roads

title: Great efficiency
review: Catch the train right to the airport nice and easy inexpensive gets you right into the airport no mucking around with idiot taxis

title: Highly convenient way to get to the airport and back
review: This is a highly efficient way of getting to the airport or tot he city from the airport for that matter The locals know it and it can get crowded as well For some reason the inbound trip costs less than the outbound from the city But at TBH 4500 there should be no complaining 25 minutes from Makassan tot he airport an the same timing back

title: Bangkok
review: Rail line from the airport is inexpensive clean and very easy to use It is 5 stops to the Makkasan station which costs 35 baht and where you can pick up the metro To catch the metro you will have to exit the station and follow the signs to the metro It is a very short walk and will take about 10 minutes  The metro can take you into central Bangkok

title: fast and cheap
review: This is a great way to get into Bangkok avoiding all the heavy trafficits very cheap and nice and air conditioned

title: AVOID  Bangkok TRAFFIC.  Use rail link
review: It is located in the lowest level of the airport When you pay you get a token This gets you into the Rail link Make sure you keep the token as you insert it to exit the station you exit It also connects to the BTS and under ground metro The will be no one to help with your luggage so it is fine if you wear a backpack and have one rolling suitcase I take it into the main area of town and then get a taxi when I get off and go to my hotel Saves money and is very fast No sitting in Bangkok traffic

title: Great addition to this great city
review: No more waiting in the line in the heat waiting for a taxi or dealing with the crazy traffic  I've been to Bangkok more than 10 times and the journey from airport to city has taken anything from 30mins  To  2 hrs  This train is clean fast and easy to use

title: Easy Transportation Though Crowded at Rush Hour
review: We took this from the airport to get closer to our hotel near Khao San Road (we took a taxi from the Phaya Thai stop) It was rush hour so it filled up quickly Luckily we were at the front of the line from boarding so we got seats

title: Fast and cheap
review: If you go to the town from airport You can reach the town through the interchange of MRT or BTS around 40 mins  The fee must cheaper than taxi or rental car It is very economy

title: Excellent, I was sceptical at first but after using it, it beats a taxi or limo.
review: So easy to get to and from the airport All signs are visible so you can't get lost I travelled from there from the Sky Train Ticket  kiosk are in Thai as well as English So cheap around about $1 USD

title: Efficient
review: Very efficient Fine at rush hour with large cases and did not feel this was a problem for anyone at all to be honest despite some of the reviews that advised caution Get a ticket from the machine and it is very clear from the signs on the platforms which one to get

title: Fast, efficient and cheap
review: Easy and cheap (45 Baht) transfer from the city to the airport Takes about 30 minutes from Phayathai and is very easy to use Trains are clean smooth and quiet Much quicker easier and cheaper than a taxi

title: Best way to get to and off the airport
review: The rail link is a great advantage to get to the city i always use it as compare to other options as its cheap Remember your normal BTS card wont work at this so you have to get their own ticket

title: Quietest train I've ever ridden
review: If somebody blindfolded you and asked you when the train began to move you might as well guess This very clean train stealthily glides along the rails and shows you a wide spectrum of Bangkok lifestyles from above Once you switch to the other trains though your ride gets squeakier

title: Airport link
review: If you don't want to take taxi to or From airport use the airport link Cost cant remember I think was 70 bht Takes you to phaya thai station from where you can change to bts line

title: Vacation
review: Great hotel in Thailand would tell everyone about this hotel and my experience Lots to see and do in amazing Thailand

title: Very easy but know you way first before you go
review: There are no directions just major stops  You can link to the metro train or sky train but need to know where you are going (maps are not readily provided)  You can do this online before your trip  To get to the skytrain  go to the end of the line  then connect with the skytrain to your destination  Workers typically do not speak english so good to map out your trip ahead of time I have an international dat plan on my phone and it worked great

title: Easy way to get to the airport
review: The ARL is definitely the faster way to get to the airport You need to alight at BTS Phaya Thai and follow the signages to the ARL The trip from BTS Phaya Thai costed me THB 47 The journey took about 25 min to reach Suvarnabhumi Airport

title: It couldn't be easier
review: I have only just used this service & will for ever use it from now on When I visit Bangkok The service was faster than a cab  Much cheaper & a great experience plus you have a lovely view of the surrounding area I recommend you try it BTW announcements for each stop are in English also

title: easy and efficient
review: Save your Baht for other taxi rides use this to connect to the metro Suggest not bringing lots of luggage during high traffic times like after work however as so many people need to travel on the metro

title: Cheap and fast transportation
review: Airlink is a great option to reach your hotel Bangkok sees a crowded rush hour traffic and hence during those times airlink comes in as a time saver

title: fast ride towards city centre
review: fast and easy access ride to and from Bangkok city centre with various stops for Bangkok sky train connectivity

title: Cheap and efficient
review: The train from Bangkok international airport to the city is just perfect Really cheap 35bath (just little more then 1au$)  Use it don't take the cab they are expensive

title: save time and safe
review: During the rush hours or heavy traffic in town or comfortable times you can go to airport and catch the flight in time by this way about 4045 minutes from Phayathai station to airport with very cheap fee Options for 1 way and round trip The trains are very comfortable clean and schedule is relaible On the way from airport to Phayathai station you can connect by sky trains or  public cars buses to other places

title: Thanks to the honest Airport staffs
review: Being absent minded i left my wallet after making payment which i could not even remember where Most likely the AIS counter When waiting for the train to the airport the security staff picked me up to go to the security station There my wallet was waiting for me After taking picture of the handover for their record purposes they greeted me friendlily I felt so embarassed but impressed by their honestly Apparently they tracked me down by searching my face in the CCTV to match that of my driver's licence in my wallet The best credit for the security staffs and the people of Thailand for this My gratitude from the bottom of my heart

title: Great!
review: Probably the best way to get from Bangkok's airport to centrefor just 45 baht (£1) you can be within 20 minutes in the centre if the townPhaya Thai area

title: Very Handy for avoiding traffic
review: We stayed in the Sukosol Hotel which is across the road from Phaya Thai Station so on the day of our departure it was a case of walking about 300 metres to the Station and catching one of the frequent shuttle trains to the airport Very cheap compared to taxi and no problems with traffic jams etc

title: fastest way from and to the airport
review: fastest way from and to the airport within very clean spacious wagons  passing each traffic jam  and fully air conditioned (best to wear light pullover) excellent description of fares  and very helpful staff

title: Quick and inexpensive way to get donwtown
review: 30min to get downtown Way faster than a taxi Easy connections to the underground or the sky train Air conditioned No traffic A fraction of the cost of a taxi I had a 6hrs stopover could have never made it into town and back by taxi With the train I managed 2 full hours of sightseeing

title: Best option
review: I've got gridlocked on my way to BKK airport (around 6 pm) and the Airport Rail Link saved my skin I've made in time and caught  my flight

title: Best way to travel to Airport
review: Easiest way to travel to Airport My Friend has to catch a Flight on Friday which is the busiest day for Bangkok due to weekend and heavy traffic He took this train to Airport which takes only 40  50 mins

title: Convenient Transportation to city
review: The Airport Link is very convenient to reach Bangkok City Center The cost is very cheap and you depart from the Suvarnaburmi Airport There is a departure every 1015min from my memory and only takes around 30min to reach Bangkok Center It's convenient if you don't have heavy and huge luggage but if your hotel is near one of the train station it may worth to go by train It is a shame that the Express Link does not operate although the infrastructure is created

title: beat the traffic
review: It was my quick and easy way to get to the airport and back to the city  It sure is a good way to beat the traffic

title: Perfect connection from/to international airport
review: If you are not a big group of people airport link is the most quick and convenient transport between central Bangkok and international airport For a big group maybe a minibus is more convenient but certainly not quicker

title: Very good option for Airport transportation.
review: This is the second time I use the Airport Rail Link  As I had a little baggage  I made the connection Airport Rail LinkBTS (Sky Train) and arrived in Silom area in just 45 minutes spending less than 5 dollars

title: Efficient
review: Efficient and easy way to get from the airport to the centre where you can easily inter change for the metro The ticket machines at the stations available in different languages it's very easy to use Overall a great way to start my journey through SAE

title: Very useful
review: Saved me lots of money So easy to connect to the rail link and ticket only 45 baht (from Phaya Tai station) It is quite fast as well Wouldn't ever think of taking taxi to the airport

title: Convenient
review: A safe cheap and convenient transportation to and fro from the airport to town and vice versa If you stay near where the rail link is it will be much much easier to move around to all places when one needed to change from BTS station and the Mrt station

title: Quick an inexpensive
review: No better way to get to and from the airport Would always choose ARL over a taxi or Uber or Grab Nothing more to say

title: Great way to reach the city
review: Cheaper and easier way to reach your destination in the city as it easily beats the traffic and it is cheap

title: Travel
review: Quick and easy travel too and from the airport Maps are easy to follow Cheaper than getting a taxi into the main part of Bangkok

title: Cheap Public Transport Transfer
review: Get rid off traffic congestionu can pay 45 baht only from airport to last station Phaya Thai its an interconnect station with BTS

title: Picked up 2 people at the airport
review: I found this to be good and reliable it takes 20 to 30 minutes depending on the time you go from beginning to AirportThe Air link was quick reliable and affordable I will definitely be using it again Lord willing
country: Puerto Viejo de Talamanca, Costa Rica

title: Very easy to use
review: train station in basement  just follows signs  Lots of ticket machines and click on the language Choose the station you want to get off and it will tell how money you need to insert Final station is phaya Thai  From where you can get BTS train to nearest station near your hotel It's all very simple and nothing to worry about also very cheap  You don't need taxis

title: Cheap, fast and convenient
review: It cost me only 40 baht to travel from the city to the airport in 30mins Not really crowded when I travelled as it was Sunday It's way better than taking a metered taxi that will cost you around 400500 baht and will take u about an hour of travel

title: Brilliant. Ignore the taxi.
review: Once you work out how to connect the ARL with the MRT & BTS if needed you can get just about anywhere in Bangkok  The ARL gets crowded but it's way better than being stuck in Bangkok's notorious traffic  Cheap clean on time and appreciated

title: Beats traffice anytime!
review: Took the train from National Stadium BTS You have to change stations as this is not part of the BTS but a separate Airport Rail Link which runs for about 30 minutes up to the Airport  Great way to beat the traffic and the connecting tunnel is very clean and convenient

title: Cheapest and the Fastest link to Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: Easiest fastest and the cheapest way to reach the city centre from the Airport Has couple of interconnectivity points to the other modes of transport (Makkasan station links to MRT Phetcha Buri and Phaya Thai station links to the BTS SkyTrain) Costs anywhere between 1545 baht a person

title: Best Way to Downtown
review: Very fast and cheap way to travel from the airport to the city The rides takes only 18minutes The taxi takes arround 4070minutes because the enormous traffic jams in Bangkok The price is very cheap and of course is aircon in the hole train Departure every 14minutes At Makkasan Station is direct link to MRT or BTS

title: Convenient and easy
review: First visit to Bangkok Got on train from Suvarnabhumi Got off at Playa Thai where is connected to BTS Worked like a charm Cost was a fraction of taxi fare as we learnt when we took taxi back from hotel at end of trip [had bahts left over burning hole in pocket]

title: Easy and convenient.
review: The best way to get around Bangkok Very easy and cheap to use There are two main lines you get a ticket from a machine or a staffed booth and hop on There is light security at every station which is comforting

title: Great way to get about
review: Great way to get about the city is to use the amazing rail network Cheap enough and so quick Very clean and safe form of transport Highly recommend

title: Airport Rail link is the cheapest option to go the center!!
review: It definitely is Only 45 baht and you can have a comfy aircon ride to the center of Bangkok You can pay either by coins or paper money

title: best option to get to the airport
review: big city mostly have a bad traffic jam and a quite far airport from the city but by this ARL all becomes easier it takes only 20 mins to get to the airport

title: Easy way to get to the airport and back
review: I took the train several times now to get to the Airport and back You change from the BTS at Phaya Thai to the Aiport Rail link and the signs will lead you directly there 45 baht for the way to the airport and it takes you around 30 minutes Pretty convenient since you will arrive directly inside of the airport

title: The Best way to travel.
review: As long as I arrive at BKK between 0700 and 2200 this is the way I always get to (and from) my hotel No hassle just follow the signs buy a token and get on the train to Phaya Thai There I change to the BTS and quite independent of traffic I will be in my hotel on Sukhumvit Soi 29 within an hour at a cost of well under 100 Baht  The only downside is getting luggage from the Airport Rail Link to the BTS  there are some steps in the way Just wonder why escalators were not installed at this most significant junction

title: The best way to go to and leave the airport.
review: Very convenient Located on the basement of the airport No need to take a taxi Just take the ARL especially if you are a backpacker

title: Fast, clean and cool.
review: The best way to get into Bangkok from the airport easy to use and cool even when busy Most taxi and tuctuc drivers will take you via their friends to get measured for a suit you don't want some even turned off their engine whilst they tried to talk us into getting out and into a shop they had just diverted us too Also be aware of helpful strangers telling you that attractions or the place you are going to is closed so they can divert you to another placein a tuctuc or taxi they have parked around the corner Let the train take the strain although please note that none of the rail links go into the heart of the old city Most hotels seem to be outside anyway so it shouldn't matter The airport is quite some way away from the centre of Bangkok so don't be worried if you still haven't arrived after 20 minutes just enjoy the AC

title: Easy and cheap.
review: Very cheap easy and fast way to central Bangkok Much faster than taxa Is closed fra 0000 to 0600 am

title: All too easy.
review: This is just such a wonderful cheap way of getting to the city and all that is Bangkok all you need to do is ask in English at the terminal

title: Amazing for budget travellers
review: The airport rail has connectivity from the airport and also the its very reasonable considering the high charges charged by the taxis

title: Nice airport, full of thailand culture
review: Nice and clean Only take 375 Baht to get there via Uber And only take you 30min if you take train  There is a 24hour food court in 1F called Magic Food and the food there is very cheap and unexpectedly delicious Please get there and take a meal before you pass through the passport control Better not to have your meal after the passport control  standard airport price inside  Also got a Family Mart there and the price is reasonable

title: Great if you only have little luggage.
review: It is cheap and quick and connects with MRT at Makkasan and BTS at MRT at Phaya Thai Buy a tickettoken and activate it when entering and have it ready when leaving

title: SO So convinient
review: Straight from the airport to downtown Bangkok  wish all cities were this well organized  As first timers we were a bit lost but the staff made it easier  I guess we weren't the first clueless travelers )

title: Awesome
review: Lovely experience  Worth a try  Wanted to do try something different rather taking a taxi Lived up to its reputation

title: Excellent Connectivity
review: If you ever come to Bangkok  then Airpot rail link is the best way to connect from the city  You can take a airpot rail link from 6am till midnight  The rail link starts from airpot at 6 am to Phaya thai and the last rail link to airpot is at 1130pm from phaya thai   Thailand infrastruture is good when the topic comes about connectivity

title: Best way to get to the airport
review: The airport rail link is a great way to get from central Bangkok to the airport It is quiet a busy train and is used by the locals for other stations so sometimes a little bit squeezy if you have a bit of luggage It is cheap around 45B per person or almost $2aud but is so much better than sitting in the traffic It takes around 20mins Would never taxi to or from the airport again

title: Perfect way to go downtown.
review: Perfect way to go downtown  Perfect way to go downtown from the Suvarnabhumi Airport  It links directly with the BTS sky train station Phaya Thai where you can go in all directions and the best part would be if you have a hotel hostel guesthouse in the near of one of the stations it's the perfect way to travel in Bangkok

title: Fastest transportation to reach in middle of Bangkok
review: After reaching Suwarnabhumi airport at 3rd floor take "City LinksAirport Rail Link" from basement You can reach Ratchaprarop in 35 minutes by spending 40THB From Makasan station of Airport Rail Link you can catch city link which will take you to Sukhumvit

title: Getting into Bangkok fast and easy
review: As you arrive at Bangkok Suvarnabhumi International Airport (BKK) you will be faced with several options of transportation into the city Limo services will start to ask for your business as early as the baggage pickup area and in the Arrival Hall One floor under the arrival hall is the taxi departure line As in most cities you want to make the ride on the taxi meter and do not negotiate a price The basement of the airport holds the best option for getting in the city the Airport Rail Link Take the elevator down and follow the signs    It is expected that you will have luggage to manage but reason needs to come into play One large piece with a carryon and personal bag is about all one adult can manage on the train People in Bangkok have learned to take the Airport Link for normal transportation but understand the purpose is to accommodate airport traffic It can be crowded so try to sit near a door to make getting off easier     The Air link connects with the BTS Skytrain and the MRT subway system Generally you only want to have a carryon bag on these two systems as they are for general population transportation If it is early in the morning or late at night then a larger bag can be taken     Obviously I use the Airport Rail Link often when traveling from the city to the airport A little common sense makes it a very useful tool

title: Cheap & fast
review: If you're traveling light and are less than a party of 3 This is definitely the way to get into the city  Its cheap and you don't have to deal with Bangkok traffic

title: Good acces accros the city
review: Easy fast and cheap By times overcrowded at peak hours but still the wasiest way of transportation

title: Very easy
review: Cheap and first  So convinced to go airport  Take from Paya thai station is take 15 m to airport  Price cost less than taxi

title: Fastest and cheapest way
review: if you don't have a lots of luggage it is the best way to go to heart of BKK it will cost you 45 bhat and 20 min

title: Easy transport to heart of bangkok.
review: This is the easiest way to get to the heart of bangkok  The fare is reasonable and you don't have to go thru the infamous traffic jam Station is clean and very convenient

title: Quick way from airport
review: If you have the taxi drivers whose condition and skills you always can´t be sure of this is cheaper and more comfortable way to travel At airport just walk downstairs buy ticket form the machine and go

title: NO traffic Jams!
review: NO Thai skills beyond SawadeeKrab no guide little time spent in Bangkok and little money left at the end of our trip  I needed to make it back to Silom Soi 18 to pick up my tailored suit on our last night in Thailand  NO problem  we easily figured out how to purchase tokens on the kiosk at the airport station and were downtown in 30 minutes for 90 Baht (Less than $3)  no waiting in rush hour traffic no worries about car fare drivers and meters the cars were clean and not overly crowded I am only a fan of mass transit in VERY large cities they don't work everywhere (not enough riders easier to drive) but in Bangkok esp during a rain storm just take the train  NOTE We got on at the airport station  I liked how the guards sweptinspected the cars at the end of the prior run before we all got on  I have never felt safer and more civilized on any form of public transport

title: Best way for a light solo traveller to get into bkk
review: If you have a few people or too much luggage a taxi might be a better deal For a light solo person the train is the way to go Just a small learning curve and you can get around BKK easily and cheaply for the rest of your visit The rail link merges with the subway which merges with skytrain It sounds complicated but in reality isn't that bad Use it you won't regret it

title: So practical
review: Extremely clean and easy to figure out Used it to and from the airport without any trouble Nice veiws of the city too

title: best way to reach the city
review: depend on what time you arrive at the airport bangkok is a very busy city  the airport rail takes between 30 to 40 minutes to reach the center and then you can catch the btw to go to your final destination price is 45 bath

title: Fast and economical
review: I have been several times to Bangkok airport is fasteconomical comfortable and cleanit runs every 10 minutes at a cost of 45 Bhat almost $200 US dollars per person for trip Then Take taxi from there to your hotelit is better than taking a direct taxi from the airport It is  The direct train is not available  but the regular train has only 6 very fast dropsit is more convenientfaster and more economical

title: Very convenient link to central Bangkok
review: Highly recommended to anyone travelling to and from Suvarnabhumi Airport At 45 baht per person per trip you avoid the traffic jams on the road if you arrive or depart evening time However the trains at peak hours are very crowded so may be difficult to manage if you have a lot of luggage

title: Great
review: Great This was one of the best train i ever traveled in my life Hope to ride again in the near future

title: Good for time management
review: As Bangkok traffic is so unpredictable taking airport rail link is the best choice in getting to the airport on time

title: cheap and easy
review: Easy to get to from the sky train and a short journey to the airport I suggest this to anyone thinking about getting a taxi this will save time and money not to mention the 2 toll fees you have to pay on top of your taxi fare From the centre of Bangkok I paid a total of 70 Thai Baht and the taxi cost me nearly 400 Baht

title: Convenient
review: A milestone in Bangkok's infrastructure Reaching airport gets challenging in rush hours If you have minimum luggage this airport rail link is very helpful to escape Bangkok's crazy traffic congestion However dragging too much or heavy articles of luggage on train is not practical The major plus point is it takes you to the airport within minutes It's comfortable clean and safe For a single person it's very economical Majority of Thais are very courteous and offer their own space to you to sit if they see a foreigner standing

title: Fast, punctual, clean and comfortable
review: It's the fastest way to reach the Suwarnabhoomi airport May not be cheap compared with taxi but definitely lot faster than any road transportation Available till late night and safe to travel alone too

title: My First Time But Not My Last
review: I have been to Bangkok many times and always taken a taxi from the airport Due to the time I arrived which was rush hour I thought I would give the train a go The best decision I made I could clearly see the freeway traffic heading towards the city and it was heaving with cars I had to swap over to the BTS to get to where I wanted to go I think my trip was about 40 minutes which I have no doubt would have been 3 hours in a taxi Plus I didn't have to deal with the suicidal driving some of the taxi drivers subject you too Plus it was far cheaper than the taxi

title: Efficient way of getting to airport
review: The Skytrain and Airport Rail Link is the most cost efficient way of getting to the airport from Bangkok Make sure you do leave earlier though as peak times can affect the time you arrive at the airport (between 4pm and 7pm are the peak times Comfortable and cost efficient

title: Convenient
review: Comfy and convenient Makes me wish we also have one in the Philippines takes you to the airport from the city OR to the city from the airport in the most practical way Less hassle i should say fast and cheaper than a taxi cab

title: First metro in Bangkok
review: It was my first train in Bangkok is airport rail link which quickest way to go to city We have been this rail and good experience

title: Clean and efficient
review: Great way to get from the airport to the city The service is air conditioned and was clean and efficient

title: comfortable
review: Make my trip in Bangkok more easy and fast  Most of tourist attraction point can go by sky train  But in the rush hour quite busy and cloudy of people

title: Cheap and fast way from the airport to the city
review: Bangkok now has a train link to the city It links up with the skytrain to give you cheap fast connections Depending on where yoy are going you may need to buy two separate tickets and change trains even a few times Cost is low especially relative to taxi charges and the traffic that they need to overcome

title: Made it easy to get to any hotel!
review: Would definitely recommend as a cheaper and more scenic route than a taxi from the airport I would look up the closest train station near your hotel then go from there because this train links to all the other lines so if you don't have too much luggage it's usually easier to take the train then taxi to your hotel

title: Easy Ride
review: The Best ride you can get from Airport to Hotel in City center Bangkok A must have experience for every one

title: Fast way to get into town
review: This was great hopped on at the airport and off at the end then got a train to Central World Plaza this place is so big and there are 3 different buildings to get through There is all sorts here to do and see Madame Tussaud's and the Sea world are here also and a huge cinema Lots of shopping and eating outlets also great for filling in long lay overs at the airport It only takes about 20 min to get into town but be warned it takes longer to get back out and very overcrowded if it is peak hour it will amaze you how many people actually squeeze on at these times

title: value for money
review: Only the second time I have used itbut the easiest hassle free way to get to the airportmuch less than a taxi fare

title: Convenience and connectivity
review: Cheap and fast way to travel between Suvarnabhumi International Airport and the city(Phaya Thai Station connected to BTS Sukhumvit)

title: Time Saver
review: Take this train from airport to reach the City Center This is quite affordable mean of travelling and takes very less time to reach the city One can catch the train from The basement level of the Airport and can then get off at any of the stations in city

title: Suvarnabhumi
review: Cheap fast and reliable  My choice of transport to the airport Beats sitting in the rush our traffic wondering if you going to make it to your flight or not

title: Much faster and cheaper than a taxi
review: Super easy and fast transport into town possibly combined with a tuktuk if your destination is not close to a stop Just lookup before hand which stop you need to take to get close to your destination

title: Quick and easy
review: Quick cheap easy  sums it up really  The ticket machines take notes which is useful as most travellers would be unlikely to have coin to feed into the machine  buying the ticket was a quick easy process Gets you to Phaya Thai station (stop 8) in about 2025 minutes at which point you can then transfer to the BTS for connections onto the rest of Bangkok If I remember rightly stop 6 on the line was where you could connect into the Bangkok Metro also

title: Airport Link Train - Bangkok
review: This Airport Link Train is really cost saver for solitary traveler the ticket price is 40 BHAT and well maintained To reach to PRATUNAM MARKET  get down at MAKASAN station

title: The best way to get to the airport
review: The Airport Rail Link is definitly the cheapest and could also be the fastest way to go to and from the airport You will definitely not be caught in traffic It may get crowded during peak hour when everyone knocks off from work

title: Use it a lot
review: The train transportation (metro trains skytrain) in bkk is easy fast and secure Use it as my main source of transport

title: BKK-Airport Rail Link
review: A great way to save money and quickly get around town in this case zip out to the airport This system is one of the worlds best Convenient fast direct efficient

title: Quick, cheap and very easy
review: As long as you dont mind lots of people this is by far the easiest way into the city it takes about 30minutes to Phya Thai station which links with almost everwhere else

title: Fastest and the Cheapest way to reach the airport
review: Fastest and the Cheapest way to reach the airport if you are single and are not carrying much baggage It connects you to Bangkok in all directions if you are visiting

title: Convenient direct cheap transport to BKK
review: easy to find  easy to use  direct link to BKK city centre  air conditioned  comfy seating  go straight from arrivals down straight to station direct to BKK

title: Good
review: A great way to reach Bangkok downtown directly from airport in a short time then you can take the BTS to reach your hotel

title: Molly
review: Safetyfastgood takecare from staff and very comfortable Sure that u can go to your destination

title: frequent convenient and inexpensive
review: The airport rail was 45 Bhat one wayyou just can't beat that yes it can sometimes be crowded and a hassle with your bags if you travel heavy but usually faster frequently more comfortable (air conditioning) and always much cheaper than taxis or tuktuks

title: Airport Link
review: This is the special Metro service from Bangkok city to International Airport of Bangkok Suvarnbhumi Airport Much cheaper than Taxi services in Bangkok Only drawback it is not in operation late night or early morning If you have flight to catch around 2 AM you will not be able to use the services operations hours are from 6 AM to 10 or 11 PM

title: Great for airport to near Victory Monument
review: 45 Baht for the entire one way trip You might book a hotel near the last stop and them be much closer to many tourist attractions

title: Amazing connectivity
review: Had arrived at rush hour at the airport was so easy to travel in city to makkasan and took a taxi back home in silom and took less than an hour

title: Fast
review: The best way to travel from the airport to the city Quick and quiet Well marked Easy on and off Clean

title: Cheap and easy
review: The most convenient and cheap way to go to town from and to the airport and avoid the crazy traffic  Clean train   air conditioned  since it is in service I never used another transportation and never had any trouble with it

title: A great service!
review: Affordable and fast The easiest way to get from BKK to downtown Closes at midnight It's very safe and you can use this to easily connect to the other rail lines

title: Quick and Inexpensive. Skip the Taxi
review: Especially if you only have carry on items don't think about an airport taxi as you will easily pay 600 BHT or more The Airport Rail Link City Line is inexpensive (45 BHT to end of line Phayathai station ) Simply get a token at the entrance from an automatic dispenser or buy the ticket from the ticket booth The train is airconditioned and will make six or so stops along the way before reaching Phayathai Here you can exit and take a taxi which will be much cheaper since you are already in the city As a second option you can board the MTS train at the Phaya Thai station as well

title: Great value, clean, fast and efficient
review: I found this service fabulous and recommend it as a great way to get to and from the airport into central Bangkok Very good

title: Why would anyone take a taxi to the airport"
review: We choose a hotel to be close to a station A taxi ride to the airport can cost you an arm and a leg and lots of time in traffic The link is less than a dollar and gets you to the airport in half an hour at most The train is airconditioned and clean What is not to like

title: FAST AND SAFE
review: Highly reccomended  better than a private car  no strees  no problem  no traffic  no delay  cheap

title: Airport city link for less than a quid!
review: 39 bahtabout 80p to get into the city at the first BTR interchange  Remarkable value  Fast Reliable Airconditioned  Definitely worth using

title: Only way to to and from airport
review: This is a faster service to and from airport No need to take a taxi and sit in traffic  Very good service from airport to downtown 6 stops takes 30mins 6am to midnight  Very clean

title: Easy travel
review: 35 Baht for one way ticket Taxi costs around 300 Baht to city center If you travel alone or as a couple you can easily use it

title: Getting to the city was a breeze
review: Getting to the city was a breeze It pays to spend five minutes familiarising with the routes and you don't have to get caught in a jam on the road

title: Excellent, Avoid the traffic, get the train
review: I normally take taxis when abroad for the ease and convenience However decided to take the train as recommended by a friend Advantages Easy to use and figure out how to by a ticket Easy to navigate  well sign posted Cheap No ques Avoid grid locked roads  Cons None

title: Great way to get around.
review: The airport rail link is a fast and easy way to get tofrom the city The rail seems to always be running on schedule so you don't have to worry about delays It is also very affordable and clean making it a great alternative to taxis

title: So much better than using taxis!
review: I stay in Pratunam area within 5 minutes walk of Ratchaprarop Station and always take the train to Suvanabhumi Airport It is so cheap and much faster Very easy system to use just buy a token at boarding station to enter and exit through the turnstiles There are always staff there to help if you get confused

title: Positive impression
review: Excellent connections in either way Clean and fast Very good service and cheap Thanks of the many airport links reaching Suvanaphumi is very easy and convenient

title: cheap, easy, direction quite clear
review: it is very cheap just thb45 from the bts station to the airport there are staff to help you to buy tkt in the station the direction is quite clear but just you have to take lift to the departure floor after you come out of the rail link

title: Escellent
review: First time I used the airport link train Was easy and cheap Only thing I would suggest is that you time your trip away from peak hours it gets very crowded

title: easy to use
review: All you have to do is work find someone who speaks at least a little English to help you and you will be fine to find your destination

title: Awesome
review: Faboulus experience of my life in Bangkok with the family they also love  the ride & enjoyed a lot & entire look is also stunning

title: Airport Breaze
review: I've use the link many times now they have stopped the express for reasons unknown but the regular train is still pretty fast The train will get very congested once it leaves the airport the seats are not very comfortable but it olny costs 45 baht I go to the end of the line  Phaya Thai where you can switch to the BTS which takes me to my stop Ari just a few stations away Wish they had more eculators going down not just up when traveling with suitcases it can be a bit difficult

title: A very easy way to get quickly to and from the airport
review: You can either take a traditional metro train (skytrain) with 10 or stops or take the express from downtown to the airport without stops Either way is inexpensive and most of all quick On our way back home we stayed at an airport hotel (12 hour layover) and used the skytrain to get into town and back cheaply and with ease

title: Great way to go the city center of Bangkok
review: If you arrive between 6am to midnight then definitely take the Airport Rail Link  It costs 45 baht and takes you to the center in 30 minutes

title: Cheap and very convenient to the airport
review: I usually take a taxi from airport to my hotel But while I was in Bangkok I had to go to the airport from my hotel and asked the hotel staff if train is available to the airport They told me there and said it is very convenient Per their advice I tried the train to the airport and it is true that it is very convenient I took the sky train from Sukumvit road and then interchanged to the airport train some where near National Stadium The price is very cheap compared to taxi Therefore if you don't have many luggages I suggest the train from and to airport

title: Easy and cheap
review: Very easy way to get into Bangkok bit of a walk from the arrivals lounge but good to get the blood flowing in the legs again after a long flight cost is cheap and trains are clean and tidy

title: Much convenience
review: Of course this means of transportation provides much convenience for us as visitors to Bangkok's city mainly to facilitate access to the airport quickly and cheaply

title: Take this, don't bother with a taxi!
review: Taxi wanted $400 baht to get into city this was $70 baht to the exact same location in same time Clean and convenient best way into the city

title: Cheap and efficient
review: The fast train has stopped running due to loss making but the commuter train is still running at B45 per trip and take you to the city within 35 mins  If you have small luggage and can manage a couple of staircases this is an excellent choice  Taxi fare for the same journey can easily cost you B500

title: Airport rail link
review: best way to move from the airport to bangkok and it costs even less than taxi or bus considering also that your avoid the huge traffic of bangkok

title: Brilliant
review: Clean fast way to travel takes you right into the city would recommend to take the sky train rather then taxis you pay for your trip up front and enough room for luggage

title: I like it
review: Fist time really scare but again I like it  colder inside very comfortable  better than taxi tuc tuc  don't worry try and u will like it

title: Excellent
review: was good and cheaper then get a taxi along there way to the airport i could say it even better because is kind of fast and time schedule time by time i always be on time at the airport no worry about traffic jam

title: Airport Express Rail
review: tried many times only if you are travelling without a huge luggage otherwise advisable to take cab directly from airport   to take the train service if you arrive around office hours rush back time as being stuck in majorlong traffic jam is no joke at all

title: Quickest way to get to the city
review: The reason I took this Rail Link from the airport to reach the hotel was because I had a meeting lined up within an hour of landing in Bangkok It served it's purpose very well I must say Though I had to change a line but this is the quickest way to get to the city

title: frequent
review: very frequent although busy during morning rush hour very cheap and faster than taxi's on the ground

title: No Fuss - Simple and Direct
review: We decided to forgo an expensive (relatively speaking) taxi or airport transfer and to take the train From landing and collecting our bags it was simple to stroll down to the trains and catch one (35 baht per person)  we transferred at Petchaburi to catch the Metro (as our hotel was close to a metro station) Nice and easy All signs are in English and in Thai  no problems at all and this was our first time in Bangkok And so much better than sitting in Bangkok traffic

title: Fast, clean, efficient, cheap transport into the city.
review: Only 150 Baht and 20 mins from the airport to the city  A great option during peak hour travel times to avoid traffic congestion  Warning travel light or be prepared to lug your suitcase updown stairs to change to the city BTS line or taxi to your hotel  Ideal if you're staying in the Phaya Thai area

title: Perfect way to go city centre!
review: I go to Bangkok often and always take the train so cheap and so much faster (especially rush hour)

title: So easy
review: Transfer to hotel in Fortune city in around 45 minutes from collecting luggage and cost less than £2  Clear signage throughout the airport easily directs you to the ticket office Signs and route maps in Thai and English easy to follow

title: Never take a taxi again
review: The Airport rail link is brilliant 40 baht to the city center in a clean super fast train For me traveling to the second last stop was 35 min and then I just had a short 400m walk to the hotle On our return having a few more bags we took a taxi from the hotel to the station which is also not a problem as taxies take all fair regardless of how short it is On previous trip I have spent 500600 baht for a taxi from the airport that took at least an hour The Airport Rail is the the way to go hands down

title: Airport rail shuttle.
review: Level B of airport  Excellent  45 bhat per adult to centre of city  Easy to use Staff were very helpful told them our hotel and they showed us where to get to MUCH cheaper than taxi (airport is a long way from city center)

title: Fast, convenient & cheap
review: I suppose it's the most convenient and cheapest way to transport from the airport to the city centre It's also easy to find the way to the airport rail link too  When we travelled to Bankok last year we stayed in Nonthaburi with our friend who is working there From the airport we take airport rail link then catch a taxi to come to her house The staff at the railway station were very helpful and friendly They try to catch a taxi for us (as we travelled in a group of five then not many driver agreed to take all of us) and show us the hotline number to inform in case the driver would be overcharging

title: Fast, convenient, and cheap
review: Much better than taking a taxi No more haggling with unreliable drivers or being stuck in traffic Definitely a great upgrade Doesn't run 247 so you should check your flight times

title: Accessible and reliable
review: I was in transit for 7 hrs and took the airoort rail link to the city Took me around 40mins to reach Terminal 21 mall in Sukhumvit This link is the best and fastest access from Suvarnabhumi airport to the city center Alighted at Makkasan and transferred to BTS going to Sukhumvit from Phetchaburi If it's your first time in BKK this link is highly recommended Cheap and safe too

title: Fast and Cheap
review: I always take the airport link from BKK to Phaya Thai station thereafter change to BTS to the city It beats the traffic jam and takes only 30min excluding waiting time Moreover it is only 45 baht However on my return journey to airport I noted there is no escalator at Phaya Thai BTS station I hence have to carry my heavy luggage down the stairs

title: Impressive
review: Had my first ride during my Mac 2015 visit to the airport Smooth quite ride Had the pleasure to discover that there are many beautiful mosques along the track  Recently I tried to take the express train from airport to Makkasan But the express service was suspended indefinitely

title: great ride
review: We used the  train about 4 times We took a  flight from Bangkok to Chiang Mai and to just go for a ride and check the city out The train was always clean safe comfortable and on time We rode from the our hotel which was in the shopping or stop A7 to the airport cost if I remember about 40 baht Well worth the cost

title: Transportation
review: Very good transportation from the airport to bangkok centre and with a standard price  after that it's bargain time

title: Just 45THb
review: Best way to get at Airport area only 45THB from city center  nothing cheaper and better you can found  fastest way of travel in city like bangkok

title: single traveler!
review: it is speedy way to transfer from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Bangkok but if you have more than 1 baggage maybe you have problem with movement

title: Most reliable way from airport-city
review: During rush hour this is the only mode of transportation you should consider getting into the city A taxi ride from the airport during rush hour can easily run over 2 hours

title: Really quick & easy travel into the city centre
review: Easy cheap travel into the city centre no hassling with the taxi drivers and super quick especially if you are staying anywhere near Makkasan or Phaya Thai

title: I dont like taxis
review: so this is just a dream  and such comfort all the way to the airport  just great   I would say the seats are a little uncomfortable

title: faster
review: To airport to playa thai  cheap and faster better take  airport rail link if u know exxactly where you go

title: Great way to get from Suvarnabhumi airport into the centre of Bangkok
review: Quick service and much cheaper than taxis which can be very slow due to traffic  but you may need a taxi when you get into the centre of Bangkok

title: Quick and clean
review: No need for taxis Just take the Train directly to town and then get a taxi to yout hotel or simply take te BTS Allways clean and on time

title: Great way to get from the airport
review: Great way to get from the airport to the city  I went to Koh San Road and it saved me lots of money in cab fares The train doesn't go to Koh San road but it will get you half way so you can then hop in a taxi and save yourself some money Or ask one of the people who work there to send you in the direction of the free bus that takes you to the palace just round the corner from the koh san area

title: Airport Rail Link
review: Easy to get there It is simple to purchase of the tickets Accurate fast airconditioned The best way to get in or out of the city

title: Efficient fast and cheap
review: It takes about 25 minutes to get to the cityif there are more than two people travelling it is cheaper to take cab There is a long walk between the the link and the BTS If you have heavy luggage and you have problems with your back or knees take a taxi They are cheap an average of 350 to 400 Bhat

title: Quick and Cheap
review: This is the best way into Bangkok Leave the other travellers waiting for a taxi at the airport take the train to Phaya Thai  which is the last stop Easy swap here to many train stops  Either then catch a taxi from Phaya  Thai or the closest station to where you are going Faster  cheaper and more interesting

title: Best Way to Commute Between Bangkok City Centre and Bangkok International Airport
review: Airport link train is the best way to commute Between Bangkok City Centre and Bangkok International Airport (Suvarnabhumi Airport) if you want to avoid traffic and tout taxi drivers The Airport link train station is conveniently located at the level B2 of the arrival hall of Bangkok International Airport Airport link train runs from 6AM to midnight Using this train you can come to Phaya Thai Station (in 25 minutes) and then can transfer to any Sky train (within the Phaya Thai Station) to go to the city centre (I mean Chong Nonsi or Bangkok Station) in 15 to 25 minutes Airport link trains and Sky Trains are modern  safe clean and spacious to carry luggage Airport to Phaya Thai Station costs only 42 THB Phaya Thai to Chong Nonsi Station costs 31 THB Tickets are sold in vending machines in every station On the vending machine ticket price for each destination station is clearly specified Customer service booths in every station help to convert cash to coin

title: Quick and efficient
review: If you are travelling light it is the best method of transport between downtown and the airport It's relatively cheap and quick rather than be in trafficIf you have heavy luggage connecting to the BTS (skytrain) is a little bit hard as there are not escalators or lifts at many of the stations to get to and from the platforms

title: Great for Airport to town, but if alone
review: Its good if you are travelling alone and without luggage and want to save some buck just take a cab if you are with three people would almost cost the same if your hotel or house is not near the station

title: easy to town
review: i like when i come Bangkok to take the Airport Rail Link for going to hotel i choose my hotel near airport rail link og the BTS if stay at hotel near BTS it is just to change at Phaya Thai price is about 45 bath pr person and more fast than taxa if you stay in centre

title: Fast & clean
review: Loved the rail link so new & clean It's very well run & there's information so you know when the next train will arrive The token machines are so easy to use overall a good experience

title: Saves time from congested roads upon arrival
review: I take a train from Suvernbhoomi  airport which takes me right to the 'Indra Hotel' in Pratunam area The entire travel takes a few minutes Travelling by taxi although not very costly takes a longer time as sometimes the roads are congested

title: Easy and Convenient
review: This was easy cheap convenient and reliable I used this while getting to and from the airport several times while in Thailand and never had any issues

title: Excellent Service
review: Loved It Its always on time Helped us to avoid rush traffic But they need to spread the link more

title: Bit of a crush but the best way to get into the centre from the airport
review: Quick way to get to and from the airport with good links along the way to all parts of Bangkok Does get crowded at times and can be hard if you've got a lot of luggage but cheap and convenient

title: A great way to start your trip
review: If you don't have mountains of luggage and a fairly good at negotiating a map Then the airport rail link is the way to go It's cheap Fast and Convenient  No Bangkok traffic jams And a great way to see how large and beautiful Bangkok is  It's an exciting and overwhelming cite to see Bangkok for the first time and you can't see it any better then this especially for the price The train is clean and has Airconditioning   and there is always some one ready to help if youbare lost

title: Fast. Cheap. Easy way to get from the airport to Bangkok and vice versa.
review: We travelled most days on the airport skytrain whilst in Bangkok It's fast clean efficient safe and cheap and beats the congestion and pollution of going by road All the signage is in Thai and English It's definitely the way to go

title: very useful and convenient
review: for 45bahts it takes 20min to get downtown clean and fast you can even stop before the end of the line to get closer to your destination

title: Help desk staff were brilliant
review: Didn't know where we had to get off as staying in Sukhumvit but asked the ladies at the helpdesk and they were wonderful They marked on the map exactly where we needed to be  super The rail link was clean quick and not at all busy when we took it We arrived at 930am is and were in Sukhumvit  with a change of train by 1030 Would have struggled without the support from help desk

title: Essential to get into Bangkok within an hour
review: The train is excellent and saves a great deal of time over taxis in Bangkok It's easy to access from the airport and even travelling with luggage access via lifts and escalators are no issue The train takes about 30 minutes to get into Phaya Thai the end  of the line There are various interchanges to Metro and the Skytrain so I'd always advocate the use of this It's especially cheap at 35 Bhat per person

title: win time and use it
review: so easy to take the rail link who takes u till the center of BKK u escape the crazy traffic in BKK and cheaper than the taxi from airport    with taxi u have to make queue at airport with rail link  NO

title: Clean, cheap, quick, Air Conditioned German Technology
review: This is a German designed and built modern rail system The key word is "German quality"   efficient punctual cheap clean airconditioned runs ever 15 minutes On the other hand if you prefer some adventure and a bit of aggravation then hire a Tut Tut or a local Taxi for 10 times the price

title: Fast and inexpensive trip to the city center
review: Finding the Rail Link at the airport in Bangkok is easy and access is convenient  The trains run on a regular schedule and transport you from BKK airport to downtown in about 30 minutes  Connections to the BTS and MRT ( Skytrain and underground metro system respectively) are easy and well annotated  Easier than a taxi if you don't have lots of luggage  One suitcase and a carryon bag per person are probably all you want to try managing on the skytrain though

title: Best Transportation for Airport Transfer
review: You can get the Airport Train from the Phaya Thai Station Its connect with BTS line so you just get down at Phaya Thai BTS and move to Phaya Thai Airport Rail Link Station Its just on 12Mints walk  As per me this is the best mode of transportation in Bangkok as the road to airport is full of traffic in peak hours

title: Easiest way to get to and from the airport to the BTS system
review: If you are staying BTS station somewhere in Bangkok the easiest and probably the fastest way to get to and from the airport is via the rail link  It is also the least expensive option  The trains are clean modern and have sufficient room for people with luggage  The only negative is that it does not run 24 hours a day which means that if you are on a flight that is arriving or taking off from Midnight to morning it might not be such a good option

title: fast and economical
review: we got the airport train back to our hotel stop in Nana it took less than thirty minutes we flew over the traffic below us  cost approx $400 NZD each in total  brilliant

title: make it easy to arrive to airport suvarnapume and back
review: like to be connected easy and cheap only 45 bahton rush hourers very crauded3 statins in the city can be easly reach every place in city

title: excellent way to get out of the airport
review: excellent way to get out of the airport without having to hire a taxis to go thru the ever congested Bangkok road way There are 2 trains that serve the city and the airport The Airport Express is nonstop but less frequent as well as more expensive whereas the city link runs regularly less expensive Even with more stops along the way the time difference between the two is only a matter of minutes

title: Quick and easy to use
review: At the airport there are agentssecurity guards helping people buy their tickets at the selfserve ticket booths You put in your money and out comes a plastic coin for entry  hold on to it as you'll need it to leave the destination station The clean airconditioned train comes every 15 minutes and you're downtown in half an hour All the stops are announced and the maps also have the station names spelled out phonetically with the alphabet so it's quite easy to use

title: Express to the city
review: Great way to get to the city fast Easy to get to bottom of the airport and you are in town in about 2025 minutes as with cab sometimes can take more than an hour depending on traffic

title: bankok trip 1
review: we used the airport rail link to get to airport on time no traffic blocks and reaches airport without any delays loved the system

title: Good option for fast travel into city
review: Cabs are cheap but traffic even in the expressways can be a nightmare This option takes you into the central area to Praya Thai terminus where it's an very easy transfer to the skytrain network ( 45Baht from airport to city)

title: Clean and quiet
review: This was clean and quiet disturbingly not at all like the Bangkok I know I rode this and then the skytrain a lot and both were great additions to Bangkok

title: cheap and fast
review: i used it from phaya thai station to suvarna bhumi airport  only cost 45 baht compared with taxi meter when i was arrived from airport to phaya thai road  450 baht  but use it if you bring small or medium luggage and not too many luggage  because it is public transportation though

title: Best method of getting there
review: The Airport Link train is fast comfortable and cheap No matter how much baggage you are carrying it cannot be beaten I will be using this service every time

title: Fast and easy
