review: Just walk down and down  The the rail link at the lowest level  Take the local train  It's near as fast as the express and runs much more often    When you get off be sure your cab is charging you with the meter They all offer fixed prices that are 23 times the metered price  You may have to try several cabs

title: cheap and FAST
review: At 45 Baht from Phaya Thai Station this service is one of the best in Bangkok  From Morchit Bus Station take Bus 136 from Khao San Road take Bus 59  Trains run every 20 minutes and start at 6am until 12am

title: Cheap & fast
review: Its convenient to travel a fast & clean transportation   45bahts per pax & can reach most of the destination (major malls) its cost THB Bahts500 for taxi with toll fee

title: Great system
review: Great to use to and from the airport also around the city It's fast and very cheap If you can use it to get to your destination I would in most cases it would be much faster It's clean

title: Easy access
review: When flying out from BKK on a night flight I stored my bags at the airport (100 THBpiece) and took the train in to the city where I went shopping Simply and easy access

title: Easy to get by
review: I love this mode of travel No hassle No dislikes fares are cheap  Will use it again always on time and safe to travel

title: easy going
review: great to jump on for trips in the city clean cheap and well organized find your way around in all directions

title: Use it
review: 35 Baht from the airport to Makassan and 16 Baht on the metro to our hotel each is way better than the 800 Baht taxi or 1500 Baht limo services

title: so easy to use
review: It's so nice to be able to get off of your flight walk through the airport and boad the subway to whatever destination your going to Everything is well labeled and to make it more comfortable the trains have ac

title: Great
review: Definitely use if you want to save money and time It will take you into Bangkok from their you can take the BTS Subway taxi or whatever The system is clean safe and efficient Just don't talk loud You will notice that the train is quiet except for foreigners Only caveat the system only runs from 6 am to midnight If you get in after 11 pm take a taxi The airport is huge with 5 levels FIND THE TAXI LEVEL If you don't you're screwed A taxi will cost between $15  $20 US A limo $65 US I screwed up last time got in at 3 am hadn't slept for 45 hours and paid the price Train or taxi not limo

title: Nearest
review: The tour places are very nearest to the airport and the MTRSo its very easy to the travellers to enjoy it

title: Avoid the Traffic
review: I'll start off with the good points for the Airport Rail Link the two biggest positives are that you completely skip all the traffic (which depending on the time of day can be really bad) So this is bar far the quickest option at getting into central Bangkok   There are two types of Airport Rail Link the City Line & Express Line The City Line will stop at each station along the way (7 stops) and will take a little bit longer but is only 45 baht (one way) The Express Line goes straight from Phaya Thai to Suvarnabhumi Airport and is 90 baht (one way) The Express Line takes about 15 mins for a journey The other major difference about the two lines is that the Express Line has racks  spaces for luggage so if you are traveling with a lot of baggage then the Express Line would be more convenient  The frequency of these lines tends to change every few months so the best way to keep up to date on departure times in to download the Airport Rail Link app from App Store  Google Play Store  Getting into and around Bangkok from the Airport Rail Link is rather straight forward Get off at Phaya Thai and the BTS station (SkyTrain) is attached to the last stop of the Airport Rail link  about 5 mins walk If you need to get the MRT (metro) you can either get off at Makkasan (second last stop of Airport Rail Link  will need to take City Line to get off here) and walk to Phetchaburi MRT  although this isn't the most pleasant of walks particularly in BKK heat   There is a second option that's a bit longer to get on the MRT Get off at Phaya Thai and get on the BTS (SkyTrain) and take this to Asoke BTS stop  there is another MRT stop at this interchange station  Sukhumvit MRT stop This will only be convenient if it isn't busy on the SkyTrain (rush hour etc)  Which leads me into my negatives about the Airport Rail Link  it can be busy If you are taking the City Line and its busy and you have a lot of luggage  this isn't going to be a pleasant experience Likewise using the BTS (SkyTrain) to get tofrom the Airport Rail Link is awful when you have baggage and its rush hour

title: Smooth trip from city to airport and vice versa
review: More expensive than other ticket prices (about 90baht oneway) but its interior is different from the ordinary train around the city as its seats are facing each other and is more spacious It's really fast and comfortable and worldclass (August 2012)

title: JUST DO IT
review: The only way to travel to or from the Airport UNLESS you arrive after their opening hoursits the BEST and CHEAPEST way to and from the Airport

title: Cheap and efficient
review: Quick and easy way to get to Central Bangkok no need for a taxi or expensive transfers Good way to see the city on the way as well It may be a bit confusing though as there are quite a few branches and map is difficult to read sometimes

title: Cheap, easy and fast
review: Easy to find at the airport we took the cheap train into the city which was fast and cost around 35 baht Nothing to complain about and will use again

title: Easy and fast!!
review: We didn't use a tax between the hotel and airport this time Just used the airport rail link and changed BTS to get to the hotel where was near Nana station The rail Link is fantastic We got to the Bangkok airport around 5pm First plan was to catch a taxi to get to the hotel However considering the traffic in Bangkok Then decide to go PLAN B which worked so well

title: Great Value - Quick - Avoid Traffic
review: Depending on when you arrive into Bangkok consider the Rail Link  It's a great way to avoid ungodly traffice it's cheap and it gets you close to where you can then take a taxi or tuktuk to where you need to go  I always use it when leaving BKK

title: Easy transfer
review: For once we where traveling light so decided to try the airport link Very easy and cheap if your having a hotel close to BTS or MRT Might be a hassle in the rush our with your luggage etc

title: Fast and cheap
review: I used the Airport link to get from and to the airport It was so convenient I arrived early in the morning so it did get a little crowded but it's nothing I couldn't handle The trains are very quite and they are air conditioned which is welcome after walking in the humidity I also felt very safe no different than taking the metro in any other modern city It was also cheap It cost me 47 baht which is about $150 Would prefer this to a taxi and during rush hour it's faster than taxi as well

title: QUICK
review: This is the best way to airport much cheaper and avoid the Bangkok traffic jams or taxi scams  Brings you directly to the airport

title: the only way to travel airport to city
review: We caught the express to makassan from the terminal  45 baht I think  $150  by my watch about 18 mins non stop  I saw someone else review this service as slow but I think they may have caught the city line by mistake which also runs to airport stopping at every station whereas the express in nonstop   (see our return details below) Then taxi 30 mins for 2km to our hotel returning to the airport at the end of our stay our concierge briefed the taxi driver to take us to makassan  it was rush hour  40 mins later he dropped us at a station and drove off  it was not Makassan but ratchaprarop and it was a 45 minute trip to the airport so be sure you go to makassan

title: Huge time saving
review: I travelled from city to the airport using the Airport Link and would not regret I saved a lot of time as the Bangkok road are always full of traffic Its the best way to travel to the airport

title: Great way to save some taxi money
review: Best way to save some money that you will pay to taxi Very convenient to connect to Skytrain I would recommend staying somewhere close to the skytrain or the rail link for easy connectivity

title: reliable and cheap
review: Avoid the rip off taxis and take the airport rail link costs about 40B unbeatable value If you're going to Khaosan just take the rail link to the last stop and get a meter taxi from there

title: Cheap
review: 50 Baht 3 stops to Patpong marketless than a quid One waycouple of Irish bars by market ok Loads of fake handbags T shirts and pretty much anything else on offer Need a broad mind as all sorts of tings offer from hawkers trying to get you in girlie bars

title: We'll connected
review: Best way to travel from suvarnabhoomi airport  It is well connected to all the location in bangkok There are at least 100 hotels in a walking distance from various BRT stations You have a check in counter for thai airways at makasan station

title: Slow!
review: I was had experience last month about Thailand Airport Link it's very nice train but look like a little old style

title: Very Easy
review: We used the airport rail link to return from Bangkok to the airport on our way home   We rode the BTS Skytrain to Phaya Thai and it's a short walk to the airport rail link station  45 baht per adult for the trip and about 30 minutes  This sure beats the cab ride not just for price but for time  In Bangkok the trip to the airport could vary between 40 minutes and 90 minutes depending on the time you travel and the amount of traffic   Using the MRT or  BTS Skytrain and the airport rail link guarantees a smooth trip to the airport  However be aware that during peak times (79am 47pm) the BTS Skytrain can be packed to the rafters so getting on is a problem even without luggage

title: Its fast and cheap
review: When I arrived at Bangkok airport  I took Airport link to my hotel It cost us  around 180 bhat for two Where hotel was offering a Taxi for 1600 bhat

title: Airport Link
review: This is very convenient for travelers who don't have much luggage But you need to go to Pratunam to get too  But if this link is extended to more places its very easy

title: Save your money and use the Airport Rail
review: Was able to get to the Airport with no trouble at all from the Asoke Station (Sukhumvit Line) From there are quick ride to Phaya Thai Station (34 Bhat) and then a 30m ride to Suvarnabhumi Airport (50 Bhat) Roughly $3CAD for the entire trip Quick Clean and Easy Save your money and use the rail

title: Perfect!
review: Cheap way to get out of airport You can easily change to Skytrain which takes you around BKK easily

title: Very convenient
review: Take your bag from the belt and head down to airport link station In 25 minutes you will be at an MRTBTS station and from there you can go wherever you wantOfcourse you need to know where you are going and that can be a challenge sometimes This is a good option IF you know exactly where you are going (or if you have a card of the place in Thai so you can use to get a taxi from a different location then the airport) and you need to skip traffic or save some baht There is also option of checking in and luggage drop from the main station (if you are going to the airport) I think but never tried it

title: Very good
review: This is the perfect solution for escape the traffic jam This is clean and fast Perfect to go to the airport

title: Best way to travel to the city.
review: it is well connected through Phya Thai station Its fastest and cheapest way to travel to city of bangkok

title: very convenient
review: Very nice and convenient service Easy and cheap to come to the city from BKK airport even with a lot of luggage At least one should definitely come to Makkasan with airport city line (cheaper than express line and not worth paying the extra high price for express line if you are not in real hurry) and there is very efficient and transparent taxi service to any where in the city This way you also save the 50baht airport toll fees which you need to pay if you take a taxi from the airport itself  But consider taking a taxi all the way to the airport while taking the return flight from Bangkok This way you do not need to pay airport toll and it's not worth  to get off at Makkasan and take airport link to Bkk specially at night when you are tired after your trip in bangkok The difference in price is not much so just enjoy your taxi ride all the way to BKK

title: Convenient and cheap!
review: This is a fantastic way to get from the international airport to Phaya Thai (center of town) There you can either transfer to the BTS or hop in a taxi If you don't have much luggage it is very easy to navigate the airport rail link and BTS

title: Use it!
review: The airport rail link is one of the best piece of infrastructure built  The rail provides a direct link from airport to the city centre  You can choose either the Express service (THB90 per person) which is exclusive and onestop or use the City service (THB45) which operates like any rail service and makes about 89 stops along the way  Overall use it and forget the taxis

title: So convenient and cheap
review: If your hotel is close to the train line from the airport do it Cost me 40 baht $135au instead of 300 baht $1050au via Taxi Go to level 2 and DO IT ( if you get through before midnight) Open 6ammidnight

title: Saves a lot of time and effort.
review: Road travel in Bangkok can be tiring The traffic is bad specially in peak hours I believe that the ARL BTS and MRT along with the Water Taxi's make Bangkok a city with great public transportation  The ARL is great way to get into the city from Suvarnabhumi Airport Take the city train to Phayathai and then change over to the interconnecting BTS (Sukhumvit Line) Its also very good to get to areas like Pratunam or Ramkhamhaeng if you are staying on Sukhumvit Road or Silom as the BTS interchanges with the ARL at Phayathai and the MRT at Makassan  Its fairly reasonable and the ticketing staff though they don't speak very good English try to help Even the security guards help and the entire experience of the Airport Rail Link is easy smooth convenient and pretty comfortable too

title: It's good
review: This is a nice simple option to get I and out of Suvaranbhumi if you don't have luggage Be aware it doesn't go to Don Muang where Air Asia flights & some other International flights leave  If the taxis make you nervous I would recommend it However you may need to get a taxi to your final destination  Clean safe & efficient  Separately for the adventurous Don Muang can be reached by mainline train From Hualamphong to Donmuang can take as little as 45 minutes However if you are in a rush then avoid it  All trains on the Northern branch stop there then it is a walk to the terminal through the airport hotel Current fare 5b and a fascinating journey through the back of Bangkok

title: Nice transportation into the city
review: You can take the express or the city train Express is faster but sometimes it's on an hourly schedule City train is about twice as long (45 mins I think) but runs more frequently   TIP check the schedule before you buy a token to see how long until the next express train  First trip i hopped a cab at Makkasan and went right to my hotel Second trip however when I got to Makkasan station it was rush hour and there were no cabsI had to hoof it a few blocks to the MRT station and take the MRT to Soi 24 where I walked to my hotel pulling my bad A local suggested going a station or two beyond Makkasan (I think Phaya Thai) to catch a cab  Otherwise this is much better than fighting Bangkok traffic all the way to your destination in a taxi

title: Superb and convenient service
review: Liked  Relatively easy to find on the lowest level If in doubt ask any airport staff Inexpensive and speedy frequent service to Bangkok  Disliked  Lack of signage and inconvenient distance and location of Phetchaburi Underground station from Makkasan airport rail link station Solution  Ask pleasant cheerful station staff

title: Simple travel
review: I liked the fact that I no longer have to dice with traffic taxis or AOT limos to get between airport and the city centre I disliked the fact that the train is as basic as the MRT or BTS  those plastic seats are horribly uncomfortable after 45 minutes And the train is often packed with many passengers travelling between stations on the line or being staff at the airport Most of the air passengers I saw seemed to be the more budget travellers Still fastest way into town  and out of town The connection with MRT at MakkasanPhetchaburi is awful though While signposted still have to drag suitcase a long way across a rail way crossing and down a very badly broken street Next time I went to the end of the line at Phaya Thai and used BTS instead

title: On time, no long queus comfortable ride, traffic jam avoider
review: For the distance they bring you it is cheap and comfortable Avoiding the traffic jam is its best feature and time spend in travelling minimal

title: Take the train.
review: Although it only operates every half hour the train into town (Phaya Thai station) is cheap and fast  It helps you to avoid the horrible traffic at rush hour and connects easily to the BTS  Use the Makkasan station if you want to connect to the metro

title: Convenient and easy
review: Been to many airports and I think this is one of the easier connection to catch There are signs to point you to the airport rail link Girl at info counter was not very helpful but there were very friendly people around to help you out  We took the slower connection with quite a number of stops along the way Not a problem since we were on holiday However as the train approaches the city centre it got more crowded so if you have more than one luggage or a big luggage maybe clumsy At the last stop we hopped into the sky train to our hotel Do note that there are stairs to climb so not for those with heavy luggages Will take train again if travelling light

title: Excellent train system
review: There were announcements in  Thai language and also English  Very useful and helpful for tourists  The ticket counter was very smiley too

title: Easy to find, easy to use
review: Easy to find easy to use research your hotel location before you go this could easily be your best option to get into town We caught the normal city line as it was ready when we arrived downstairs there is an info booth which will let you know whether the express platform of the city platform are the go at that minute City line stops at about 8 or so stations before reaching Phaya thai the end of the line

title: 15 minutes to town!
review: Beat all traffic jams But note that the MRT at Makkasan is out of the station and across the road on the left

title: Fast and easy
review: Its quick and airconditioned and avoids the express way traffic If you are travelling reasonably light this is a great way to get into town

title: easy access to & from the centre of BKK
review: So much easier than getting a taxi A pleasant ride right to the airport Trains run on time and are clean and comfortable Not available to Don Muang airport though

title: The best option to travel to airport
review: No jams like the taxis are always stuck in jam particularly in wee office hours Better to board the Airport link and in 20 minutes you can reach the destination without jam and moreover you can look around the Bangkok

title: Quick and easy
review: Cheapest way to get in and out Bangkok  Stroller friendly too  Highly recommend over a cab or bus  Air con too

title: Excellent
review: For a few pounds you can get straight into Bangkok and the surrounding area very easy on this air conditioned train

title: Perfect
review: Really easy and cheap (50 bath) Very quick and easy to use if you have to go near a skytrain station

title: cheapest and convenient way to reach city
review: i use airport rail link  city line  ( cheaper compare to express ine) from suvarnabnhumi airport to bangkok its a 30 minutes smooth ride only cost me 45baht ( express line is 150 baht) city line stops at 7 or 8 station along the wayit gives me time to enjoy the ride the route easy to undestand you can choose where to stop ( the nearest station to your hotel) you must try it

title: The better option to arrive in downtown Bangkok
review: With Bangkok being busy anytime during the day the airport Rail Link is the better option to commute to and from Suvarnabhumi Airport Its fast its cheap it has frequent departures and its comfortable leaving from inside the airport terminal Its too bad that it does not connect to Don Muang Airport A tip remember to purchase the roundtrip ticket for a good discount

title: Very impressed
review: Very impressed with the airport rail link Was prompt clean quiet well signposted quite cheap and gave a very nice welcoming view into Bangkok  If you a little adventurous or just want to save the hassle and cost (and traffic) of getting a taxi from the airport try the airport rail link for sure  Great way to get back TO the airport from the city too

title: Best way to reach airport
review: Airport rail link is best way to and from the airport if you have luggage We took the link from Phaya Thai station for 90baht per person and reached airport in 15mins The frequency is every 30mins There are no stops and there is enough space for luggage It is definitely more convenient than taking the BTS as BTS would have people getting down at every station which makes it difficult with luggage

title: Perfect For Getting From BKK Airport to Most Of Bangkok
review: Quick simple direct  I recommend the express train straight from BKK to Phaya Thai BTS station From there you can get to much of the city The train is quiet clean and fast enough Not much else to say here it's a city train that you will spend less than 15 minutes on

title: Fastest mode to reach airport
review: I would say this is one of the fastest way to reach Bangkok International Airport Costs about 90 Bahts (at least when I was there last October) per trip Starting from Phaya Thai this nonstop rail link reaches airport in about 1520 mins However frequency is not so great running one every 30 mins Still a great hassle free mode to reach airport

title: Short, Direct trip to the City
review: Was a simple direct and cheap transportation to the city  I only wished that the line operated later than Midnight

title: Convenient to get you into the city, can get crowded
review: For about 45 baht (~125 USD) you can get from the airport all the way into the city Easy to locate at the airport follow the slanted moving walk ways all the way to the bottom then find the kiosks to purchase blue line tickets (the express is not working and not worth it) It will link you up in Phaya Thai with the Skytrain (BTS) if your stop is not on the link itself It also links with the subway (MRT) Very cost effective especially if you don't have a ton of luggage We had backpacks Note it can get pretty crowded at peak commute times (morningevening) It is airconditioned

title: Fast, cheap and easy
review: So easy to use for me I took mrt from Silom to Petchaburi from there its a200 mtrs walk to Makasanstation You just buy a token at a vendingmachine to Suvarnabumi airport If you find it complicated no worries there is staff to help you or just go to the counter to buy your token I’ve paid 30bth and in about 22 minutes I arrived at the airport If you are traveling during rush hour this is the fastest way to the airport without traffcjam Highly recommend

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Great way to get around Bangkok Especially with the conjested Streets There are people there to help you understand how to use the expansive system

title: fast cheap transit from airport to city
review: fast cheap transportation from airport to city  Board in the airport  inks with MTR for access to skytrain on Sukhumvit

title: Cheap and Easy
review: One of the easiest ways to the airport if you are around SukhumitMakkasan area If not take a taxi to the corner where Petchaburi station and Makkasan meet All escalators and flat from there

title: Quick. Efficient. Affordable
review: As title says Not sure of wait time between trains 10 15 maybe Very good cheap transportation Taxi's nearby to finish your destination

title: The best way out of BKK
review: The rail link take you to Phaya Thai station connecting you to BTS which takes you to most areas of BKK city Fast clean and affordable way to travel in BKK   Runs until midnight every 15 min

title: Excellent way to avoid the traffic
review: I have used the Airport Rail Link a number of times to reach Bangkok city from the airport Sometimes travelling with a heavy larger luggage other times with a carry on but each time I found this the best and most convenient way to reach the city  Frequency of trains are pretty good I have never had to wait for more than 15 minutes Also if you get in from the airport it is almost guaranteed that you will always find a seat  Having also hired taxi's in the past the rail link is definitely the much cheaper and quicker option This however depends I guess on where in Bangkok you plan on staying  I always stay in the Sukhumvit area and if I stay closer to Asok I get off at Makkasan and catch the MRT to Sukhumvit station in Asok If I stay in the lower Sukhumvit area I get off at the last station 'Phaya station' and catch the BTS For either of these options you don't have to enter or cross any roads The BTS and MRT is a few minutes walk once you exit the train connected via a sky walk  To catch the MRT or BTS you will need to purchase a separate ticket at that station The Airport Rail Link pass does not apply to the BTS or MRT  When you arrive at the airport past customs collect luggage and exit it is very easy to locate the Airport Rail Link It is located within the airport itself so you don't have to step outdoors There are signs everywhere which you can follow to get to the ground level which is where the station is located   To purchase a ticket you can just go to the ticket counter and tell them where you want to go and they will either give you the ticket immediately or coins to purchase the ticket from the vending machine The ticket is actually a plastic coin which you tap to go through the gate and put in a slot when you exit the gate at your destination  I am a frequent traveller to Bangkok and this is now my preferred method of travel from Bangkok Suvarnabhumi airport to the city I will continue to use the Airport Rail Link as a solo traveller or if I am with a smaller group (up to 3 individuals) It might however be more convenient and cheaper for larger groupsfamilieselderly with a lot of luggage to catch a taxi

title: Best way to reach central Bangkok
review: If you are landing in Suvarnabhoomi Airport and looking for the cheapest and most convenient way to reach the central Bangkok don't bother to look for taxis The Airport Rail Link is easy accessible from the basement of the airport and is not only economical but also the fastest way to reach the city

title: Fast transportation
review: If you want less traffic and affordable price choose airport rail link From perch abut I station it was affordable I think I paid less than 50 baht

title: Gateway to Bangkok!
review: Do you want to get ripped off by a taxi or stuck in traffic on a nearly equally slow bus NO Then take the rail link in the basement of the airport For a little more than a bus and heaps cheaper than a taxi (and much faster than both) the Rail Link will have you on your way quickly and cheaply It intersects other rail lines to get you right where you need to go without any traffic and there are people everywhere to help you buy your tickets and give you directions Enjoy

title: Airport link with Sky Train
review: This is a quick way to get into the central city area You can then either walk to your hotel or take a taxi from the station

title: ARL Quick and Cheap
review: Best way to travel to downtown Bangkok via the airport rail link Vending machines are located at B1 level of the airport for purchasing tickets for the travel

title: Clean and efficient
review: Just like the BTS it's clean and efficient There are boards showing their routes and interconnections with the other rails Keep change on hand to help buy tickets faster Don't need to rush as there are trains every 10mins

title: Easy!
review: The Airport Rail Link is easy to navigate affordable dependable and fast It connects to both the MRT and Sky Train  Yes all of the trains can be crowded so I don't really encourage too many bags especially on the MRT and Sky Train  But all in all it was a great experience  When I had questions I asked other passengers who were kind and helpful

title: Comfortable
review: The route was relatively straightforward and a trip endtoend would take about half hour The trains are clean and on time and as it’s the only line that serves the airport you do get lotsa people with luggage bags A trip from Praya Thai to the airport would cost you 90B and it’s very affordable compared to other options such as Grab or taxi

title: Easy to getting places
review: When you get claim your baggage they will be a sign that say Airport raill link service where every you need it to go to To Siam Paragon it just cost us 75 bath one way Very excellent service

title: Convenient and Cheap
review: Took the Airport Rail Link on arrival to Bangkok Payed a little over 1USD for oneway transfer to the end of the Rail Train ride was smooth Luggages weren't an issue as the train is spacious and was not crowded We arrived in Bangkok on a Friday evening right around sunset Be advised the Phaya Thai Express is no longer available Also what out for the lady at the Information Booth in the Airport before entering the Station She has an attitude problem

title: Convenient transportation
review: Tried train many times and very convenient way of transportation I tried Suvanabu airport to central BKK and found very Ok

title: Fast, Efficient and Cheap!
review: As a matter of habit I used to cab it from the airport to Bangkok and back For the past few years I always use the rail link saving over 600+ baht per trip Highly recommended

title: Fastest way to get into the city…
review: The train takes you directly from the Airport to the city where you can then connect with the other train lines in Bangkok  It is reliable and a fraction of the time and cost of a taxi  I would definitely recommend using the airport rail link using to and from the airport

title: Your fastest way to the city.
review: Airport link is your life saver if you do not want to stuck in traffic jam It will directly takes you from the Airport to the city and other train networks in Bangkok Higly reccomended

title: excellent mode of transport to get to the airport

title: wonderful service
review: One need not take a taxi from Bangkok Airport You can travel to any part via Airport rail link Very efficient and easy to commute

title: Went to MBK centre via this train had to walk down a km, but excellent services.

title: So convenient!

title: amazing

title: Best trip

title: Easy!
review: Easy to use and cheap Awesome views  pay by the stop cheapest way to get around  give it a try you won't regret it

review: Fast and perfect  It's five stops but after you understand how congested the streets are in Bangkok if you take a cab or an Uber you'll be sorry  This is the best way to reach your hotel or the center of the city from the airport Even if you have a suitcase with you

title: See Bangkok even for less
review: Such an easy and cheap way to travel and see the city At first might me a little intimidating and challenging but after you tried once you will always travel around Bangk9k this way  If you need any help the local people are always there for you and that is such a lovely way to interact with local community  even with some language limitations but always ready to help  smile and you will be rewarded with beautiful smile back  Enjouy

title: Easy and convenient
review: What a great way to commute from the airport Easy to find and to pay for at 45 BHT from memory Air conditioned and if you’re lucky you’ll find a seat but there was heaps of room We could understand all the stops given over the speaker

title: Good way from Airport to city
review: Only THB45 from the airport to the city  Cheap and fast way to go city besides cab and it only takes 30 mins from airport to the last stop

title: What a great, cheap, fast, hassle free way to travel.
review: I highly recommend using this Rail Link to get from the airport in to town It was cheap and easy with people there to help free of traffic congestion and free from the hassle of dealing with Taxi or Tuk Tuk drivers and only cost us 160Baht Awesome

title: train is very convinient
review: this train is easily access from the airport going out to the main city itself just buy a card and reload after finish

title: Excellent - that's all !!!
review: It's cheap  It's quick  It's effective and efficient  It's suitable for everyone regardless of age and physical traits  My advise  please use it whenever you can

title: Good for avoiding traffic

title: Allow time rush hour is crowded.
review: The airport link is only just over a dollar to the end of the line which is located in a BTS station so one can get the BTS to the nearest point to you hotel If your hotel is a on theriver you can get the relevant hotel shuttle to the 5 star  onesIf you flight gets in at 1100pm or later get the public taxi because you won't get through customs in time the link close at midnight It started at 730am but is about to change to 530 am It was an easy journey but crowded in rush ours I personally only carry a rucksack and small rolling suitcase  I saw people which huge luggage I would not attempt the link with such Remember when you travel less is best so you are not held back by possessions

title: great transportation from the airport to the city
review: avoid rush hour time time yourself for your arrivaldeparture time cos the train could be very packed with commuters

title: Very comfortable

review: I've lived in Bangkok several years and now visit a few times a year The taxis have set their prices above the meter rate in an effort to keep up with inflation I highly recommend the airport link which also links with a few BTS stations Just check the hours of operation

title: Never need a taxi again

title: The best way to travel to and from the airport

title: Great
review: Fantastic service easy to navigate and dropped us right where we wanted to be in Bangkok Very cheap too

title: Best way to the city
review: The rail was easy to use and a good way into the city At times Bangkok traffic is very bad so the rail is a good option

title: Cheap and good
review: I had done my research and found that this is the number one way to get to the city centre if you want to get there cheap Will use it again

title: Cheapest and fastest way to the city.
review: The Skytrain Connects  Suvannabhumi International Airport and downtown  You can connect to another Skytrain at Phayathai Station at the end of the route  Very convenient  It allows you to bypass traffics save time and money  If you have several suitcases this might not be the most easiest because you have to drag them up and down the escalators  In that case I recommend an Airport Limousine (AOT) which will cost you about $3560  Depends on the type of vehicle of your choice  But if you can manage your luggage(s) yourself Airport Rail Link might be what you need  One thing though you might have to wait 1020 minutes at the station before it takes off (Because it is the first station either at Suvannabhumi Airport or at Phayathai)

title: 25 Minutes to Central Bangkok
review: For only 35 to 45 Thai Baht you can avoid Bangkok's famous traffic jams arrive at stations well connected to the MRT and be on your way Highly Recommended

title: Cheap and convenient way to the city centre
review: Cheap and convenient way to the city centre and link to BTS and MRT Fastest way to the city without traffic jam If less than 3 travelers is the best choice

title: It's my daily commute
review: I take this train every workday It's great Operating speed is faster than BTS The only downside is that it's a bit crowded during rush hour especially in the afternoon going into town with lots of tourists coming in from the airport with big bags You sometimes have to push and shove your way out because there are so many nincompoops who won't step off the train to let you out I love trains and hate humans The Airport Link will be even better when it gets connected with the BTS Yellow Line in another year or 2

title: Essential

title: Super economical and fast
review: What’s the fastest way to into City from Suvarnabhumi Airport RAIL LINK was fast and easy if you have the hotel within walking distance from the nearest station then you are set to arrive without any fuss at super budgetit costs me 20 times in my hometown airport rail link

title: Best way to get to the city

title: Best way into town

title: Fastest way to get into the city
review: Strongly recommendable transport to get into the city from the airport or the other way around Bangkok's traffic is one of the worst we know and having this opportunity there is just a timesaving relief

review: The Airport Rail ink is a very efficient and fast way to access the city linking to the Skytrain for onward travel to hotel destinations The link uses a token system with a token needed per person per direction They are easily purchased from machines in the station Plenty of room for luggage but be warnedif you are transferring to the Skytrain or MRT space can be tight

review: the cars are clean and the train is fast  the maps are good  but make sure you know the name of your stop

title: Great System
review: This is an awesome addition to the Bangkok infrastructure It is cleaner and seemingly better run than many US trains Certainly the easiest way to get from the airport to down town with out booking a car in advance

title: Convenient
review: I traveled through Suvarnabhumi Airport so I took Airport Rail Link to Phaya Thay Then take BTS to my hotel I enjoying my time it very very convenient And the price is reasonable

title: Use This Service
review: a great way to hit the city and allow your self to get into the vibe of bangkok Cheap and easy a great way to see some of the less likely tourist areas of Bangkok

title: Easy Ride in Bangkok
review: It is convenient to get into the city center without traffic jam Easy connection and the coach is clean because no one is allowed to eat in the train Don't rush to get on the trains as they are running frequently

title: Faster and cheaper
review: First try for me safe so much time and money High recommended especially to those who is traveling alone as you have no one can share the cab fare with you 😅

title: Easy access to the city
review: The train is clean and cheap It gets more crowded as it approaches the city center It costs about USD2 from airport to Phaya Thai (the end terminal) which connects to other rail services within the city

title: Excellent Ground Transit
review: If you arrive during operation hours and don't have too much luggage there is no reason to take a taxi into Bangkok  the Airport Rail Link is so easy to use affordable and hey  if you're in travel mode it's awesome Follow the signs and start your great Bangkok adventure You can't get lost and even if you do unless you have to be somewhere why not Rail link connects to BTS and you can get most places from there If you are staying in Khao San Road area you might be better off taking a bus  there is no BTS in that area so the connection is a little more difficult  there are buses from various BTS stations thoughso do your research and the rail link might be a good start

title: Probably the cheapest airport express train in the world
review: Amazing  this train takes you to the heart of Bangkok for about 30 minutes and for just over 1 euro Running every 15 minutes from 6am to 24pm it's obviously the easiest fastest and cheapest way to get into Bangkok connecting you with both metro systems (MRT and BTS)

title: The best to travel to the City Center
review: Very accessible and cheap The cheapest way to travel from Airport to the City It is better than the taxi for the crazy traffic into the City Center

title: Best way to get to bangkok international airport
review: The new MRT link from Bangkok city to Suvarnabhumi International Airport has taken all the hassle out of travelling to and from the airport No more haggling with taxi drivers who don't want to use the meter No more sitting in traffic jams now you can jump on a new airconditioned train and using MRT BTS and Skytrain links you can get to most places quickly and inexpensively The only drawback is the line only runs to midnight so those arriving in the early hours will still have to use the taxis I understand that a link to Don Muang is also planned with similar benefits

title: Perfect!
review: Fast efficient cheap Really enjoyed using it from the airport Would recommend for anyone landing in BKK

title: Cheap transfer to City center
review: We took our ride from Suvarnabhumi Airport at 6 AM and it was crowded We dropped off at Phayathai Station (City center) and internally changed to BTS to reach our hotel Overall the train was clean and conditioned and cheap way to reach the city center if you're traveling on a budget

title: If you are a bit older...
review: and not so good on your feet or travel with huge amounts of luggage dont take the train because you will suffer lugging this stuff around it is fast inexpensive but still not very convenient  We had just one large suitcase which was acceptable

title: Good and efficient

title: Pretty much the best transport option in BKK

title: Very good

title: Cheap and affordable
review: Tried to take airport rail link this time and surprisingly is fast cheap and convenient Wating time is short so much cheaper than KLIA transit )

title: best airport transport

title: Frequent & cheap
review: I think these run with a 15 minute frequency until midnight Really clean guards at each major stations I just wish the one to Don Mueng was  is ready This can only be used for the new Bangkok International Airport

title: Fast
review: It is a good option from or to the airport if it is not rush hour or you have plenty of time It has a connexion with Bts sky train at Phaya Thai stop hight air conditioning all the time  We took it from the airport in two occasions very convenient but to go to airport we preferred by taxi (400baths)

title: Convenient & Good Way To Beat The Traffic
review: The airport rail link is reasonably prized convenient and very well air conditioned The ride is comfortable and you can beat the crazy traffic jam of Bangkok easily The train station is located at the basement of the international airport and will bring you all the way to Phaya Thai station Highly recommended to use this mode of transportation

title: Airport rail link
review: Fast and convenient to Makassar even with luggage where I always change to MRT to Sukhumvit Best way to escape the traffic

title: Very fast and save time
review: I am so afraid to go airport with taxi because  is about the traffic but friend of my he tell me to go sky train airport rail is take time only 40 to 45 minutes I am  so happy now I caught my flight

title: Very convenient, but allow more time during rush hours.
review: Airport Rail Link is one of the most convenient ways to get into Bangkok Even if you do not take it to the end you could save a lot of time by avoiding some of the traffic At the end you can connect with BTS or connect to the subway 2 stations from the end which could save you a lot of time during the rush hours or if there is rain Because there are no  other rail lines that serve communities in that direction the Airport Rail Link tend to be overcrowded during rush hours with commuters Sometimes the commuters have to wait for several trains before being able to get on Some even resort to going to the airport rather than closest station to be able to get on an empty train Therefore allow more time during rush hours

title: Fast transport to the centre of Bangkok
review: Bangkok is becoming very modern but hard to believe the scam taxis are as active as every  Avoid Scam cab and catch the train At the airport take the escalator all the way to the ground floor and use the vending machine to buy your ticket for the train  Trains are frequent and you can jump on the BTS on arrival in BKK to continue your journey

title: Convenience travel within Bangkok
review: This is the best way to get around Bangkok This Bangkok MRT is one of the most well connected to importance city landmarks

title: Quick and clean
review: Very easy way to travel to and from Suvarnabhumi Airport Follow the signs and take escalators to the bottom level of the airport  The station area is clean and well lit  The train travels into the heart of Bangkok There are connections to the MRT and  BTS the two other mass transit systems in Bangkok so you should be able to get at least near most tourist destinations Near every train stop there are taxis waiting if you need short transport to your exact location The Airport Rail Link works best for solo travelers or couples If you are traveling in a group of four or more a taxi will be cheaper but probably not faster A little research into where you want to go and will find using Bangkok's rail and subway systems are the fastest cleanest easiest and safest way to travel

title: Passable
review: Cheap and easy ride Suitable in case you don't have several bags Around 30 minutes to city Need to exchange trains if your staying around Sukhumvit area

title: Great Airport Link
review: The Airport Link is located in B1 of the airport  It is very tourist friendly since one can navigate it easily going to the city  The presence of the staff where one can ask just in case he gets lost is very useful as well  The Airport link paves the way to taking the MRT and the Skytrain to one's destination  It offers efficiency clean couches and good frequency  It's very well planned having handicaps in mind as well  Love it

title: smooth ride
review: its cheap and easy but not if you have too many people with luggageinstead take a taxi  Just go down to the basement City line into Phaya Tai not the Express which is fast but infrequent  At Phaya Tai connect to the skytrain BTS to Nana or  other area easy

title: Avoid traffic jams and get to BKK airport without any stress
review: Great way to get to the airport  Easy to connect to airport link from center of town and you are guaranteed to miss all of the traffic jams  Cheap easy reliable

title: Easy access to and from airport
review: Best way to get to and from airport in my opinion Takes less than half hour to get into the city interchange stations where you can change to the MRT or Skytrain Way more efficient and cheaper than the taxis

title: Most convenient way to Suwarnabumi Airport
review: Avoid traffic snarls to reach airport on time  Safe  Secure and Sure  convenient  and economical has good connectivity to all major parts of the business district

title: Fastest and cheapest way to Airport
review: Better than hopping into a taxi or catching an uberIt's the easiest and cheapest way to go to the airport

title: Travel
review: very good for the travellersmy son studies in Ramkamheang areavisiting him and going to Bankapi mall was easy

title: So convenient
review: So convenient for anybody to get on the train and save time and don't have to worry about traffic and being late for pickup of friends family Not expensive at all

title: Cheaper than a Taxi
review: The best way to travel to and from the airport is by using the airport tail link It is easy & so much cheaper than a taxi They run from 6am Easy to get to as signs are all so clear Run regular and AC

title: Liked it
review: The train is convenient and affordable With good airconditioning and passes frequently so u don't have to wait too long for it

title: Convenient
review: Very convenient way to beat Bangkok traffic You can get off at Phaya Thai station to swtich to BTS to get around city centre

title: easy,cheap and very convenient travel to airport
review: the best way to travel airport from bangkok is airport link mrt stationits is easycheapconvenient and hassle free to travel directly to airport from anywhere in bangkok city

title: Perfect journey straight into the heart of Bangkok
review: Service is pretty standard MRT There is a ticket counter though The machines only accept coins but the counter will change your paper money in an instance Only paper tickets

title: Best way to travel to the airport
review: I always try to have flights flying in Survanabumi Airport instead so that I can make use of the Airport Rail  The cons It can get really crowded at times as there are lots of local commuters taking this line as well  The pros Fast cheap and efficient way to get to the airport  There are departure timings preindicated so be sure to try and be there for the train that leaves at least 2 timings before when you actually need to take the train so that you don't panic when you can't get on board Hope that makes sense Lol

title: Great way to get into the city
review: The rail link is a great way to get into the city from the airport without worrying about getting stuck in a taxi in terrible traffic It is clean and efficient However if you need to connect to the BTS once in the city you have to drag your luggage quite a long ways Doable but think twice if you have lots of luggage

title: Very convenient and fast to reach the city
review: it is clean cheap and very very convenient to take it to the hotel Took taxi previously and not only is the fare high it took a longer time than using this Airport Link Highly recommended

title: Best travel option to escape from the traffic
review: Do not give a second thought just opt for metro wherever you want to go if you are not sure take a taxi in the last mile traffic in BKK is too much to consume your day

title: easy!
review: I was taking the rail link from BKK to phaya thai and walking to my hotel from there It was very easy to get to from my terminal in the airport There are clear signs inside the train telling you which stop you're at in Thai as well as English

title: Very Convenient
review: Extremely cheap clean fast and convenient option to get out of the airport and into Bangkok I highly recommend taking the rail from the airport to a station in the city and then hailing a taxi or tuk tuk to complete the journey to your hotel

title: "Very Convenient"
review: This is the best way to move around in the city Starting right from the airport this is one of the fast and cheapest way to get to the city Very convenient fast reliable comfortable  Highly recommended

title: Best way to and from the airport
review: Airport link is the fastest easiest and the most inexpensive way to get to Suvarnabhumi airport forget about taxis

title: Easy To Get Around
review: You may not be good in Thai language but you could definitely find your way in Bangkok The airport rail link is very convenient and affordable transportation option travelling into city area Try to look out for any accommodation that is near the BTS or MRT that you could basically go everywhere as you wish

title: Great service
review: Quick clean and simple This service connects with the bts and mrt It's cheap and my preferred way of getting to and from the airport

title: Cheap and easy
review: This is SO the way to get to and from the airport  cost 40 baht and takes 30 min A taxi will take an hour or more depending on traffic and cost around 300 baht On this last visit it seemed like the highways were little more than a car park

title: Airport into city
review: Easy cheap and fast Will never take a taxi again  Token payment very easy Just keep token for exit too

title: Transport
review: Excellent service and quite convenient given its connection to the BTS Luggage is an issue if like me your wife can't travel with the full kit

title: excellent service!
review: it is so easy to go airport to city by airport rail link and the fare is not too much must travel

title: great
review: it is great connection between down town and airport but even if you can not catch this airport rail link you can easy find bus from famous touristic places to the airport

title: EASY AS
review: It's a good experiance and much cheaper than using a Taxi It's quite user friendly I used it from Airport to Maccassan train station and was a smooth ride

title: Amazing! Use it and save your Money ! ❤👍🙏
review: The train located at the airport as soon as You get your bags and everything Don't get out of the building buy keep going straight (right side along the gates) then take the escalator 2 floors downstairs It's very easy to find the way and there are many signs to show you where to go 😊👍    You can go with Suitcases and large bags no problem  The train is very comfortable and airconditioned   The airport is the 1st stop so You will be able to find places to sit very easily   Don't be afraid if it's Your 1st time on the Airport train It's easy and every Thai Person and everybody who knows Bangkok use it ONLY You can use it too 🙂👍   Taxi from the Airport to Bangkok will be no less than 600700 Baht and the price at the train is only 3540 Baht for each Person to go to Nana  Siam area (Center of Bangkok)   The time from the Airport to Bangkok with the train will be around the 2030 minutes depends on what Stop You get off (With Taxi it will be around 3040 minutes and if there is a lot if traffic it can be a loooooong ride)     I recommend You to use the train and save a lot of time & money this way  If You are not sure how to go exactly to your hotel guest house ask them near what area it's located (which BTS stop)  get off at that Stop and walk if it's close or get a Taxi from the Station to Your hotel It's going to cost You 50 Baht (or a little more) in most cases All together (train and Taxi inside Bangkok) around the 100 Baht  👌😊👍

title: Cheap and convenient
review: Easy to find my way It brought me to Ratchaprarop station We could have walked 15monto my hotel but chose to take a taxi which charged me 150thats too much Should have book uber which is cheaper

title: Suvarnabhumi to Central Bangkok with ease !
review: Buy your token at the ticket counter on the lower ground floor of Bangkok's Suvarnabhumi Airport and enjoy a stress free ride to Central Bangkok

title: Enjoy Ride
review: If u want to avoid traffic and save money than u will use this train  For this use u will change train station one time only  Nice and easy way to go directly airport as wall as in Bangkok city for BTS station

title: Fastest Ride from the Airport
review: The airport link is awesome Imagine a ride from the airport that can actually take you in the center of the city (or viceversa) I usually take this ride and go down the Makkasan station and with just a few minutes walk i'm already in downtown Sukhumvit area What a breeze for travelers

title: Very convenient!!!
review: Its fast on time main thing is you dont have to sit in the Bangkok Traffic The price is a little expensive if you take the direct train but if you take the indirect one which have around 4 to 5 stops in between barely takes 45 minutes and its very cheap

title: Nice Rail System - But, Visa on Arrival at Bangkok Airport is Very Bad
review: Airport rail link is good option to reach the city But Visa on arrival at Bangkok Airport is very bad  Its advisable to apply visa for Thailand before your journey   Few tips 1 You need to spend 5 hours in the queue standing (without any food  water option) to get your visa stamped (even though you are ready with all your documents) 2 Better you carry Thai Bhat or accepted currency for exchange before you land as there are no ATM facility before the immigration lane in Bangkok Airport  Hope you make use of these tips

title: Easy way to transfer
review: Airport rail link is a very good way for airport transfer if you are a light traveller It has regular service and reliable and cheap

title: Best option in bangkok
review: This saves a lot of time Loved using the service It gets crowded but if you don't have any check in luggage this is a great option Best used by those traveling light without small kids

title: Airport link (uses different payment of BTS & MTR)
review: Total time of full train ride from airport to Praya Thai (linked to BTS) Airport link at Mayasan is also linked to MTR All these 3 services use their own payment systems (which is the only bad point about city BKK trains)

title: Perfect to go downtown
review: Very easy to use and not expensive Advantage you know exactly how long it will take to go downtown Connected to the skytrain

title: Fastest and cheapest way to travel from Bangkok Airport!!
review: This is undoubtedly the fastest cheapest and most convenient way to travel from the Suvarnabhoomi Airport into Bangkok or other way around The trains are really fast spotlessly clean and very punctual At 90 Baht per person oneway they are dirt cheap and a fraction of the 1200 to 2000 or more Baht that any kind of Taxi will charge you There is enough space to keep all your luggage and mostly the train is half empty It's even got a clean toilet inside it

title: Very on time
review: It's very near to my hotel so I use it to connect to BTS The service serve untill mid night 12am I stop at Ratchaprarop Station

title: Airport - BTS
review: the best way to get connected to city cannot avoid the heavy traffic of bangkok it is reasonable and healthy to walk

title: Transit from airport rail link to their BTS or MRT.
review: Since it was my first time travelling there Had doubts of taking the Taxi's So my friends and i decided to take the Airport Rail Link Might look like there only a few stations but the journey from one to the other station can be quite long i would say

title: Great and inexpensive way to get into town from Airport
review: Least expensive way to get from Swampy to downtown If your hotel is close to a station its a perfect way to save a bundle If not then you will still need a taxi so best to grab one on the lower level and insist on a meter

title: FROM THE INTERNATIONAL TO THE METROPOLIS IN EASE
review: Just go to the lower lever of the Suvarnabhumi  International Airport and use the RED LINE or the BLUE LINE to transport you in convenience and air conditioned ease tonear the BTS skytrain (depends on what your location may be)  I use this tofrom the airport every time I go to Bangkok and would always look out and see the horrific traffic and confusion as I easily traveled to my nearby destination  Great using this service and since I lived in Thailand for over 11 years  IT IS THE BEST

title: A great addition to the BTS system.
review: I have visited Bangkok before this link was added to the BTS Skytrain system and I was always forced to take a taxi to Suvarnabhumi Airport  This link saves my money and especially time getting to the airport  I still take a taxi if I have a lot of luggage because it is difficult to haul luggage in and out of the Skytrain but for shorter trips when I only have one bag and a carryon this is the way to go

title: Quick and easy during busy street traffic times.
review: Took me 35min on a Friday morning from Asoke station with a short transfer on the metro then on to the airport No complaints Would certainly do this over the far more expensive taxi if you are staying centrally on the BTS or metro lines

title: Airport rail link
review: Excellent service from the airport to the city of Bangkok Easy to understand and use Plenty of space for your luggage Very friendly staff Excellent value

title: Convenient and VERY Reasonable
review: If you have little or no luggage at 45 baht for a oneway ride into Phya Thai this is the best deal in town

title: easy to use!
review: fast and convenient way to get to and from the airport  many stops connect to MRT and SRT rails so as long as you stay near one of those systems it's easy peasy

title: Convenient
review: I don't quite understand what's the difference between this rail and  the sky train as it's pretty much the same  It's a convenient affordable and easy way of getting into the city centre from the airport and vice versa  You can connect with the Sukhumvit sky train line

title: Perfect n easy transport
review: Highly recommend to take this Airport Rail Link it's so easy cheap and stress free  Just buy the ticket at the vending machine or at the counter Then proceed one floor down to catch the train to the city and it takes about 30 mins No traffic congestion Frm city you alight n buy another ticket if you want to transfer to BTS train

title: reliable, fast and safe
review: I was a bit stressed as it was my first Bangkok experience and travelling from the airport is always a big issue But this train service is excellent always running on time However it can get really busy during peak hours

title: Best way to go to the city if you are traveling alone or two
review: I've been using ARL over two years now and I love it  YYou can easily transfer to  BTS or MRT  I always use ARL every time I visit Bangkok  I hope it would be great If there's free or paid shuttles to major tourist's hot spots during certain hours so that stopover tourists can easily enjoy the beuaty of Bangkok

title: Easy access to and from airport
review: Want to get to city fast and cheap  and it's very convenient  Get to the city from the airport within 45 mins no jams no toll fee and usually no crowded trains Great for solo tourist and it costs only up to 45 bahts to get to Ratchaprarop which is near Pratunam

title: Easy connection
review: Very easy connection between the airport and the city of Bangkok It's cheap and fast no trafficjam

title: great accessibility
review: great transportation to choose from other then taxis from airport gets u to most hotels in downtown bangkok

title: Efficient
review: The signs in the airport are very clear to lead you to the station The payment details are also very clear It goes directly to the station for you to change trains to town

title: Efficient and Speedy Service
review: Having arrived and experienced the Bangkok traffic at first hand there was no other sensible choice to ensure timely arrival for our return flight  The train journey was fast and efficient and so much quicker than a taxi the sensible choice

title: Screw the tuktuks
review: BKK train and tube system is quite good in some parts of town I recommend using the train to get from downtown to the airport because sometimes it is hard to get a metered taxi

title: Fastest way to reach Airport
review: I feel very comfortable to use Airport Rail Link to go to Suvarnabhumi Mainly the stations are easy to access by BTS Sky train

title: transfers
review: very easy to use if you get stuck people are very willing to help just ask so much cheaper that private cars We stayed in Siam and had no problems getting to and from our hotel on the train and cost less than $1000

title: Amazingly Easy
review: We got off our plane and were newbies to Bangkok  It was approximately 10pm at night We walked outside to the cab rank and my goodness the cue it was so long  My husband and i just looked at each other and decided to take the train  At first i was slightly apprehensive as we didn't have a clue of the vicinity of the hotel from the train station and we didn't have 3G so we couldn't check on our phone however any apprehension that i had quickly was gone because once we got to the the train station it was so very easy to navigate  We got to our hotel with ease and for 40 baht each as opposed to a 600 plus Baht trip via taxi so win win for us It is such an excellent transport system and so clean it would be great if Melbourne Airport had one

title: Airport Link
review: Just on more station from the hotel and connect with airport like to Suvarnabhumi airport No worry for traffic

title: Fast and convenient ride from the airport
review: Take the ARL to Bangkok if you want to avoid traffic and have an airconditioned experience Otherwise you can take a taxi or a tuk tuk

title: Best Transportation alternative from SuvarnaBhumi airport to Paya Thai.
review: the train helps a lot to get access until paya thai station you can take another train link depend on hotel location the train will stop operation at 1130 PM so if you arrived in bkk before that time you can get the train till the downtown the train will operate 630 AM in the morning in the between 1130 PM until 630 AM you need to take bus or taxithe train is very comfortable and cheaprecommended

title: Most economical way to reach downtown from Airport
review: Strongly recommended for young tourists to Bangkok Easy and cheap to use Clean and convenient as well

title: Fast and efficient
review: What a way to be ushered into the country  Upon arrival just proceed several levels down you get to hop into clean cool coaches It brings you straight into the heart of bangkok Terminals are so clean and the cost to is very affordable

title: Fastest, safest and cheapest way to the Bangkok center for a backpackers
review: Well this IS good not only to backpackers really but for people who don't carry tons of belongings and wanted to save money and time with reasonable comfort Traffic jams are terrific here And expect that taxi drivers will charge you more than agreed if you are stuck in a jam ( if you use taxi with meter you know that you _will_ pay for each minute in jam )  So in metered taxi the best case you pay around 300500 depending on traffic conditions to reach the very center ( Patumwan )  in nonmetered the price is random but it's not uncommon to pay 13001500 if you are unaware In contrast you will pay 80 THB to reach Phaya Thai BTS station if you will use Rail Link ( and be delivered within a fixed time )  Traveling here is very safe don't expect rude crime here ( and anywhere in Thailand )

title: fantastic
review: it just takes 30 mins to come in city via airport rail link we had 5 baggage still managed very well to come by train in just 115 baht where in all taxi drivers outside of airport will ask from 600 to 1000 baht

title: Best option from the airport to town
review: If you are arriving at Suvarnabhumi airport and staying in Bangkok then this is the easiest option The train makes several stops with connections to the other travel networks Termination at Phaya Thai station its an easy connection to the BTS Cost full length trip is 140 THB and takes about 25 mins

title: The Best & fastest way to the heart of Bangkok
review: The Airport Rail Link is similar to the KLIA or the Airport Express in HongKong and Malaysia respectively   It connects the Suvarnabhumi airport to Phaya Thai with 6 stops in between  The service is fast prompt and efficient The trains are clean and maintained well

title: Great even with bags
review: There was 4 of us with our bags and we had no trouble buying tickets and getting our suitcases onto the train  Got you into the heart of Bangkok with no hassle  Recommend it especially at peak times it probably is quicker then the road

title: Too easy!
review: So easy and quick to access the airport line in Bangkok Clean cheap cool and efficient Great way to beat the traffic and arrive on time and cool Really easy to navigate and to get you to and from airport

title: Cheap, easy to use
review: The airport rail link is a quick easy and cheap way to get from downtown Bangkok to Suvarnabhumi airport

title: Value for money
review: I can't believe our hotel tried selling us an airport transfer for almost 1000THB when the Airport Rail Link is SO much cheaper easy to use and probably just as quick A very easy connection to BTS Skytrain makes this the obvious choice for getting tofrom BKK airport

title: most convent  tranpostation in/out of suvanarnabhumi airport
review: cheap and convenient best way to avoid bangkok traffic from town but will be packed during rush hours connected to payathai BTS station

title: Best way to get to the airport if you have a daytime flight
review: We took the airport rail link to catch a domestic flight and was by far the easiest and cheapest way to get there Bangkok roads are mayhem and often full of traffic jams which can take up to an hour to clear on sections Not to mention the taxi meter ticking along while sitting there  I got a taxi to the airport previously and it cost me 400baht and I nearly missed my flight due to traffic even though leaving with enough time  The sky train to the airport was 45baht So a huge difference especially if your running out of money at the end of your trip The platforms also have mini shops on them were you can buy tea and coffee and even a McDonald

title: Fabulous transport
review: Boy does Bangkok have the best train system Stayed in Bangkok 5 days (used the train) then onto Phuket On our way back to Australia we had a 10 hour stop in BKK so we hopped on the train at Airport then connected onto another train & went to SiamMBK for shopping stress free easy as no traffic & was brilliant

title: Extremely good!
review: This is the way to travel to the airport in Bangkok No guarantees the cabs will get you there on time because of the traffic jams wishing Bangkok city This rail link brings you directly into the airport so is vary convenient Even if you have older people or big bags lifts will take you to the different levels very smoothly Don't make the mistake of taking a cab to the airport

title: Cheap and easy
review: Great to use  easy cheap and quick Very helpful staff at the airport just follow the signs Cost about 50 cents to get to Bangkok from airport

title: cool, efficient and fast way into town!
review: Love this transport to get into town very quickly in a cool carriage Clean and comfortable Only down side is that Makkassan rarely has taxis waiting outside

title: Great means of transport, especially if travelling alone
review: Safe fast and totally reliable When running short of time this is the best possible way  25 mins from Phaya Thai station to airport (inside of the airport) Very reasonable and you get a seat (if you are standing pretty ahead in the line) Very good if traveling to or from the airport during weekdays (too much traffic in the city during the weekdays)

title: Don't be Intimidated!
review: So unbelievably easy So cheap Sooo much faster than a cap Ticket machines have English option and signs into the station below the airport couldn't be anymore in your face Spend 30 seconds to see which stop is closest to your lodging and save yourself a headache and some cash

title: Good way to town
review: fast from airport to town and early to reach at airport within 30 minutes Not expensive and better that taxi

title: The cheapest way to go to the airport
review: One of the best if not the best transportation means in between the new airport and downtown Easy connection withMetro and taxis

title: Best way to travel from the airport
review: This is the best way to travel to the city center or your hotel if it is within the route It is very reasonable 30 or 35 baht depending on where you are going Do not take a private transportation or taxi because the traffic is so bad if going to the city center

title: Easy-cheasy
review: I think it's the fastest way to go to the city centry  the closest metro station from the BKK airport Cheap and efficient

title: From the airport direct to city centre.
review: This train makes getting from Suvarnabhumi airport into Bangkok central (or vice versa) extremely easy Taxi drivers will often try to charge you 500 baht without running the meter but you can do the full length on this train for 45 baht A great service and they are currently busy building one for Don Mueang airport too

title: convenient way to travel to the city
review: The Airport Rail is a cheap and convenient way to travel from the airport to the city Sometimes it can get very crowded

title: Excellent service
review: The only way to travel  especially peak hours as roads in B can clog up  reliable trains with frigid aircon  easy to navigate  downloading map will put you ahead of the game

title: Stressless
review: The airport rail link is simple to use and cheeper than taxi If you use it you can be sure that you will be on airport on the time no matter if there is rush hour in the city or around Great choice

title: Smooth and pleasant journey
review: Took ARL because the taxi queue was ridiculously long when I arrived  Turned out to be a smooth and pleasant journey About 3045 minutes to reach city area Connect to some BTS ad MRT stations but separate ticketing  Okay  if you don't have bulky luggages

title: Effective
review: Best and cheapie way to getbto and from the airport It was clean cheap and fast It was not over crowded and had god security

title: SO EASY
review: Highly recommend using the metro to get to BKK We flew out of BKK and were struggling to find an inexpensive option to get to the airport Traffic in Bangkok is terrible it is a big city afterall and we weren't trying to spend $30 to get to the airport (it was the end of our trip so we had run through most of our money) We decided to give this a try and I'm so glad we did  We walked to our closest metro stop which was less than 10 mins away We put in our destination at an automated kiosk at the bottom of the station You don't need exact change We were given two tokens one for my boyfriend and I We were a little confused going up but one of the guards helped me go through We waited about 10 minutes for our train which was running like 2 or 3 minutes late We had 7 stops to get to the airport It was air conditioned and not very crowded though we just found a spot to stand in the corner We were dropped right off at the airport   Seriously this is the way to get tofrom the airport It's cheap easy and by far the fastest method of transportation This metro definitely beats the on in Washington DC on cleanliness and timeliness so if you're from the States you will be pleasantly surprised

title: Good to know !
review: Discovered it this time Will surely use it for Airport travel next time Can use it if u dont have too much of lugguage

title: Effective !!
review: This was my first time as a single traveller to Bangkok and instead of taking a taxi I thought of experience Airport rail link to city Center  I was highly impressed with how seamless t is for a traveller to visit this place with English written signs everywhere Just go to level 3 below departures and take a train as per map available at information desk Simple

title: Definitely worth it
review: you can take a taxi into town or you can hop on the airport rail  absolutely one of the better ways to travel  The only challenge is changing trains midway through to catch the BTS  Worth the ride

title: Best way to travel from airport to city
review: Fast convenient value for money way to travel from city to airport and back You avoid traffic of bangkok and can reach in 40 min from Phaya Thai airport link to Bangkok Suvarnabhumi Airport Phaya Thai skytrain station is across the road and not well connected At airport the connections are fine

title: There is no more express (red line)
review: There is no longer an express red line Only the blue line which stops at a few stations along the way It cost me 45 baht from Phaya Thai to Suvarnabhumi Airport Still good ride about 30 mins by train to airport  Suggest you take the train here at Phaya Thai because if you take it from one of the stops the train may be crowded and you will be left standing tiredly with your huge luggage

title: quick and easy
review: A really easy mode of transportation from airport to the city then an easy swap over to the BTS for us to reach our hotel near national stadium Can be quite busy in rush hour Best used for travelling with small amounts of luggage

title: marvellous
review: Brilliant method of travel guarranteed to be on time no fuss no harrassment from crooked taxi drivers juat relax and get out at the airport brilliant so easy

title: What could be easier?
review: What could be easier You skip the taxi haggle and the bus squish for a modest 3 dollars Just follow the signs after immigration and as long as your destination is somewhere in the vicinity of a sky train station you're as good as gold Even if it's not you won't pay more than a few extra dollars to get to get there

title: The quickest way to go!
review: The Airport to Bkk rail link is by far the safest  and quickest way into town  it is true you may not always get a seat but let's face it you've been sitting down for some 6 or 7 hours at least so 30 minutes on your plates isdisd not going to kill you )  the trains are clean and fast and here's the best bit CHEAP  Less than a pound  all the way  No rip off taxi drivers or the airport sercharge  to pay

title: Very convenient way to get in and out of central Bangkok
review: For only 45 baht great way to get in and out of town  especially if you're travelling light Trains are large and comfortable  Do note that there quite a few stops in between the airport and the final westernmost station in town (Phaya Thai)  and these are heavily utilized stops off and on peak hours so expect a constant crowd and be prepared to stand   Phaya Thai is also connected to the light green BTS line which is excellent for getting around to the Sukhumvit area

title: Convenient and quick!
review: With this rail link you will save time money and stress  You don't need to go outside and find expensive taxy always they ask much more money You will arrive in the town very quick  Be careful when you get out you are going to crash into a wall made of humidity and super hot

title: Fast w/a ViEW
review: I'm from San Francisco  To get from my San Francisco home to SFO airport I took public transportation  Let's just say that the Airport Rail Link is much smoother & has a better view  Very impressive

title: Perfect
review: Always on time but can get very crowded better than sitting in traffic Very cheap  Ideal for sight seeing

title: Good, clean, cheap and convenient
review: As stated in the title I have nothing to add I would definitely recommend to travelers who had reserved hotel along the BTS or subway line with 1 piece of luggage traveling with you

title: 30mins for 45Baht. Bargain!
review: This is a really cheap way to get to the airport if you have like one luggage and no children (Even with children it would be easy though maybe not if you have like 5 babies) Anyway by taking the BTS to Phaya Thai station and they switching to the airport link is the easiest way to use this Half and hour later you're at the airport And because you get on at the first station you almost always get a seat

title: Easy to use
review: Cheap and efficient was crowded but heythere's a lot of people to move  City line cheaper but slower than express line

title: Convenient
