review: Airport Rail Link can be connect to BTS Station or MRT Station  If you get off at BTS Phaya Thai station you go out the gate of BTS station and walk only a short distance to the Airport Link station Phaya Thai It is more short distance and convenient if you bring a lots of luggage with you  Or you can choose to transfet at MRT Phetchaburi station where you get out BTS station and have to walk around 5 mins to Airport Link station  Makkasan here is longer distance

title: Best transport from the Airport
review: This is the easiest way to travel into Bangkok from the Airport Direct links to both the BTS and the Metro Stand near the door if you have large bags as it will be easier to get off

title: Easy way to get into town!
review: Nice way to get into town  I've taken a taxi from the airport a few times and this is faster   I've been taken for a runaround by a few cabs as well  This way you know where you're going and if you have to you can still take a taxi from the closest station

title: I Come from San Francisco
review: Fabulous train  (1) I first visited Thailand in 1985 when the only way to get around as a backpacker was via PRIVATE BUSes that didn't cooperate wea other  That was slow and confusing  (2) I come from San Francisco  I had to catch a bus and BART to get to SFO from San Fran a distance shorter than this Airport Rail Link  It took much longer AND cost $225 for the bus and $850 for BART  Thailand beats San Francisco hands down

title: Does the job, very safe, beats the traffic.
review: This airport link is INVALUABLE when there are traffic jams in Bangkok It can take a long time to get through traffic by Taxi when there's a bad storm a lot of rain or just rush hour traffic I always consider the rail link for the airport as a backup incase there is a huge traffic jam   Always know your nearest stations on route to the airport which means you can ask your taxi driver to just drop you at the rail link if it looks like you're going to miss your flight due to extreme traffic

title: You can't beat the Airport Rail Link
review: For speed and ease skip the taxi stand and take the rail link  The fare is really reasonably  so inexpensive I have even forgotten what it was  Runs directly from BKK to Phaya Thai where you can connect with the rest of Bangkok

title: easy to find
review: Just followthe signs inside BTS and you'll find it Drops you off at the airport and other stops too but not too hard to figure out

title: High speed link to airport.
review: A high speed link to and from suvarnabhumi Always on time and in good condistion 45 THB is worth paying for

title: Efficient and effective
review: Easy to find fast to city centre and any exchange aircon comfatable cheap  what more do you need  does whats needed

title: Great service
review: This is a great service only sorry that the budget airlines for International have been moved to Don Maeung It is much better than sitting in a taxi to get into the centre and much cheaper

title: Way to go!
review: Forget taxis dump the Limo leave the bus stop and grab this  40 THB and it is the FASTEST and most comfortable journey into the city (and return) Just brilliant

title: Super fast
review: This is a high speed transport almost every moment is had forgot to take a breath If you want to try I think you should as you will receive a lot excitement

title: Best and quickest way from airport
review: At only 45bht a ticket you can't beat the price as an airport transfer I would bet to say it's the quickest way in to town as well skipping traffic

title: Simple way to get from airport to the city!
review: I get the Airport Rail Link every time I visit Bangkok Its really simple to navigate has AC is really clean and comfortable and doesn't take longunlike a taxi Also its cheap what more could you want

title: the independent rail....
review: the train is good clean and goes to many parts in town  connects at the end to the BTS and the MRT at Makkasan Station  1 reminder thou the BTS uses 1 type of tap card the MRT uses a different type of tap card and so those the Airport railway

title: Easy to use
review: This is easy to use but you need cash It accepts thai baht However the stations are not well connected to the other lines So some walking is needed If you have big bulky luggage it will be annoying During peak traffic hours the train gets packed so becomes difficult to manouver out with even small luggage

title: Very convenient
review: My hotel advised how to reach hotel from Airport and highly recommended travel by Airport link express Convenient and reasonable45 Bhat for one way full journey Only problem is while returning specially during afternoons and evening when local commuters use service in great nos Suggest during peak hours one coach is reserved for Airport travellers with luggagewill be of great help

title: Travel from airport to shopping mall
review: Very quick and cheap way to travel to downtown and shopping mall from airport Scenic Would recommend Traffic is very congested Best use of time is rail link

title: A little plus from Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: From Suvarnabhumi Airport you can choose this type accomodation to the heart of Bangkok Clean and Comfydon't worry about luggage as long as you can carry and drag this place have lift This ARL also more cheap than you go by TAXi if you travel alone or two

title: 40 baht!
review: This is the only way to do it when landing in Bangkok much much better than grabbing a taxi much quicker to Right into the heart of the city with no traffic problems and all the onward travel optionsconnections you could want

title: Very handy way to get into town
review: For Baht 45 one way you are transported from airport to a station on the Sky train route and from there most places in town easily accessible The train has several stops but all required info is clearly ser out on train Just a pity you cannot use your Sky train stored vslue card on the airport train  you must buy a special token  all pretty easy

title: very fast, very reliable
review: By far the cheapest and fastest way to get into bangkok from the airportwhy sit in a 2 hour traffic jam when you can be in the heart of bangkok in 30 mins

title: My only issue is dragging luggage on the streets to switch lines
review: Trains are clean Travels fast and intervals are not long My only issue is dragging luggage on the streets to switch lines

title: brilliant
review: an easy cheap way to get into the city we landed in the afternoon peak hour traffic so caught the train so esay no traffic jams connected to the BTS to travel to my hotel

title: Airport easy way
review: Nice and easy way to reach BKK airport Cheap and the best way between I can recommed it From 6 am to midnight

title: Makes Travelling to Bangkok Much Easier
review: Easy for travellers to do transfers from airport to the city It is linked to the BTS and MRT train stations and it makes travelling to Bangkok so much easier It is a smart alternatives to bus and taxi and keeps you on budget

title: super convenient
review: super convenient for your to reach the city center which you dont have to do much walking in the airport this rail link brings you straight to Phaya Thai for transit you can the hop onto BTS or bus or whatever your transport maybe

title: Highly recommendable
review: The airport rail link is indeed recommendable it is the fastest and the cheapest way of getting into the city centre Numerous stations allow you to exactly plan your itinerary depending on where you want to go

title: Don't even think about a taxi
review: Super practical way to and from the new airport Having taken it when I first arrived I can't think of taking a taxi to the airport anymore It's fast and comfortable and will get you to central Bangkok and after an elevator and a bridge you can extend your journey on the subway And if the subway doesn't get you close enough to your destinatiion you can still connect with the BTS I took all three when I arrived and "landed" 5 blocks away from my hotel and only spent 100 Baht (thus saving 400 from the usual 500 Baht taxi ride) This being Bagkok anything is better than ground transportation

title: Best transportation from airport to downtown
review: Though the Express line is suspended the City line is still fast enough to get us to downtown and no more worries about traffic jam and tricky taxi drivers

title: Easy to get to/from the airport
review: If one lives near the main station it is a great value  I have taken it a couple of times but I was travelling light  The point is that afterwards you have to take a cab and depending on the time of arrival it would be better to take a cab from the airport

title: Better experience than BTS
review: The vending machine accept 100 Baht note and it's more convenient for travellers Meanwhile the airport rail link vending machine provides with multitickets function The stations in between takes approximately 35 minutues for one stop

title: Excellent option to go to Pratunam area
review: We reached the airport early in the morning on the last day of our stay in Bangkok deposited our bag at the left luggage area and caught the airport rail link to Rathchaprarop station which is very near to Platinum fashion mall did 7 hours of shopping and returned just in time to checkin my flight The frequency of the trains is good slightly crowded takes 45 mins from airport to the last stop

title: Cheap, fast, and reliable.
review: We have used this service several times ( with and without suitcases) and it does work well It gets crowded on the train with all the commuters but just shuffle around and you will be fine It is faster and much cheaper than a taxi and it feels a bit more adventurous

title: Fast. convenient and lot cheaper than a taxi
review: Best and cheapest way to get to and from the airport to get into the city or interchange with the BTS Only problem it does not run between midnight and 6am but in peak hour it is the fastest way to get to the airport and the cheapest Not many taxis like putting on the meter going to the airport in peak times Use it when ever I can

title: Much better ( and cheaper) than a taxi.
review: Having suffered at the hands of the airport taxi drivers on  a number of occasions ( meter not working going a long way round etc) we decided to use the airport rail link to get initially to Phya Thai station Clean cheap and easy to use Cost us about 45 baht each ( ticket machines easy to use and both English and Thai language available) We didn't have any luggage which made it easier although we saw a number of passengers with large suitcases Trains run frequently so there is never long to wait Announcements are made in both English and Thai and are visually displayed as well   Was much busier later in the day on our return to the airport but nothing like the London underground at rush hour The journey from the airport to Phya Thai took about 20 minutes Would certainly use the rail link again

title: Dont bring so many lugage
review: Make sure if you use this airport Rail Link don't bring so many luggage if you are transferred from BTS to the Airport Rail Link you have to walk down under the tunnel and quite far Beside you cant bring trolley with you meet with many people on the que So make sure you are not bring so many luggage and boxes Something if you took from the airport if you do bring luggage just switch over to taxi instead

title: Great way to get to and from the airport
review: Firstly its cost  its cheaper than the flag fall on a Bangkok taxi and mostly times its far quicker to get into Bangkok or out to the airport at peak hour But it does have its drawbacks especially if you are carrying luggage Get a taxi when you get off

title: Easy travel
review: When we were doing our research on Bangkok we came across the ARL and after reading enough about it we decided that we can definitely use the ARL as opposed to the taxi service  Yes it is way cheaper than booking a private taxi and that really works especially if you are traveling on a budget It also gave us a first hand experience of Bangkok it's infrastructure systems and people on day one itself  We traveled between the Suvarnabhumi Airport and Makkasan If you know where you want to get off then all you need to do is check the maps which are marked very clearly and in detail  There is no confusion when getting the tokens from the self service machine or looking for which platform you need to be at to board the train in your direction Everything is well laid out  Getting on and off the train is also very convenient as people are more relaxed and follow a proper queue system Most of the passengers were busy with their own thing conversations cell phones etc   It is a great way to look at the city from above and the sights are very attractive I particularly found this entire stretch (sorry do not know the name) that had beautiful homes with red roofs and interspersed with trees Just made me want to get off and stay there So if you can then definitely do this train journey standing and not sitting  The announcements are clear and so there is no chance that you will miss your station People were polite and didn't really catch anybody staring  If you have too much luggage or too many children (who are already getting tired and cranky) then maybe you can skip this and do it another time  The coaches were very clean and well maintained You can look up the detailed information on their website httpwwwsrtetcothen or read more about them at httpsenwikipediaorgwikiAirport_Rail_Link_(Bangkok)

title: smooth and efficient
review: Love love this airport rail the fastest way to Bangkok city without the hassle of bad traffic and grabbing a cab This airport rail is linked to Phaya Thai BTS which took us directly to our hotels Perfect

title: Convenient and economical airport transfer
review: I used the airport rail link from the Suvarnabhumi airport to Phyathai Station then transferred to taxi to go to the hotel I did not only save time due to heavy traffic in Bangkok I also saved money Besides I also used the airport rail link to connect to Pratunam market and Platinum Mall via the Rajprapop station which is just about 10min walking distance

title: Convenience
review: used this Reil connection to the airport and my experience was great you can clearly hear all the stops the train is clean and not crowded but also fast (aproximately 20 minutes from PHA THAI to Airport) and the value for money is fairaround 42 BHT As compared to road link traffic is so unpredictable in bangkok With time sensitive airports  you wouldn't want to get into serious pressure and get stressed to getting there on time Rail connection should be into your Plan A means  Enjoy

title: fast and reliable
review: the best option by far to go to Suvarnabhumi airport Do not even ATTEMPT to go by road The traffic snarls in Bangkok are legendary and the last thing you want to experience when you are rushing to catch your plane

title: A peaceful and jam free travel
review: I was on the trai just before my flight to  Yangoon I was able to reach well in stipulated time No tension hurry bury or anxiety about the long stops & traffic  jam I landed well ahead of the time  A great and peacefull  to air port

title: Very nice, clean and good service
review: It's a very nice and clean Moreover it's a great facility and service for travelers It's very convenient for people to go to the airport as well

title: Efficient travel
review: Great service to get to and from airport with links to other train routes Never have to wait long and a good price that cuts out the necessity for expensive airport taxis Staff at airport helpful in letting you know what stop to get off

title: Fast connection to the city for no money!
review: Where every you go you should take Airport Rail Link to connect to BTS and MRT in BKK It is cheap and fast and you can go to most places You can also take the boats on the Klongs to connect to BTS and MRT

title: Cost Effective
review: An efficient and well maintained and run system  what a shame that at the city end one then has to deal with fraudulent taxi drivers who don't want to use the legally required "meter" system so loudly advertise don top of their taxis

title: Best travel to and from the airport
review: Best way to get from the airport to Bangkok It is efficient and very clean It is also way cheaper than taxi a taxi It is convenient in that it leaves from the basement floor of the airport and runs pretty regularly

title: Best way of travelling to airport
review: Best way to reach airport is to board this one Economic deal with all the comfort and time saving option of reaching airport

title: Easy transport to downtown.
review: Excellent service into downtown Bangkok Affordable and comfortable Easy to access to and from airport

title: Very Helpful
review: It is very helpful to ride airport rail link you can go to the city easily without traffic Easy to use and it is also connected to the BTS I enjoyed it

title: Great alternative to Bangkok taxis!
review: Fast and efficient and no need to deal with those dangerous taxis and their belligerent drivers The ticketing system is easy to use and help is at hand if you get stuck

title: Take the train from airport to city, much better and cheaper than taxi,
review: Excellent means of travel from Airport to city ie Paya Thai and Ratchaprarop best way to avoid traffic

title: Travel fast.
review: Travelled on the Airport Rail Link several times Fast efficient clean on time easy relaxing as to driving in mega busy Bangkok Cheap and easy to purchase yellow button ( which is the ticket) Simply  GO GO GO Luv it

title: Easy access
review: Located only at Suvarnabhumi Airport basement and easily access to town area They only have 8 stops

title: Very convenient way to go to the centre
review: At first I and my friend feel a bit wary to take this train to the centre of city because we travel with quite heavy luggages But it is an wonderful experience We dont meet any problem with this Even when we change the Link to MRT this is also convenient with the very good walk way between to stations You can save a lot of money comparation with taking a taxi from airport to hotel Highly recommendation

title: Reliable and recommended
review: Leaves frequently not busy easy to reach main city Ideal and saves money compared to taxi but only runs from bkk to central bangkok

title: Very clean and safe transport
review: The aiport rail link is a high speed one stop trip to a transit hub just outside of the downtown it runs on a 20 miute cycle and quickly and silently speeds you to and from the airport I do believe it should run 24 hours a day with service not end  as it now stops at Midnight It also starts up at 600 am but a lower speed local train operates 24 hrs

title: Best and most inexpensive way to get to airport
review: Airport Rail Link is quite convenient and easy to use The service is very reliable and not expensive It saves you from having to sit in traffic and dealing with taxi drivers trying to rip you off The ride is comfortable and arrives there quickly There are also some station that connect to local BTS & MRT stations

title: nice ride
review: nice trip here every the time   cold ac and a quick trip to and from the city   rush hour can be a bit like a sardine can but what can you expect in a city of millions of smiling people

title: Fastest link between Suvarnabhumi and city
review: Quick and easy avoid the taxi and take the airport link direction citycentre It's simple and cheaper than taxi (45 baht one way app 45min and the express is 90 baht)

title: Handy and inexpensive
review: I would recommend this instead of a taxi Cheap and easy to use Easy access to the BTS The ticketing agents will tell you what stop you should get off at to change over to the BTS

title: time to airport
review: good tranportation short time less than 45 minites easy to access city from Suwannaphumi International Airport(BKK)

title: Economical.
review: Fast and economical  Good choice if you are close to one of the stations but for a group of three or more cost Is about the same for taxi

title: Easy Access to BTS
review: This was easy to use to get to the BTS lines  I'd say just buy the Rabbit Card right away so you don't have to wait in lines using tokens

title: Fast and easy to use!
review: Great way to get to your hotel from airport plus it is inexpensive  go to lower level of airport there is the boarding platform  Buy one token depending on where you are going insert into turnstile and you are all set  You do have to wait to get on train When train arrives the police do a check of the train before you can board Only takes a few minutes Very easy to use if you need help just ask many people will be able to direct you

title: Skip expensive car rentals
review: If you have a handy luggage take the airport rail link instead It's economic fast and safe Perfect alternative to expensive car rentals and Bangkok traffic jams

title: Good service
review: Suvarrnabhumi Airport located at south east Asia bangkok Thailand is very beautifulArchitect structural design is amazing coupled with friendly immigration & English speaking staffs that smiles at strangers like as if there is no worries in their livesit has waiting & departure loungeit has banks readily to attend to your financial transactions and taxi's waiting to take everyone to their final destinations in summary i had a pleasant experience at Suvarnabhumi Airport Thailandi love Thailand  Land of smiles and beautiful women

title: Excellent way of getting to town
review: Quick efficient and it beats the traffic Bangkok is famous for I cant see myself getting from the airport by any other means unless you have heavy luggage or you travel off peak in the morning when traffic is not heavy

title: Quick, fast, convenient
review: We took the Airport Rail Link from Suvarnbhumi airport which is at the B1 level Ticket vending machine is easy to operate since you can choose English language n it accepts notes Frequency of the train is good n the stations are clearly announced while in the trainNot crowded so easy to commute even with your luggage  n you pay a fraction of what you will end up paying if going by a taxi the maximum fare being 45 bahts which is to the last station of Phayathai

title: Cheap alternative to take from airport
review: You can take their airport rail link from airport to pratunam if you are staying at the area Very cheap and fast compared to taxi from airport Try not to take this transport back airport We nearly couldnt make it as we met their peak hours and the cabins are always full or block

title: On The Move - ARL City Line
review: A great solution I need getting to and from Suvarnabhumi airport I do not need to worry about dirty cabs their AC's usually not cold enough in the humid Bangkok weather expensive cab fare horrendous traffic jams Easily accessed from the basement (B floor) of the airport with signs pointing the way from the upper floors

title: Efficient
review: Does what you expect it to About 45 minutes from Phaya Thai (the end stop) to the airport at the other end of the line Good value

title: saves lot of time and money
review: Each time I visit Bangkok I take this train from the airport This is very convenient and in about 30 minutes you will be in Bangkok

title: Efficient, quick and cheap!
review: We caught the rail link when we arrived in Bangkok  we only had a 10 minute wait  the train was clean and quickly took us to our link with the MRT  impressed It was also very reasonably priced

title: Convenient and fast
review: It is a perfect mode of transport to the airport and staff are always there to assist if needed Clean easy to navigate affordable and fast

title: Quick and cheap
review: Just as the title says really easy to buy "coins" which you use as a scan for the electronic portals It's really fast and cheap compared to taking a taxi

title: Fast and and quite cheap rail link
review: Very cheap and fast way to get to the Bangkok airport only 80100 baht per person it will take you from central Bangkok to the airport in no time Very spacious trains very clean and westernised you will arrive in the airport ground floor inside the airport not outside Extremely convenient and fast

title: Best way to get into Bangkok
review: This is the best way to get into Bangkok and probably the quickest and cheapest Super clean very efficient if only public transit systems in other countries were as good as this

title: Forget the Taxi's
review: Don't get a taxi and don't let a travel agent talk you into buying an overpriced transfer  The Airport Rail Link is the fastest way to get into Bangkok and back to the airport  We used the link in June & July for 45 Baht each way per person  The trip took about 30 minutes  The trains are air conditioned and it was easy to get a seat  From the airport you can go straight to Phaya Thai station and connect with the BTS

title: Quick
review: Taking the rail link is a cheap and quick way to get to the airport It can get busy at certain times of the day

title: Best way to commute to Bangkok
review: Given Bangkok's traffic is notoriously bad the best way to commute into town from the main airport  Suvarnabhumi Airport  is the Airport Rail Link For 45 baths you can get to Phaya Thai station where you can then get on the BTS  the skytrain that serves most of central Bangkok The airport rail link is highly recommended as it only takes 30 mins from the airport to the city

title: The easiest route to town
review: Easy to figure out cheap and fast way to the city center It took almost to the front door of the hotel

title: Airconditioned and super fast!
review: The Express link gets one into BKK city in less than 20mins  It's super fast faster than getting into the city using taxi One can even avoid the nasty traffic jams in Bangkok Highly recommended

title: Fast, Easy, cheap great
review: To get to and from the Suvarnbhumi airport In bagkok the cheapest  fastest way is to take the Airport Rail Link It starts from the Airport basement level and is very fast It connects you to the main Bangkok area (Sukhumvit) and from there you can take BTS or MRT to your destination

title: Convenient
review: convenient and cheap for travellers to suvanabhumi airport easy to use but you need to purchase ticket you can't use the rabbit card

title: Best way to get to city center.
review: Fast cheap comfortable  It leaves from airport and takes 30 minutes to get to center with 110 price of taxi

title: Its the best way to commute between airport and Bangkok city!
review: The hotel where I was staying recommended  using rail link to avoid late evening traffic clog of Bangkok city They suggested that I take a taxi to Phaya Thai station from where the rail link starts The fare to airport is 45 Baht and it took around 2030 minutes to reach airport The train travels overhead and is quiet organized   certainly better than taking a taxi to the airport  Do remember that the train doesn't operate after 11 PM

title: A wonderful addition to Bangkok's many attractions!
review: As a longterm visitor to Thailand I have spent many hours of my life sitting in horrendous traffic jams on my way to the airport biting my nails with anxiety about missing my flight  The Airport Rail Link has changed all that  As a frequent traveller I chose my current home in Bangkok based on the link and can now leave the house 30 minutes before I want to be standing at check in  No more stress  No more wasted time in traffic  And the incoming journey is even better knowing that I can be home within 30 minutes of picking up my bags  Furthermore the service is incredibly cheap (less than £1) clean comfortable and reliable  It makes going to Bangkok so much more pleasant that it used to be

title: Quicker and cheaper than a taxi
review: When you arrive at savanapoumi airport just get a lift to the basement and follow the signs for the rail link to Makassanonly 30 baht

title: Best way to go to the city
review: The easiest convenient traffic jam free and economy way to go direct to the city from the airport If you are not a fan of taking taxi this is your option

title: Simply the easiest and fastest way to the airport...
review: Traffic in Bangkok is a bit crazy so if you don't want to risk missing your flight the best fastest and cheapest way of getting to Suvarnabhumi Airport You can see timetables using this link httpwwwsrtetcothen

title: Quick, cool, efficient way to travel from the airport
review: this method of transport sure beats battling traffic in a taxi it's very cheap plenty of room for luggage Just google the nearest stop to your hotel and enjoy the 5 or 10 minutes walk to your hotel taking in Bangkok's culture noise smells and fun

title: FAST AND EASY
review: Had a night flight out of Bangkok Suvarnabhumi Airport and a whole day to kill so I put my bags in left liuggage and took the Airport Rail Link into Bangkok City Terminal and on to Sukhumvit Road for some shopping  The Airport to city terminal experience was really nice and the train carriages were really clean and fresh I bought a return ticket which cost 300 baht or about £600 UK  it was about a 15 minute trip each way and was well worth the price a taxi would coat about 400 baht each way and you also have to brave the bangkok traffic  Which can be horrendous at times I would recommend the train as a fast and cheap way to the city

title: Cheaper and Faster way to Bangkok City Center from BKK International Airport.
review: The Airport Rail Link is a good ay to get from BKK (Suvarnabhumi International Airport) to Bangkok City Center and connect with the BTS (Elevated Train) or take a taxi and save the hazel of taxi stand at BKK This is best if you have little luggage Apple has an App Bangkok Transit TH It will show where the BTS and MRT(Subway) routes go

title: Easy and fast
review: The Airport Rail Link take you to and from the Airport The Rail link is underneath Bangkok International Airport and can take you into Bangkok city for around 75 Thai baht Very safe

title: Cheap clean and relatively reliable
review: It's only 45baht (around 85p$13) for a single trip takes around 2530 mins but you get to see lovely views of the city and literally save hundreds of baht compared to taxis

title: Simple, easy and cost effective
review: I was a bit nervous about using the Rail Link and connecting to the train but it was actually really simple Signs everywhere and you can ask the staff if you're a bit lost It works out so much cheaper than a taxi if you're travelling alone

title: best way to get the city
review: we loved the link no worries about traffic if you go to a city hotel its better to take the rail link and reach out to the city and you can take a tuk tuk to the hotel if that is far from the station

title: Best rail in Asia
review: Cheap clean timely transportation to and from the airport No problems using it finding it or paying for it Nuff said

title: Awesome, convenient and cheap as
review: So very well organized clean cheap and safe Great service to the airport It does get busy in peak times but you don'[t have to wait long til the next train Easy to purchase tokens and understand the rail system and stops Gee Melbournes rail system could learn so much from Bangkoks

title: Cheap and fast way of to & fro from Airport
review: Saves  a lot of time and money specially if you are travelling for Holiday and do not want to spend a lot on taxi you can easily take Airport Link The best part is it starts from inside the Airport itself you need not go out Very convenient

title: super convenient
review: convenient and quick to get you to the city centre it is clean the train has enough space for luggages and it is very cheap

title: Must-use!
review: The absolute cheapest and quickest way to get into the city 4050 bhat into the city It gets busier as you get further from the airport so best to not have too much luggage

title: Much cheaper and economical means of transport to the Airport
review: The hotel we were staying at asked for 1200 THB the taxi we came in from Airport to the hotel took 350 (exclusive of toll) but it took me 87 THB to get to the Airport via the BTS (42) and Airport Rail Link (45) Go to Phaya Thai (N2) station of the BTS and then go downstairs and on your East will be the Airport Rail Link Phaya Thai is the first station of Airport Rail Link but still it will get you there on time no extra charges and drops you right inside the Airport

title: Great service.
review: Great system and so cheap but beware the express one does not connect easily to the rest of the Sky Train system I would recommend getting the slower one for 45 baht that takes you to Phaya Thai and a very short walk to the BTS system

title: Airport Rail Link
review: Fast comfortable and efficient There are two types of train here Rapid and normal all at low prices Cheaper and faster than taxis Avoid peak times 710am and 47pm

title: "Fastest way to go to international airport"
review: A lot easier and cheaper to go to international (Suvarnabhumi) airport from the city It might get crowded along the way as people take this tofrom work but it's more convenient rather than taking bus or taxi the traffic here takes forever

title: Fastest and cheapest way from airport to center of city
review: Wow This was simply the best method of going to airport to center of city in under 30 minutes and only for 45 baht Take this over any taxi

title: Fastest way to get to the city
review: It's the best way to avoid the traffic Keep in mind to go almost anywhere you have to switch lines at least once And you can't buy tickets just once to reach your destination which is a bit of an inconvenience when you have luggages

title: excellent and cheap
review: great option for getting into the city  from the airport and links with the Skytrain and BTS systems  for central hotels  not to be used for direct travel to Khao San Road area

title: Often more convenient and quicker than a taxi
review: I switched to taking the airport rail link from taking a taxi It is often gets you to your destination more quickly than a taxi with good connections to Bangkok's other elevated and subway rail systems

title: Great way to take you the city
review: it was my first time to take this train from the airport very easy convenient and most economical way  Easy to follow directions and really cheaper than taxis  Announcements made in Thai and English Passengers well behaved and friendly  Highly recommended

title: Take the train!
review: Great way to get into the city particularly in peak hour when you can sit in traffic for hours without moving

title: Best option into Bangkok from the airport
review: Please AVOID the taxis when coming from the Airport into Bangkok You will be scammed and you will be stuck in traffic This is the best option for less than £2 Air conditioning and timely a pleasure

title: Reliable, predictable, saves money
review: Get through the passportcarouselscustoms hassles then get some local money at the exchangerip off rates so don't change muchsay Aus $50 max will be enough to get tickets from the booth near platforms Follow the signs to basementthere are 2 choicesexpress or normalexpress wasn't running so we got the other one No problemscost 40 bahts per personabout Oz  $250bargain Cases next to you as you head to your stopall stations called or you can follow the signs on network map above doorstoo easy

title: Best way to reaching the airport
review: Love the Airport Rail Link the best way to reach the airport when you are travelling light it is fast has great frequency of trains throughout the day and the quickest way to reach given that the airport is around 25 kms outside the city the only con is it not a great way when there is lots of luggage

title: Easy way to get to the city from the airport
review: The Airport Rail Link is a wonderful way to transit from the new airport to the city There's a stop train and an express train I've been to BKK several times and never found the express train running Not sure what the schedule is But the stop train doesn't take too long Train connects to other systems like BTS conveniently

title: Gala Ride with airport link
review: Very convenient clean and fast transport to reach city from Airport Even a first time visitor can understand the route with the Map and it cost only THB 45 from Airport to city with 20 minutes great rideWith Bangkok traffic this a boon to tourist

title: Easy
review: An easy way to travel when you know where your going much quicker than a taxi a probably a lot cheaper

title: Efficient and cheap
review: Great way to get arpound Bangkok to most major areas I use this often to go to places within Bangkok and then walk where necessary  Efficient and cheap

title: ARL Bangkok
review: This is a brilliant service not busy at all as locals feel it's too expensive for them but most European tourists find it reasonable and it links with the sky train so you can get pretty much anywhere in the city

title: Really easy
review: Ok you buy a token at the airport 45 Baht Only the stopping all stations line runs despite all the brochures but thats fine Takes you into the city area where you can connect to other transport services Would never use a taxi again Help desks located at station in Airport terminal

title: Perfect escape
review: The ease and affordability of this service  Can be crowded but still beats traffic in a taxi  We were lucky to get on at the first station of departure and it was still standing room only It only takes 30 minutes Seats became available

title: Cheap way to town
review: Great to get into town if you don't mind changing the train with quiet a long walk in between don't forget the heat in Bangkok However its a fast and efficient way to get into the heart if Bangkok I actually went by taxi but my friend took the link and bts to sukhumvit well he was there faster then me

title: Long journey, but easy AC fast rail transfer
review: We were really tired after a long journey and it was tempting to jump into a taxi but the rail link is very easy to navigate It's cheap (45THB each £1) airconditioned and not at the mercy of traffic (a reliable half hour journey) We easily caught a taxi at the other end to our hotel

title: Boon for Solo travellers
review: 20 mins and you are in Suvarnabhoomi Airport What else you want when the traffic in Bangkok is crawling and require 15 hrs to reach airport from city centre Cost is  THB 40 where as taxi will take min THB 150 from city centre Stunning looks user friendly rail system courteous staff However travelling with huge luggage is difficult and thus its better if its less or light baggage

title: Convenient
review: Faster than a taxi for the location we were in (Makkan) clean great views cheap safe reliable easy

title: Very easy, but
review: Rail Link from the Airport to Phaya Thai is a winner and very fast and cheap BUT the airport staff need to be better informed  In very good English a staff member told me the line no longer went all the way to Phaya Thai which I knew was wrong On the Express Line you do have to change at Makkasan and that adds a few minutes and changing platforms But the end of the  line is definitely not closed

title: Quick and Easy
review: By far the quickest way to get between the airport and city centre  Traffic is pretty crazy in Bangkok so a taxi ride can take a long time  If there isn't a station close to your hotel it would probably still be a lot quicker to use the train and then take a taxi from the station

title: Convenient
review: It was so much easier than catching a cab We used it to and from the main Bangkok airport and found it fairly easy to navigate

title: Unbelievable deal ... but ...
review: make sure you are either just out of gorilla training (strength  flexibility to haul luggage) or carry one suitcase and one bag  do not take a lot  lots of up and down steps and hauling luggage (like Tokyo Station  kinda)  but no better deal for transportation to & from Suvarnabhumi than this

title: "THE" way to go from the airport to the city and back
review: Forget about taxis and limo's  Take the express (take the faster one) and you will be in the center of Bangkok in less than 20 minutes at the price of 80BHT

title: Fast and reliable.
review: Wonderful cheap way to go to the city center However if you are 4 people and have to take MRT or BTS after the Airport Rail Link a taxi will be more cost efficent

title: No Better Option
review: There's no better way to and from the airport  The express train is only good if you time it right  Their definition of express is one or two trains per hour  The express train is more comfortable and more like a real airport connection  The City Line is more of an urban rail line and is used by many locals as public transit so the trains can be crowded and there is no room for luggage  If you can time it right go for the express

title: Best way to travel
review: Fast takes you straight to your international terminal and reasonably priced Plenty of room for luggage and the platforms are well signposted

title: Excellent
review: Try this on the way from the Airport to your hotel if your hotel isnt in some remote location  The train is located just on the ground floor of the airport and is so easy  Their trains are so clean and modern and the train ticketer are a great help if you have the full address of where you want to go  If you dont want to do it just to save money do it for the experience We got to Bangkok International Suvarnabhumi Airport in the morning exchange currency then took the train to Islom our hotel was about a 5min walk

title: Best hassle free way into city
review: Best option from and to airport connects to MRT and MRT connects at some stations to Skytrain system Signage is great in dual language  English and Thai easy to follow No waiting in congested traffic

title: Easy
review: This was an easy trip with staff speaking English and offering help Thirty minutes to the last city stop we had a seat  but after a few stations the train got full some people were standing Staff on arrival were also very helpful and we got a taxi to our hotel

title: quick and easy
review: much underused rapid train travel from the airport to the heart of bangkok with no traffic jams   cheap and may still nean a taxi to your hotel but great none the less

title: The best way to get in and out
review: The Airport Rail Link is by far the best and the fastest and paineless way to get in and out of town The traffic in Bangkok is unreal Avoid taxis and buses at all costsTalking either the express or local line to "Makkasan" you'll will connect safely trough an upper bridge into "Phetchaburi MRT" station from there you can figure your way to your final destination pretty easily

title: Excellent
review: Great rail system Easy and economical English wording Acong with Thai make it easy Easy connection to the City

title: Quick, easy access to and from the City and Airport
review: Can be busy and overcrowded but easily managed Its only 45 Baht to  from the airport All up it took us around 30 minutes per direction

title: CLUTCH
review: makes life easy Fast clean air conditioned cheap Use it but try to get on at the first stop otherwise you may not get a seat

title: Express link at Makkasan station is the way to go!
review: The express link is very comfortable with cushioned seats It's not crowded I think I paid 90 baht Will arrive at the airport in 15 minutes

title: efficient way to get to central Bangkok
review: fast cheap clean and easy to use  I always use it and stay at a hotel nearby so it is a breeze to get to airport

title: Best way to the airport during rush hour
review: This is the best way to get tofrom the airport especially if your hotel (or your home) is close to the BTS line that connects to the Airport Rail Link  Not only is it inexpensive but its just 30 mins and reliable  A taxi could take 2 hours or more during rush hour (taxi early morning and late evening is more like 30 mins)  Its a pity the airport link express now doesn't run all the way to the BTS  though the local train does

title: The easiest way to get into the city
review: Who has been traveling to Bangkok already knows the annoying traffic jams all around town With the Airport Rail Link you can easily avoid most of this and just take the Skytrain to or at least to a location near your hotel If you choose your hotel to be near a Skytrain station you will never be wrong because this makes traveling and moving around town a lot easier Fares are very moderate and also taking luggage on the Skytrains is not a big thing as you have elevators or escalators at every station

title: Fast and efficient
review: The fastest and best way to get out of the airport Make sure your destination is near one of the stops or the stops connect to one of Bangkok's other public transport systems Public transport is world class

title: Quickest way into city
review: First time in Bangkok but so simple to use and a very quick & easy way to get into the city even with cases

title: The only way airport to BBK.
review: What a great service this is Direct into BBK no fuss no messing about One price for all that in its self makes a change Linking into other train services in BBK it is quick clean and efficient A win win for all

title: Easy to use, clean and safe
review: I boarded the Airport Rail Link at the BKK airport It was easy to find in the airport by following the signs Purchasing a ticket was easy and there was an employee there to help answer questions The train was clean and safe and I made it into Bangkok quickly If you can take this instead of taking a taxi I would recommend it The traffic was terrible when I arrived in Bangkok and the ARL got me into Bangkok without hassle I took a short and inexpensive taxi to my hotel at the end of the line

title: Excellent Service
review: Love the speed it gets you into town (as long as your destination is close by a station which mine is) Shame it get's so busy from the 2nd and 3rd stations into town

title: fantastic
review: if you pick a hotel close to transit routes simply only way to get to and from airports as long as you do not get in or out too late

title: Bangkok Airport-Transfer review - Impressive
review: This years  2014 i have been to Bangkok Thailand i used the Bangkok Airport Transfer serviced by searched from Google and found this company a bit scare to do the payment with this website as first time lol  but Luckily this company is real (Thx God) we have booked for 3 of us and the drive came on time also our name picking at the airport  The driver looks really kind but his English is not that good but still ok for communicated and he was trying to chat with us with us not sure his name is but would be great to compliment him if the owner see this review )   Love this company and will use it again for sure  httpbangkokairporttransfercom

title: Easy way to travel
review: This really is the easiest way to travel to and from the airport to Bangkok  It is so much faster getting into Bangkok than sitting in the notoriously bad Bangkok traffic

title: Cheap, fast, reliable
review: We didn't take the taxi from Suvarnabumi Airport to Bangkok downtown For 35thb pers and in 25 minutes the Airport Rail link is at Mahakasan Station close from the place where we wanted to go  Try it you will not regret

title: Useful transportation
review: We use it everyday when visited Thailand It was really useful and fast The only thing I think it's disadvantage is it will cost you a long trip even you drop at one of its destination

title: Great service and value
review: Took this train from the BKK airport into the city Nice and clean train and very quiet Saved me money and time vs taking a taxi into the city 5 Star Train Service

title: Great way to get to Bangkok city fromAirport
review: I travelled to Bangkok after a long time and was pleasantly surprised to see Airport Rail link It is clean and fast as compared to all the motorways and cheap too

title: Fast, easy and air con!
review: What isn't to like A fast easy mode of transport to the heart of Bangkok or to the airport Saves the hassle of taxis Cost no more than 50bht and all you have to do is sit and wait for you stop Much better than a taxi

title: Great way to get to the airport
review: I liked the convience of it and use it through links from BTS I wish it was all the same so I could use my Rabbit Card Always timely and clean

title: Great!
review: A really easy way to get to or from the airport It takes about 30 minutes to get to Makkasan Station from where you can get on the metro or in a cab

title: Best way to and from the airport
review: At 45THB this is the fastest and most convenient way to travel from directly within the airport terminal to central Bangkok and back For first time visitors take the blue line and you'll immediately be immersed amongst the locals which is always a treat when visiting a new city

title: User friendly train
review: This is such an easy public transport system to use Simply look at the map for your destination station which will then have the cost of your journey next to it Pay that amount into a ticket machine and you are given a plastic token allowing you to make your journeysimple I wish the train system here in Melbourne were as easy to use Very user friendly

title: This is hands down the fastest way into the city.
review: Very cheap fast way into the city You can take the city route which has about 5 stops or express all the way to the end There are kiosks and a service desk at every station Get with your hotel and ask if there is a station close so you can plan which stop to get off on Taxis and tuk tuks are at every station if your destination is to far We have used this service many times and it is the best fastest safest & cheapest way to and from the airport

title: The Only Way to GO !!!!!
review: Stay in Sukhumvit 50 bht taxi ride to sky train None stop 15 20 min service from Phetchaburi station to airport for 80 bht No worries about being late no crashes no motorway night mares The station is world class security staff and easy to understand instructions For me it is the only way to det to the airport

title: easy, quick, cheap
review: Great way to travel to and from the Survarnabhumi Airport and Bangkok city This along with the BTS is a great form of transport

title: Excellent, convenient and great value
review: Can only recommend it to anyone whether living in Thailand or simply just visiting Living on Sukhumvit this link simply connects me in the fastest way with the International Airport

title: Hidden gem!
review: I never thought to catch the train then we were like hey lets try it it only cost about $5 Australian so heaps cheaper than a taxi It was clean and only took about half an hour into the city I recommend it just make sure you have lots of 10 baht coins to pay for your ticket

title: big time saving
review: I travelled from the airport to the hotel and then back to the airport by Airport link Its cheap and very quick you will save a lot of time in Bangkok traffic Highly recommended

title: Clean fast and efficient
review: Used this method on my last trip Well worth it faster than taxi and did not struggle with my luggage I will certainly use it again

title: Cheap, clean & fast
review: Service is convenient cheap clean and fast The signs from airport to the station are well marked and staff always helpful

title: Easy travel
review: Give all those taxi touts a miss and go down to the lower level of the airport to catch the airport link train (it is well signposted) Travel is a fraction of the cost of a taxi and no sitting in the Bangkok traffic congestion the line links up to the skytrain rail line and the metropolitan line for onward travel

title: Perfect! No reason to take the cab if your hotel is nearby a station
review: Best possible standard No problems Airconditioned The Thais have invested in transportation Not just the Airport Rail Link but also the Skytrain and the Metro are all topnotch Much better in fact than in some European cities

title: Very efficient and reliable way to move
review: I wish there was an Airport Rail link from our other international airport (DMK) here in Bangkok because some times I just book a flight from BKK because of the Rail Link being so convenient to get in or out of town  Not only is it cheap but at rush hour when you see the taxis just crawling you are zipping by in a nice AC train without any worries about missing your flight  Coming from BKK the link is also very convenient because it links you to the BTS which in turns also links you to the MRT so you have pretty much the whole city at your disposal

title: my preferred transport from the airport
review: easy fast and cheap way of going to the city from the airport my friends and i have our baggage with us but the airport link is still the fastest and most comfortable option for us to go to our hotel in sukhumvit compared to a normal travel time of 1hr with taxi ride and fare of 300 baht the 60baht airport link plus bts trip of 45mins is certainly the best deal

title: easy to go to APT and express
review: good option to use APT Rail Link there have express train and normal train to go to APT and Siam Area and many hotel around platform

title: Stress free transport to the city
review: We liked nearly everything about this service  speed cleanliness price excellent assistance by transport police & ticket personnel & the easy transfer to the BTS (sky train)   We have been to Bangkok many times & after long flights from somewhere else have been frustrated by the extra time added to our journey by sitting in a taxi or airport bus for up to an hour getting to our hotel  This new link is excellent & we highly recommend it

title: Excellent
review: Fantastic what a simple way to get to the airport 90thb takes about 20 mins Aircon & very nice much better sitting in a taxi with drivers that doing know where there going & much cheaper

title: Save Some Money & Time
review: I visited Bangkok many times always used taxi form airport to reach city center and paid 400~600 THB for one way also waste a lot of time normally more than 1 hour to reach to siam square where I normally stay  This time just followed sign boards at airport and reach to railway station of airport rail link important points as below  1   just keep going down using escalators to bottom level 2   walk to the ticking machine and use 35THB coinsnotes 3   wait for train which I think come after each 15 mins 4   last stop is PAYATHAI leave this train & change to upper level for next train 5   buy another ticket for where you want to go around 10~15 THB & enjoy   Total time form airport to siam square was 35 mins including the time to wait for train and change of trains its extremely convenient and cheaper than taxi  I love to travel in bangkok sky train even I saw many tourist families traveling in this train

title: Not only cheaper but much FASTER than taxi
review: Traffic can be appalling in Bangkok so the most reliable way to go is using the Airport Rail Link You can get a express ticket or regular  I've only taken the regular Combined BTS and link leaving from the Sukhumvit area takes less than an hour Note the BTS and link involve stairs and a little bit of a walk between each other so if you're not up for that best go for an early taxi (in which you ALWAYS ask for meter on and take highway if they hesitate to put meter on get out)

title: Easy and quick way to travel.
review: This is the best way to travel into central Bangkok when you arrive or when you are returning to the airport after your holiday Very cheap and safe Don't get ripped off by taxis

title: Ideal way into the city
review: Having used taxis from both Don Mueang and now Suvanarbhumi this is a great way into the city  Trains are clean and frequent  about every 15 mins  and amazingly cheap if using the slower City Line Each time I've used it the train has been very busy which is a bit of a nuisance with luggage but go with it and adopt the Thai attitude of "sabai sabai" I always use the Makkasan terminal which as another reviewer has pointed out is near but not next to the Phetchaburi MRT station which requires travellers to make their way across a road and a railway track to reach it though it appears that a connecting bridge is being built (This is Thailand  don't expect UK  US style joined up thinking)  Makassan itself is a strange bard like place not easy to find your way around but there are people to ask  Cheaper and quicker than a taxi I'll continue to use this

title: Life is made much easier
review: Great way to travel from BKK airport to the city Despite weird logics of placing the terminal (Asoke) out of nowhere without (real) connection to BTS or MRT they have significantly improved quality of life for locals and foreigners alike Good that government realized and changed the hub to Phayathai where you can easily connect to BTS SKytrain Phayathai station  Now look at the grand infrastructure at Asoke it is such a shame that it was built without longterm plan  Anyway def a great infrastructure BKK has

title: Quite a decent Airport Rail Link
review: Facts (from my tired brain at 2 in the morning)   Cost 45 baht from Airport to the very end of the line It's slightly less if you stop at one the in between stops  Duration About 30 minutes (I think) from Airport to the very end of the line  The Good   1) Cheap and hassle free   This train is a direct train from the Bangkok Airport to the middle of Bangkok city I've used it twice Prior to that I used to take the taxi from the airport which used to mean running the gauntlet of taxi tauts and paying about 400600 baht depending on who you settled with and how much energy you were willing to spend bargaining  I hate the taxi tauts  2) Fast  Approximately half an hour by train or up to an hour longer if you take a taxi and get caught during peak hour traffic  3) Convenient Actually goes where it's supposed to  Unlike some airportcity links this one actually goes the to the city  and actually links to stations of the existing train lineok at the very end you have to walk about 50100 metres from the Airport platform to the BTS one but I mean thats not too bad for 45 baht  Think of it as exercise and part of the holiday experience  )  Compare this to the Shanghai high speed express does end near the existing train line but very far from city centre  and the Hong Kong Aiport Express where at some stops you need mini buses or taxis afterwards  4) Connects to the existing train line Just check the map to see which station to alight and if necessary transfer  5) You'll see locals  Most of the passengers appear to be Thai so you'll be getting the full Thai experience the moment you step from the airport  The Bad   1) No luggage racks in trains The trains seem to be regular passenger carriages so you just keep them next to you Not a biggie  2) There's no escalator or lift at the platforms  All above ground stations in Bangkok seem to only have stairs between the ticketing level and the train level (there are 3 levels street ticketing train)   This makes it inconvenient to lug around suitcases especially while the crowd is surging around you at the stairs  Still everyone seems to survive Again part of the experience  3)  Taxis  This next point isn't directly related to the Airport link since you'll have probably transferred to the regular train line BTS etc but it still is since it's a consequence of taking the Airport Link  You still have to get to you hotel right  If it's nearby to a station  you just walk to it  If it's still a bit of a distance or it's the middle of the day and it's Bl****y hot and even 100 metres seems too far then you're going to have to queue at the road and flag down a taxi or tuk tuk  Depending on the time of day or night this may take some time   This is the one advantage of taking a taxi driver goes directly to the hotel (assuming they know the hotel so many new ones have been built in the last few years I've found it common for them not to know it   Still I consider it to be part of the experience )  Gosh I didn't think I'd write so much for a train line Thanks for reading

title: great & quicker
review: great & quicker than taxi & cheaper no tolls to pay no traffic drops you straght at the airport wouldnt go any other way now

title: The best way
review: It is very good transportation way to go the downtown because it is linked with others BTS line Very convenience for tourists

title: Let the train take the strain
review: I get dropped at AL Latkrabang when returning to Bangkok after a few day's work It is very convenient and quick to get into the center of the city while watchinng the traffic jams on the motorway The cost is very reasonable Recommended

title: Efficient way to the downtown
review: Preferable way getting easily to downtown No waiting for ticket less people in train 🚆 no traffic jam waiting for train only 5 min and great value for money Recommended The way to ARL is well labelled from arrival hall

title: Excellent way to get to city center from airport
review: Only cost about 1USD to get to either the BTS (elevated trains) or MRT (subway)additional minimal cost Good to use if you do NOT have much luggageotherwise cumbersome Hours are limited till about 11PM

title: Confortable
review: A comfortable clean and rapid way to get the airport without paying an elevated price for the taxi

title: On time and clean
review: Love to travel with Airport rail link to avoid travel jam  Easy to access and on time  Can manage time easily

title: Excellent
review: Very easyand fast and we managed to get money back on our octopus cards when we got to the airport   Made going to the airport much easier

title: BEST TRANSPORT
review: You can reach almost everywhere from AirportArrangements of ticket kiosks and information with escalators is very convinient

title: Very nice
review: easy to use convenient and faster than getting stuck in very horrible traffic jams for hours Recommended

title: Bangkok Suvarnabhumi Airport Rail Link to Ratchaprarop Station
review: It was more economical and convenient to take Airport Rail Link to Ratchaprarop Station for 40 baht I was staying at Centara Watergate Pavillion Hotel so just walking distance from the station to the hotel

title: So handy
review: We can see there is huge expansion of BTS which will be fantastic when completed anything that stops you having to use the roads in Bangkok is a must and it will be amazing when it stretches out to Don Mueang airport the aircon is great even at Bangkoks hot and humid worst you can feel a little chilly Great value for money too

title: The most convinient way to reach the heart of Bangkok
review: I've been taking ARL every single visit to Bangkok The prominent station stops at the heart of Bangkok It is an alternative way to avoid the traffic to and fro the airport One recommendation is to take the ARL and then take a taxi or ehailing ie GRAB to your hotel if the station is not near your hotel This will reduce the cost and time You need not worry especially heading back to the airport as the traffic at Central Bangkok can be notorious during their peak hours

title: avoid traffic Jam on the streets
review: This is very good ways to move around the center of Bangkok and from the center to the suburban areas without traffic jam like buses

title: Cheap and simple
review: If you are keeping costs down on your trip this is the answer The rail link travels from the airport to the BTS station where you can sky train to your hotel The service is always on time and has great views of outer Bangkok as you travel towards the CBD I think in all ways it is comparable to any rail link in the USA or Europe

title: Easy
review: A great way to get from the airport to the city Good value at only 35 baht Regular service and seems very efficient

title: Great Service
review: I have used the airport link twice now & each time it has been faultless From the Airport to the center of town where you can connect to anywhere else using the BTS really is a greatfast & relatively hassle free experience Worth a try

title: Cheap, good and efficient
review: This probably the best way to go to the city from the airport it's fast it's cheap and it's efficient

title: Fast efficient service
review: Cheap clean easy and hassle free Good for our trip with children 4 and 8 Lots to see Train staff helped us understand how to travel and all in all better than the taxi

title: Cheap convenient and on time
review: This is by far the least stressful way of getting yourself to the airport  As an extra bonus you will get a nice view of Bangkok all the way to the airport 👌

title: Efficient and economical transit to/from Airport
review: You can use the Airport Link to get to any connecting BTS or MRT station and reach your hotel with ease We never had to use cabs or tuktuks

title: Great Inexpensive Transit to/from the Airport. but not Tourist Friendly
review: The Airport Rail Link is an inexpensive way to get tofrom the Airport The system does lack clear signage at the airport and lacks transit infrastructures at the stations (ie taxi stands maps signage Etc)  AllInAll not very Tourist Friendly especially for First Time Visitors

title: Always stay close to this line
review: Never stay too far from this line the traffic is terrible in Bangkokonly got 6 or 7 stations on this lineits very quick45 bhats from one end to the otherits cheap

title: super cheap and easy!
review: Located in the basement level of the main Bangkok airport is it is only 25Bht (eg just over an Australian dollar) to get into midtown Bangkok for example Petachauri station  It takes heaps longer to utilise a taxi but to be fair a taxi is only about $A30

title: cheap and easy to use
review: we use the airport rail link and we found very cheap and easy to use and very quick to get where we want tovery clean towould use it again

title: an inexpensive and easy way to get around.
review: We used this service to Bangkok airport and people were so helpful  Signs are in both thai and english  Would definitely use this service in future  (although after a long flighttaxi is so nice ()

title: Say to use.
review: Easy to make your way into the centre Clean uncrowded and aircon Cheap and quicker than catching a taxi

title: Easy rail link from airport Heathrow London to Paddington station
review: Easy rail link from airport Heathrow London to Paddington station  Book online for savings  on rail ticket cost  Quick reliable service to Paddington

title: Very convenience
review: Very good and converience in Bangkok but no traffic jam Reasonable price I get in from Makkasan station to Suvanabhumi Airport cost only THB 35 Highly recommended

title: Incredible, affordable, fast, covers much distance
review: I have used Airport Rail Link in conjunction with the BTS to go visit a friend that live on the very outskirts of Bangkok  It makes it so much better  It helps get there faster by avoiding extremely heavy traffic and very affordable about 40 Baht (under $150 US)

title: Efficient!
review: Convenient travel from Airport to City Centre Accurate timings and efficient way of travelling between airport to downtown

title: Traveling from Suvarnabhumi Airport to city center
review: Very convenient for traveling from the Airport to city center  Airport rail link will cost 45 baht from the airport to Phaya Thai station Then you can transfer to sky train from this station If you would like to transfer to MRT you can get off at Makkasan station then connect to MRT at Phetchaburi station

title: Excellent way too get around Bangkok!
review: We travel on the BTS every time we visit Bangkok as it is the easiest way to get around the city as well as one of the cheapest

title: Airport rail link, a great way of avoiding traffic in Bangkok
review: A great way of connecting the airport with the BTS network in Bangkok The tickets are cheap but the only downside is that you cannot pay with credit card  cash only

title: Easy and comfortable
review: Most tourist go for taxi at the airport as they are relatively cheap We always take this train  45 Bathperson and just 30 mins to the centre

title: Excellent connection
review: Excellent connection to and from the main Bangkok airport fast clean cheap and safe Highly recomended

title: Cool and quick
review: This is the only way to get around Bangkok if you are looking for the places to visit  After a heat stroke you can get on sky train and rehab with the air con

title: So quick and easy
review: 30 minutes from the airport to Phaya Thai interchange and only 45 bht per person  Not overly crowded nice and cool  What more could you want

title: Fast & Convenient
review: A very impressive service Much more affordable than a taxi & quicker than a bus A brilliant way to reach the airport

title: The way to get to and from the airport
review: We were going to take a taxi back to the airport till friend recommended the airport link Took the airport lonk at 11pm at night and it was busy but clean and quick and only 40 Baht each

title: Bloody Brilliant
review: The only way to get tofrom the international airport Cheap and efficient and turns run nearly every 5 to 10 minutes

title: Centralise and very convenient
review: I decided to do one thing I never did before on any travel On my last day of work trip I had about 8 hours free and I then bought a one day tourist pass and stopped at every few stations to walk around and gosh I really am amazed at what Bangkok can avail just all around the very BTS stations lined to the airport rail

title: Fast and on time
review: Reasonable price It takes around 35 mins from the airport to city Clear direction from airport express to BTS Better pre order the ticket from KLOOK

title: Recommended
review: Easily interchangeable with BTSMRT Lines Trains were running uninterrupted and very ideal mode of reaching townairport

title: Fantastic Experience
review: Amazing transportation safe and had some adventures Love the people who commutes everyday using Airport Rail Link

title: easiest way into the city
review: the train from the airport stops at a few stations the last one interconnects with the BTS the trip is fairly fast and efficient

title: Best choice for Suwannabhumi Airport
review: Single traveller with small luggage will prefer this transportation I took Phaya Thai station to the airport back and forth It was easy and save

title: handy service
review: Best service to move from Air Port into the City clean carriages fast service and stationd close to tourist spots

title: Thumbs up !
review: This is fun Jokes apart it's really comfortable and fast The travellers with connecting flights need to walk from 1 terminal to other The airport being really big the walking distance is too much The airport rail link makes it easier for us to reach a terminal in the other corner of the airport within minutes Absolutely hygiene and safe

title: Quickest way to the airport
review: ARL is a great option not to be stuck in traffic which can be super unpredictable in Bangkok It's also a lot cheaper and let's you out straight at the airport

title: Cheap and efficient
review: I think this is the best way to go to town Skip all the potential traffic jams in the city The Makkasan station connects to the MRT line and the last stop Phaya Thai station connects to the BTS

title: Save some money and time
review: This is an easy way to get downtown It links up with the metro system which can get you close to your hotel

title: I use always it !! no anymore taxi !!
review: If you not have too many luggages  use it to go to airport and or from airport to go to the center of Bangkokit is cheap and fast From Phya Tai to airport is 45 Thai baht for around 20 minutes

title: Forget the Taxi
review: If you're staying in the main centre of town forget trying to get there with a Taxi and take the Airport Rail Link It's cheaper and faster I'd only ever consider not taking this if I had masses of lugage

title: So efficient.
review: its a worth transport network to use traveler to conned=ct to Bangkok city from Airport  so efficient fact and worth for money consider with time saving compare with other transport medieas in the city

title: cheap, easy and fast
review: never again will i pay for a taxi from the airport in bangkok the AC trains leave on time and get you to the city centre very quickly  And cheap Just 35 baht Sukhumvit to airport

title: Cheap, efficient and quick route from/to airport
review: Myself and friend used this service twice from the airport into Bangkok for Rembrandt Hotel and to return to the airport from Rembrandt Hotel in the Sukhumvit district It is a cheap (35 Baht person) efficient and quick service

title: Convenient, cheap, fast and traffic-free!
review: Convenient cheap fast and trafficfree Although it can a little inconvenient for people who bought too many goods but they have elevators

title: Reliable mode of transport
review: From airport the rail link is the best mode of transport Price is most economical Can avoid the heavy traffic and reach your destination on time Plus it is well connected with BTS and MRT making it very easy for tourists

title: The best way to get into the town
review: The far best way how you can find yourself in Bangkok center Cheapest fastest airconditioned clean Skytrain Love it

title: Amazingly cheap transfer to the city
review: Catch the train from the lowest floor level It costs 44baht The ticket is a scannable disc which you can buy just before the entryThe machines here take notes unlike on the Skytrain where you need exact money  Takes approximately 40mins to Phaya Thai

title: Convenient and fast way out of the airport.
review: It is pleasantly fast and convenient to travel out of the airport If you are travelling light with children that can handle their own luggage this is a good and fast alternative to taking taxi But most of the time we have more luggage when we leave Bangkok so we would still take taxi on our way to the airport

title: Easy and cheap
review: Very convenient quick way to get to and from suvarnabhumi airport on the way from airport it could get really crowded during peak good in case you want avoid traffic on higway snd safe some cash for taxi

title: Easy way to the airport
review: This is the easiest way to get from the airport to the MRT or BTS and then to wherever your destination is or vice versa If I did my research well I would have not taken the taxi upon arriving at Suvarnabhumi airport I would have used the Airport Rail Link But I did when leaving Thailand From Phaya Thai BTS Station you can easily walk to the Airport Rail Link no need to get outside because it is connected to it The Airport Rail Link takes you directly into the airport

title: Airport transfer
review: Very handy for transferring from the airport to the BTS without having to queue in the city traffic Cost 45 baht per person from the airport to the BTS link so very very cheapway of getting to the city Just follow the signs from the arrival hall The train is on the very bottom floor of the airport

title: Fast and easiet mode to reach heart of city..
review: ARL run from Suvarnbhumi airport basement in every 1015 mins it is connecting to BTS (skytrain) from phaya thai Station you can interchange from phaya thai fare is 45 THB per person you can carry your luggage from airport in this you need to show your passport on interchange very fast and will take 30 mins only

title: Take the Link and Avoid a Headache
review: Sometimes luggage limits one's option for getting to and from an airport but if luggage permits take the Airport Rail Link for a fast and efficient comfortable and reliable mode of arriving stress free at the Airport

title: From Airport to City in No Time
review: Excellent service and truly helpful and very affordableReally a great and convenient service with efficient and helpful staff

title: Travel
review: Ive never experienced the most convenient way to go to and from the airport Airport Link in Bangkok is the fastest way to go to the airport and from the airport to the city or to move to another sky train to your destination but if your traveling with big baggages or loads of bags and your alone better yet take the taxi If your in a hurry to go to the airport take the link The train is spacious and fast

title: REACH DOWNTOWN IN A FLASH
review: This is the fastest cheapest and best way to reach Downtown You just need to check your Hotel on the map and find the nearest stop and then walk to your Hotel

title: Great way to travel. Fastest way to the city
review: Cheapest and fastest way to travel to the city centre even with luggage  Trip only cost me 45 bhat  Taxi would have cost you 100 times more  Quick link to BTS at the terminal station Phya Thai

title: Very fast. Good service. Convenient
review: Works like a charm and brings you downtown in no time compared to time If less tahn four also cheaper

title: Cheapest way to travel from the airport to Bangkok
review: We arrived early in the morning and took the ARL to central Bangkok  It was easy to buy a ticket very clean and easy to navigate the staff were very helpful with the gates as we had suitcases  It is definitely the cheapest way to get from the airport to the centre  We took a taxi on the return journey and wished we had taken the train

title: Easy travel to Bangkok City
review: We use the Airport Link train each time we go to Bangkok as it is easy and much  quicker than a cab I would recommend knowing where your stop is close to your accommodation and use the rail to get there and if need be catch a taxi to the hotel from your train stopmuch easier and cheaper

title: Easy and cheap transportation to/from Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: Easy clean and affordable transportation to and from Bangkok Suvarnabhumi Airport No hassle safe and very prompt I was very pleasantly surprised and will definitely prefer this method of transport over shuttle or taxi next time I'm in Bangkok

title: Thailiand sky train
review: People were very nice who were waiting for the train and on the train Everything was inorder  People waited in line (no one was rushing to get on or off  I was there in November 2016

title: very effective and cheap
review: I always take taxies from and to the bangkok airport I used the rail link once and discovered a very fast cheap and easy way to connect to the air port I didnt carry a large bag but escalators will make the trip easy for havy travellers as well some hours the rail link may be fpacked but it is only because of the goodlocation on the stations

title: Fast, cheap way to the airport and city center
review: Great way to get to airport and from there to the center 60 THB to the center I believe  Does run every ~10 minutes Quite busy in the morning

title: great price - super clean
review: Have caught this about 20 times over the years They no longer have the express but the ride is still quicker than anything else

title: very convenient!
review: easy and cheap the best way to go to the city center it takes only 3045 mins depending on where you are going

title: Once again easiest way to travel to hotel
review: Airport link is the quickest and most tassel way of travel from the airport to and from hotel  Used to use takes but find this easier quicker and cheaper

title: Easiest way to travel
