review: Trust me and dont take any other mode of transport from the airport to the city centre This is the cheapest and easiest to travel 45baht and ur there to city centre Takes roughly 30min but be sure to reach in time and not get stuck in the insane bangkok traffic

title: Fastest way into the city
review: The ride from end to end costs 45 bath pp and takes 30 min It departs every 15 min You can take the first train at 530 am from Paya Thai From the airport you need to get all the way down to B level it is fairly easy to find  The ride is comfortable easy to get into and efficient meanwhile the traffic outside is just at stand still

title: Very Nice and Comfortable
review: Its very Cheap Easy Fast Safe for budget travel it is very good for sure i would travel again when i go back to Bangkok

title: Awesome!
review: you can't be late to your flight by using this and it's fast rather than getting a bus or taxi price are reasonable I recommend this to all it is located on the basement of the airport you can check the signs on how to get there and it's easy to find

title: Very Convenient
review: This train service is faster than taxis if you are close to one of the stops Phaya Thai station is where it connects to the BTS line

title: Perfect way to travel from Airport to the city
review: I would highly recommend to take the Airport link to the people travelling from Airport to the Bangkok City We only had to pay THB 35 to travel to Makkasan which was way too cheaper than taxi as well as convenient It hardly took 2530 minutes for us to reach our place highly recommended There weren't too many people so there was no rush and enough space to carry our luggage

title: Peanut
review: It is easy to connect to BTS or MRT to city The first station is inside Suvarnabhumi Airport Easy to catch it from airport to city

title: Better than Taxi
review: I use this everytime when I go from the Airport tot he BKK city you og off at Phaya Thai and then change to BTS Its cheap and its fast less than 30 min form airport You will locate it on the lowest Level at the airport so you do not need to og out of the airport

title: Easy way to central Bangkok
review: When arriving at Suvarnabhumi airport with your accommodation in downtown Bangkok this is an easy and cheap way to get there Board at the airport station and interchange to the BTS Skytrain at Phaya Thai station which is two stops away from the main central Siam BTS station Airport Link trains run regularly but can be a bit of a wait between trains  as long as you're not in a mad rush this isn't a problem

title: A great introduction to the wonders of Bangkok!
review: An efficient mode to get into the heart of the city this was a simple and inexpensive and very efficient way to travel into the city of Bangkok Great to get some insights on the land the people and the customs too

title: best, safe and economical traveling option in Thailand
review: The vey best safe and economical traveling option in Thailand Train starts from airport itself I paid only 40 THB to my hotel if I catch a taxi they charge me around 600 THB to reach the destination ARL starts from early morning till midnight Best option

title: Easy access from Airport to City.
review: I bought my tickets online prior to my trip Just had to collect and show the tickets to the staff and they immediately let us pass through the side gate Make sure you keep the tickets (cos you're not given token) as you need it to show to the staff again to get out of the station A cheap alternative compared to cab But as the train is pretty small expect squeezing your way through

title: Transfer between the two rail systems
review: This is where you transfer trains between the two above ground transport systems of Bangkok  Be sure you are heading in the right direction before boarding the train since it can get confusing

title: Great connection to the airport
review: I love this alternative way of getting to the airport which saves a lot of time and money (considering Bangkok's taxis who overcharge for almost everything) The trains are clean and convenient However the stations are not really trolly friendly so take note of this if you have big luggage I wish though that they operated longer hours

title: Works very well
review: The staff will help you with all your questions within no time you are in the right train Within a very short time your are at the airport

title: Conviniente
review: super convenient if you arrive with Suvarnabhumi airport The lighter your luggage is the better though  Interchange with BTS as long as your hotel is next to a bts station you should take the airport rail link It’s 13 of the price

title: Easy, fast and efficient
review: Took the airport rail from airport to my hotel Easy and fast as I am staying at NASA Vegas hotel So it is only 4 stops away from my hotel  Easy and convenience Never had problems with the rail

title: Holiday
review: Very easy to usecomfort and cheap pricevery fast compare with another transportwhen i back home will recommend my friend

title: Best way to reach the city
review: Very accessible and cheap way to get into the city in no time You can access it from the ground floor of the arrival section Just follow the directions

title: Good service
review: Much cheaper than a taxi if there's just one or two of you  very easy to use  straight into the centre of town  I recommend it for your return flight  takes away the uncertainty and beats all the traffic

title: Easy to the airport
review: A cheaper alternative to the airport be aware that there is no lift or escalators at the interchange bts Phaya Thai other than that it is easier than being caught in bkk traffic

title: Fast efficient easy airport link.
review: This speedy airport train link misses all the peak traffic on the roads gets you to airport fast and easy access at airport

title: Quick and cheap
review: By far the quickest and cheapest way to get to Bangkok city centreTicket is only around 50 baht and you avoid all the traffic

title: Superb service
review: This is our preferred method of transport every time we visit Bangkok and it is excellent For less than 1 pound you can buy a token which is immense value and to off at any of its eight or so stops in the city itself  It is fast clean and very efficient It is security checked before you get on and you can fit as much luggage on as you need The stops are clearly announced and there are lifts and escalators to help you get around  Beats getting stuck in the incredible Bangkok traffic any day

title: Fast and smooth ride
review: Economic price to reach the city Fast and comfortable ride only 7 stations to reach the city in about 30 mins at 45bhat most importantly avoid the traffic jam

title: It's the best way to go to the city from the airport or vice verse
review: The train was comfortable and fast  There are a few stops but in general it takes about 30 minutes from the airport to the city center of Bangkok From there you can either transfer to a subway or take a taxi  It's very convenient and it is so affordable too

title: Excellent, efficient, frequent and super cheap
review: The airport rail link is an excellent efficient frequent and super cheap way of getting from Bangkok International Airport to the centre of town Ticket from airport to Phrya Thai (centre of Bangkok) is only 45 Bhat (US$ 136) and takes approx 25 mins  Trains are clean and with excellent signage  Various stops connect to the other Bangkok MRT  LRT lines making this an excellent way of getting around Bangkok  Not only an absolute steal but a great way to avoid the notorious Bangkok traffic jams

title: Convenient, frequent and cheap.
review: Lots of trains lots of information and staff Frequency of trains is excellent and fares are rock bottom We use it regularly when in Bangkok

title: Clean Efficent and Cheap
review: Nothing more to add The title says it all Way better and cheaper than trying to get a taxi and far faster from the centre of town

title: Easy and fast!
review: Better than BTS MRT etc Less crowded and much faster than taxi during peak hours Only downside is the waiting time i think its about 10 mins per train From airport all the way to city and link to other train network (BTS) along the way

title: Easy to use
review: It was easy to use when going out of the airport The transfer to Metro was easy to find The train was clean and fast enough We were lucky that it wasn't crowded early in the morning

title: August 2017
review: Very cheap and quick access tofrom airport and Bangkok Taxi took an hour to get to hotel because of heavy traffic but train took 20 minutes and only 100 baht Not very busy but onward taxi ride from  station may be necessary to get to hotel

title: Super fast and convenienct
review: The most convenient way for me when I travel to airport with fews luggage I normally took taxi to MRT Makkasan which is lose to my condo Then I continued in airport link for about half an hour This was fast and convenient The train was clean and super express with fair price Arriving at the airport was convenient and had not to worry about car parking and traffic congested at the drop off point as well as when I traveled back in town my mate can picked me at the Phetchaburi station or i could easily catch taxi from the station back to my condo Try and experience a new choice My Singaporean friend also love this method whenever he came to Bangkok

title: Cheap and great way to get into Bangkok
review: It's easier than it looks Just find your destination get your ticket (cheap) and hop on We had to get a taxi from our stop but the train took us most of the way there

title: Very convenient
review: You can find this basement level of Airport Every 30 min there will be metro It will lead to paya thai station which is interlinked with BTS METRO Before that from makashan station it will interlink with MRT LINE

title: Excellent service
review: Impressed with Airport rail link to Phaya Thai from Airport Runs regularly and air conditioned moving lots of people with good space Trip 45 baht takes about 30 minutes

title: Great, efficient way to get to centre of town
review: Easiest and quickest way to get to centre of town from airport Change at Makassan for Metro MTR or just get a cab from closest MTR station or get the express to centre of town and then a taxi (or any of these combinations Ticket machines (for token) take 100THB notes or change and are in English and easy to use 25 minute ride so try to get a seat at airport because at the first stop the train will be full packed with locals

title: Convenient and cheap
review: Very cheap option to get to the city At Makassan station (junction with Phetchaburi) there are yellow locker rooms so before leaving Bangkok it might be a good option to store your luggage there before you head to the airport

title: Definitely recommended in bangkok's jammed packed roads
review: Arriving at the international airport once you exit lookout for signs to the MRT go to basement level It's easy ride is clean and for a very populated city the trains are not overly packed Our ride from airport to makkasan city centre was about an hour cost only thb70

title: Faster and Cheaper
review: Bangkok is known for its heavy traffic so taking the Airport Rail Link is a faster and cheaper way from the airport to the city For hotels far from the stations you can take the taxis waiting at each station There are machines at the airport to purchase train tokens The passenger car is clean and spacious but many were still standing

title: Easy Peasy
review: Well signed and easy to access via any route on the BTS skytrain Cheap as it only cost us 57 Baht (less than $2 US) from downtown Bangkok Very reliable leaving about every 57 minutes Fast25 minutes from downtown Bangkok Clean and roomy with lots of luggage space Drops you right at the airport When you change ot the Airport line from any other station you have to purchase a round token that goes in the slot to enter You cannot pay a through ticket to the airport except at the beginning of the airport line Security checks occasionally

title: Quick way into Bangkok
review: The airport train was very good lots of room for your suitcase great way to get a bird's eye view of Bangkok on the way in A 30 minute ride Our hotel was Anajak Bangkok which was at the last stop & about a 5 minute walk to the door was very easy to get to Going back to the airport it became the first stop so easier to get a seat on the train

title: convenient for travelers
review: one of the best ways to reach the center from the airport Affordable (45 baht from airport to phaya thai) and hassle free highly recommended for tourists travelling to bangkok

title: Fast and Efficient
review: Cost about 25 to 45 baht per journey   Downside unlike train systems in other countries when you switch from BTS to Airport Rail Link you have to purchase a separate ticket

title: Excellent service
review: Stayed in Pratunam and caught the train from and back to the airport  Costs 40thb each way and takes about 30 minutes  Gets very busy with tourists and locals and you may not get a seat but the time goes quickly  Leaves and departs from the basement area at the airport and is very easy to find

title: Efficient and fast
review: Easy to use takes around 30 min with around 7 stops Costs around 45 baht per ticket Clean and efficient service

title: Affordable and fast
review: If you haven't tried using the ARL you're missing out It is much cheaper than normal taxis and is also fast and suitable for anyone There is no fuss and you get a bonus of being able to see the city and surrounding landscapes on the way Highly recommended as experiencing Bangkok's public transport during a stay is a must to me

title: Best way to Travel
review: Air port link is the best and cheap way to travel to and from Airport at  Phayathai Station it connect with Sky Train

title: Fast and cheap
review: If you are travelling with less luggage then definitely it is the fastest way to reach the airport from the city and that too economically

title: Dead simple way to get to central Bangkok from the airport
review: Why use a taxi when you can use this train Cheap quick comfortable And you get good views from the windows on the way

title: World class
review: I had to go airport in a rush Airport rail link saved my life It is fast and cheap way to go to the airport from the city center It goes to bkk not dmk 35 THB for 1 person

title: Cheap train ride to airport
review: From BKK airport to Phaya Thai we have to pay only Baht90 for 2 pax and took us less than 30 minutes with 7 stops Very convenient and link to BTS of Rachatdewi You may start your journey after the immigration go to B to take your Airport Rail Link It is so easy

title: Best way to reach the city.
review: If travelling light definitely use the airport rail link to reach the city  The station's airport entrance is on B1just keep going downdown the escalators  Ignore the taxi touts buy your tickets at the convenient machines (which operate in Thai or English)  and hop aboard   While travelling notice the fast developing Bangkok eastern suburbs from the windows and the commuters and locals coming into to work shop or socialise   On arrival in town (Makkssan) you can transfer to the MTR or BTS (Metro or Bangkok Sky Train) easily   If you have much luggage take a taxi (but insist "meter only")  Bon voyage

title: Best way to get from airport to city center
review: Easy cheap (4045 baht) and fast (25 mins from airport) Leaves from floor B (below the taxi floor) There's a small gap between platform and car for those with suitcases The station at Ratchaprarop has an elevator directly to street level

title: Fast and convenient
review: Coming from Manila I envy the Thai people because of this Clean fast and efficient to get to down town Wish our government could do something like this

title: Extreme Convenient to avoid traffic
review: I experienced the terrible traffic jam in Bangkok thus I choosed to use Airport Rail Link to avoid traffic jam and save my time   The price is fair and it is very convenient  It worth a 5stars review

title: Quick and easy
review: Great way to get into the city and link to the metro or Sky train  Cheap and easy to use  When you see the traffic on the roads on and out of the airport it's a must for travelling  Takes around 50 minutes and a taxi would take far longer Not what you want after a flight We navigated well as we were with our kids who are seasoned travellers and had had done it all before

title: Much, much cheaper than taking a taxi
review: Since the Airport Rail Link opened I always take it to get fromto the airport to SiamSukhumvitAsok where I tend to choose to stay  It's about 1 hour to get from the airport to Asok The same as taking a taxi But the ARL costs ~80 baht taking the ARL + BTS or MRT combined compared to ~400 baht (as of this writing) by taxi

title: Good ride
review: This train is a quick and economical way to get from the Airport to central Bangkok It connects to the Skytrain system at Phaya Thai station

title: Convenience of Airport Rail  Link
review: Airport Rail Link ARL was very convenient to tourist and cheaper only cost 40 thb from Suvarnabhumi StationAirport  to Ratchaprarop Station This station service closed at midnight

title: Easy and not so expensive way to get to Suvarnabhumi Airport or to the city
review: The Airport Link is an easy and quick way to get to or from Suvarnabhumi Airport It's less expensive than a taxi and no worries about the traffic

title: Easy to find and use
review: The airport rail link is very great depending on where you need to go of course I've had a hotel near Ratchaprarop station and therefor the airport link was the easiest and cheapest possibility for me  At Suvarnabhum airport the rail link station is very easy to find by following the signs all the way down to the bottom floor The ticket machines are as very easy to use and afterwards you just need to wait till your station arrives The announcements in the train are made in English as well and the next station is shown as well on the display panel

title: Budget and fast accomodation
review: The train will took you faster to the city center where you can connected with BTS to your preference location

title: Easiest way to get to the city from the airport and back
review: It's easy and cheap Avoid airport taxies and take the Rail Link which is well connected MRT and BTS

title: Easiest, cheapest way to get into the center Bangkok
review: It is easy fast and reliable Also fun and comfortable During rush hour can get a tad crowded especially with a big backpack Knowing where and how you are going is important if you are taking a bus onwards

title: Easy way to travel
review: In the airport and go down to the airport link The trains run regularly and are comfortable even with your luggage The longest part was waiting to buy a ticket

title: Easy to Airport
review: We used this on our outward trip via Makkasan station and Hua Lamphong underground line Very easy and much cheaper than taxi Cost 30thb for the rail link and about the same for the subway

title: Best transfer to Airport
review: This is the best way to go and come from airport Its cheap and easy to use No traffic trouble It takes arround 45 min to go from phaya thai So you can be sure you get your plane

title: Overcrowded in Betweeen, but Reliable
review: This train is great if you get on at the airport or at Phaya Thai because in between it's a suburban local train This means it will be difficult at any point in the day to get on this train if you're not at either point It is a big city after all  The train system doesn't use the Rabbit card but encoded tokens Flat fare for all one way of 45 Baht If you had one taxi in non peak if would cost you about 300400 Baht so you decide which works best for you   Bangkok jams are tough and real so you decide which is best depending on where you stay

title: Good value, efficient way of getting into the city. About TB 40 (£1) each way. Frequent, clean service.
review: Recommend this way of getting to and from the airport into the city Taxis available to meet trains if you have further to go

title: Great service from Bangkok Transport Railroads
review: It's comfortable  it's puntual it's on time convenient clean and always ready to take passengers from A to B

title: Reliable and fast
review: Took less than 30min to get from Phaya Thai station to BKK airport Train was clean and crowd was reasonable ~740am in the morning

title: Efficient and clean
review: A cheap and effective way to get to the airport 45 bat per person for a ride from Phaya Thai to the airport in a way that beats the traffic However it is best if you have limited luggage and don't ride it during rush hour It started to get crowded when I got back at 340 PM The trip takes about 40 minutes

title: Best route into the city
review: The airport rail link has now been operating for about eight years and is now the favoured connection during daytime peak hours From Bangkok airport you can take the train to the end of the line to Prayathai station then change to the BTS for city connections and hotels The price is just 90 baht and takes about thirty minutes If you have luggage think of a taxi from this point onwards as the BTS is not baggage friendly

title: Surprisingly smooth and comfortable ride.  The trains are clean.
review: Our first time taking the Rail Link and we are pleasantly surprised with the cleanliness and the efficiency of the train and the clear directions in the Rail mall

title: crowded but absolutely necessary
review: Bangkokians complain about this transport system  It might loose money but is working very well Please expand it no matter the costs

title: Seriously the best way to get downtown if not in a group or lugging big bags
review: Seriously the best way to get downtown if not in a group or lugging big bags Fast no jams to contend with and 2 options  really fast express or slower (but still faster than car) commuter (also much cheaper) Once you get off at town stations  buy a BTS or MRT ticket to final destination Easy and Fun

title: fast and central
review: Great Connectivity to the heart of the  City and aslo several good  connections on the way to the  Thai Rail System one can easily get from the baggage area to the  train in a jiffy

title: Cheap, Fast, Efficient, Clean, Connectivity
review: The reason I prefer to fly into Suwannaphum International Airport is the City Link train service From the airport you can take the train to link with two other metro systems (the BTS and MRT) Actually there is an express service which doesn't stop at all the stations along the way   The City line is the cheaper  only slightly slower service From beginning to end the trip takes only around 30 minutes A lot faster than taking a taxi and soooo much cheaper    You can haul your suitcase and carry on with you into the train  no problem No trolley though which could really help for travelers like Beyonce or Kim K But they probably booked a Limo anyway so  The end of the Line for the City Line is Phya Thai Station which links with the BTS line If you are traveling to the Suwannaphum airport you are bound to find a seat (if you move fast enough) at this station At the next stops the cars will begin to fill up  Fortunately there are escalators going up Going down is the problem You would have to haul your precious belongings down several flights of stairs  but then be comforted that you might be able to take on that MMA fight in the octagon after your journey  Love the City Line Be thankful it is there for you

title: Easy, cheap, efficient
review: I will not take taxi tofrom the Suvarnabhumi airport ever again Because this train connection is brilliant It is cheap (40bahtsride = 1€) clean safe and on time Remember that the first train will start operating around 6am so for those flying earlier it is unfortunately nogo For others enjoy the beautiful skyline of Bangkok

title: really good
review: great to get from the airport and back if staying in bangkokcheap tooand no hassle of getting stuck in traffic in a taxi

title: Wow
review: What a refreshing change trains that are clean and on time People respected the order and in ran beautifully No eating or drinking on trains so they even smelt ok toothe UK can learn sooooooo very much from these guys

title: Fantastic and quick to the city
review: We stayed near the stop at Easton hotel and it took only a few minutes from the airport to Makasan near the hotel  Journey was pleasant and quiet

title: Convenient
review: The best mode of transport to go to the heart of the city from bangkok airport Its very cheap as compared to a taxi and there is direct connectivity from the airport terminal But it will be very difficult to find a seat

title: Accessible and on time
review: One of the things that travelers wants is a very reliable fast transportation that will bring them to their destination and hotels

title: Convenient
review: Good connection from the airport to the city Cheap and efficient it prevents you from spending 2hours stuck in traffic

title: Transport from Bangkok to Suvurnabhumi Airport
review: Very easy inexpensive and comfortable service to travel from downtown Bangkok to main Bangkok airport Trains run every 15 minutes or so

title: Fast and efficient way to get from the airport
review: Airport Rail Link was easy to travel with you buy a token and use it to get into the train They keep the token after you exit the train system

title: easy to go with
review: Airport Rail Link was easy to travel with after a few minutes of reading how to do to get a ticket so we were on the train to Bangkok

title: Handy!
review: I used this service and it was easy and within the airport and cheap  I would use this service again

title: Metro Train
review: Airport link railway is like metro in Mumbai and delhi But little beat costly it charged 40 bhat for 30 km Also main pont is it is just inside airport So no need to go outside and took texi But see nearest station to your hotel

title: Good link between airport and city
review: The airport rail is a cheaper way to go from the airport to the city It connects to the MRT and BTS line making is a very convenient way of travelling

title: Quick way to get into the city
review: Great rail system that links you to the BTS and Metro lines  Staff are exceptionally helpful  Trains and stations are clean  Transport is very cheap

title: Convenient
review: Very convenient quick and cheap (120 THB for 2persons means 3euros) we took a taxi from our hotel next to the phra phanong bts for 60 THB to Ramkhamhaeng Station then we payed 30THB per person for the airport link it takes about 30 min to reach the Airport it's very convenient to avoid Bangkok trafic and 500 THB of the taxi ^_^

title: Cheap, quick and efficient
review: We use this sky train every time we fly to Bangkok for the reasons mentioned in the title For less than a pound you can get to many places in the city itself without having to ensure the massive traffic jams you would inevitably be in otherwise  Even if you aren't staying near one of the stops it makes sense to get as far as you can on this train and then get a taxi to your destination It is clean on time and very safe

title: Great way to avoid traffic
review: There is a great online map for your travel planing Use the BTS to save time and avoid traffic Try to use the BTS turing offpeak times as it does get crowed during business rush hour

title: Best way to beat the jam from the Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: It was my first time travelling out from Suvarnabhumi using the Airport Rail Link Strongly strongly recommend this option instead of the taxi and you'll end up getting caught in horrible traffic Took us about 40 minutes from airport right to Sukhumvit  Asok Station I think it is about 130 baht for a ticket which is realtively cheap compared to any other Asian city with airport train

title: Incredible
review: Fast and cheap way to beat the notorious traffic jams of BKK D 40Baht from the airport to ratchaprarop station The trains comes quite frequently and the waiting time is not long Bad choice if you've got loads of stuffs because the seats are very limited

title: Great Service
review: The muchawaited Airport Rail Link (0600midnight) that connects downtown Bangkok with Suvarnabhumi International Airport is a smart alternative to the airport’s express buses or taxis The City Line makes six stops between downtown (Phayathai Station) and the airport completing each run in 30 minutes making this a quick and convenient transport option for getting in and out of Bangkok  The Airport Rail Link connects you to the MRT underground at Makkasan City Interchange Station (MRT Petchaburi Station) and the BTS Skytrain at Phayathai Station Please note the baggage checkin at Makkasan Station is no longer available   From Bangkok International Airport (Suvarnabhumi) the entrance to the Airport Rail Link service is on the First Floor

title: Fast and solid
review: I love using this rail link as it is fast and superbly well built unlike the BTS sky train This system however does not run 24hrs making late arrivals and early departures problematic I get off where ever my street is nearby and take a taxi the rest of the way This is a preferred method as it saves money and in many cases it saves time

title: Always use the airport link.
review: At such a cheap price and availability why mess around outside with smelly taxi fumes in the stonking heat Its cheap and its fast Just whip down a couple of floors from arrivals and youre on the way

title: To airport
review: This is the easiest way to get to the airport from Bangkok I use this service often and will keep using it Besides being convenient it is time efficient

title: Short and Comfortable Ride
review: Was taking the airport rail link from Pratunam area to Aiirport and back Only 40baht per way and it is convenience Need to kow that they had posted security officers to scan all luggage and bags towards the airport Also they would be a security sweep before allowing the people to board the train at the both end of the journey

title: Convenient, safe & reasonably priced.
review: Quickest mode of travel between the airport & city avoiding the hassles of haggling price & traffic

title: Easiest way to airport
review: Fastest and cheapest way to go to airport or to some other connecting areas like Petchaburi BTS where you can take to go to Chatuchak market

title: No rus, No jam, Just On-time
review: A great way to travel to & from airport by Airport Rail Link Clean and comfortable ride No problems for ant foreigners with all the English signage around in the Airport to the Rail Station

title: Best way to get through town avoiding the Bangkok traffic
review: Strongly recommended to get through town easily All major shopping malls are linked with the BTS In order to avoid the cues get the Orange Rabbit card Easy convenient and cheap way to get through town especially during rush hour

title: Great way to travel to or from airport
review: Quick and easy to board Buy a token from a machine for the tollgate and you are on board Can be crowded at times because of the low fare and popularity Arrivals and departures at the lower level and easy to find Connects with MRT and BTS rail for onward journey to many city stops

title: Amazing
review: This rail lick is fantastic On time and inexpensive It brings you right into the main sky trail hub  or I like to stay at the inexpensive and pretty nice Nasa Vegas hotel Great name Just a few stops from the airport

title: Easy and cheap
review: This is the easiest way into Bangkok Catch it all the way the BTS for about 45baht pp Air conditioning air conditioning Bloody brilliant

title: Awesome sky train
review: This is a great sky train I usually get off at the MRT stop Petchaburi which is Makkasan on the airport rail link The only thing is that if you have a bunch of bags then you bump into a lot of people Most people use this for their daily commute not for travelling to the airport Taxi is usually faster but this is a lot more fun

title: Cheap and quick
review: Very handy for getting you into town from the airport and if your hotel is near a skytrain or metro stop it'll save you loads compared with a taxi

title: fast and simple
review: If you are staying near a bts or mrt station this is the best way to and from the airport It is fast (especially compared to taxi during rush hour) and very cheap only 45 baht

title: Fast, convenient connection
review: Probably one of the best airport train connections in the world Fast very comfortable inexpensive and running at high frequency  taking a taxi is completely out of question with such infrastructure in place

title: Great way to miss traffic and be on time
review: Forget the heat madness and crazy traffic patterns when you can ride in ease and more comfort (and not watch your watch every few minutes and worry about getting to a hotel or an appointment)

title: Unbelievable Trip To The Airport for only 40THB!
review: Normally I pay RM60 to RM90 to go to the Airport in Malaysia (550THB TO 800THB) via taxi Even via train it is RM40 (350THB)  With this I can conclusively say that Bangkok is one of the most economical cities to live in when it comes to mass transport

title: excellent
review: very easy to get perfect air conditioning clean Cheap and you don't need to bargain like with the taxi drivers

title: Awesome
review: Nice  clean  Fast  Reliable  always in Time  I recommend this method for transport if you need to go back and forth in Train

title: Best mode for to and fro from airport
review: it took just 45 baht and 30 mins to reach siam from airport had i taken taxi i would have paid atleast 700 baht and 90  mins

title: Efficient, air conditioned and cheap
review: I was arriving during peak hours so decided to take the ARL as I needed to get somewhere by a certain time and if I took a taxi could've been stuck in traffic The signage was quite good  to get to the stations On board is air conditioned which is a relief from the humid weather All in all a seamless and efficient trip and cheap too to get into Sukhumvit If you have lots of luggage though you're probably better off catching a taxi unless you don't mind lugging it around

title: easy for the travel
review: easy for the transport from hotel to Suwannaphumi airport and 30 minutes and the cheaper more than taxi

title: Efficiency Plus
review: Very clean airconditioned and efficient transport Very cheap and runs on time about every 12 minutes or so Can be quite crowded

title: Best way into the town
review: This service takes you to and from the main airport and connects with all other rail links in the city  Easy to use and inexpensive without the stress caused by the Bangkok traffic

title: Travelling light perfect
review: Take to a central stop and then use other means of transport Very cheap and efficient not meant for travelers who cannot manage their luggage alone

title: Check my review of BTS. But this i cool. only new and works better than BA
review: I have waited for years for this  And it does not disappoint  Clean cheap easy (don't be scared just ask a local)  You will find once you try it really allows you to start a proper traveler experience not a tourist one

title: Don't be tempted to go by taxi......
review: use the airport rail link instead It's cheapmax 45baht and connects with other rail routes at some of the various stations Ticket machines are in Thai and Englishtake notes and give change Announcements on the trains are in Thai and English Trains can get very crowded depending on the time of day so could be difficult if you have a lot of luggage In the airport you need to follow the signs down several floors to the trains  The trains don't have meters that aren't working and don't take a circuitous route either and are much much cheaper than a taxi

title: good way to get into bangkok
review: The trains are located in the basement of the airport The cost is pretty reasonable The train is setup a bit different from the trains in Bangkok and help to accommodate suitcases and baggage The train is quite fast but probably about the same time as it would take by taxi during nonrush hour times One thing i noticed is that a lot of thais especial thai youth use this train to get into the city Because of this the train can be crowded and difficult to exit with baggage  The stations are conveniently located with connections to other transport lines within bangkok  I would use the line again

title: Quickest and cheapest way to get into town!
review: The airport link is a very convenient way to get into town No hassle of having to find a taxi and run around with you luggage It connects to BTS and MRT at different stops as well as the ferry Once your in town you can still change into a taxi you've just already skipped about 20 minutes of traffic minimum

title: Quick, easy, reliable service from the main airport to the city area
review: A cheap fast and reliable way to get to the airport Especially useful in peak hour and rainy weather to beat the traffic It is clean the only problem can be getting to a station

title: wow
review: Its a good and different way of traveling and so neat and very discipline people i have saw And different way of taking a ticket counter

title: A must for getting into the City
review: I always use the airport rail link to get as close to my hotel as possible and then get a taxi or tuk tuk for the last part  It's ridiculously cheap  air conditioned and fast as the traffic in Bangkok is usually horrendous  Google map first and look at the different routes and options as some train lines go in a big loop which wastes time   For example if your going to Sukumvit it's faster and cheaper to get off at Makkassan and get a taxi then do a big loop and swap to the BTS train line If only my home city of Melbourne had such a great train service for less than $2 each way

title: Fast & easy way to access city center..
review: You should definitely contact with information office to access the ariport rail link If other agency catch you they will definitely force you to go by taxi or bus You can also contact with your hotel abour roadmap  But airport rail link is easy fast and cheapest way to go city center from the airport But it only have for  suvarbabhumi airport   Cheers Ernur

title: Great public transport
review: A very quick clean and cheap way to get from the centre of town to the airport with a frequent service

title: i love saving money
review: it just takes 40  45 minutes to reach airport it is the cheapest way to reach airport fast quick and economical

title: Great and easy link between terminals
review: So easy to use to get between terminals English signage which helped me understand Well organised and maintained Clean and efficient way of getting around a massive airport

title: The fastest way into the city
review: The rail link is 45 baht one way and runs frequently  It's on the lower level of the airport  take escalators all the way down and get what looks like a poker chip token from the ticket window  The train cars have plenty of room for luggage  Taking the train all the way to Phaya Thai takes about 30 min  If connecting to the BTS having large suitcases or multiple suitcases may be more challenging to navigate since some of the BTS stops do not have escalators  The rail link will avoid the traffic of Bangkok and get you into the city faster even if you need a taxi from the rail link or BTS station

title: Really Convenient!
review: The cheapest and fastest way to get to the airport you can check the itinerary online and go to the station (it is crowded so be aware of that if you are carrying lots of lugagge)

title: Clean, efficient and great value
review: Would recommend for all easy to navigate friendly staff and great value Travelled from BKK to the city and then over the following days across the city

title: Great way to the city
review: You save a lot and I mean a lot of time and money if you use the service Fast frequent cheap Excellent alternative to taxi

title: Very convenient
review: Took this link to the airport from my hotel in downtown Bangkok and it was quick easy very econonomical and an easy fast way to get to the airport

title: Faster and cheaper to reach Airport
review: Its connect to Airport and faster and cheapest way to reach from Airport to City and also connected to BTS which is kind of Delhi Metro or London Tube

title: Great way to get around
review: Cheap fast clean on time air conditioned Best way to travel around Bangkok  Don't get stuck in traffictake a sky train

title: Fast and Easy
review: If you travel without heavy baggage I would suggest using this ARL extremely fast and Easy i go from Makkasan station in just 20 to 30 minutes i already in Airport Dont waste your time stucked in Bangkok traffic jam

title: This ride it's an atraction itself!
review: It was just a blast to enter Bangkok this way Modern convenient and safe and on top of it a real look into Bangkok's local life

title: Very convenient and faster way to get around
review: Our hotel was situated 300 metres from the Nana BTS station near the Sukhumvit area  From the airport instead of taking a taxi we had taken the Airport Rail Link as we were not sure about the city traffic   We changed train at the Phaya Thai Station and took the BTS Sky train  We were three of us and the total cost of reaching the Nana area from the Airport was less than 200THB

title: Good
review: very convenient for travel within the city and I think fastest mode very easy to negotiate with names in English

title: Best way to go to the City
review: From the airport to Makkasan MRT station to link with the Metro and to Phaya Thai to link with the BTS   Fast and doesn't depend on traffic get a taxi to and from the next station to your hotel and void the traffic jams

title: Excellent way of going from the Airport to BKK
review: This is by far the cheapest and most easiest way to get to your hotel or destination in Bangkok If you stay in Sukhumvit or other areas connected to the BTS Skytrain then this is the solution for you

title: zip into city
review: Quickest easiest way into the city and the great mrtbti system Avoid all those traffic jams and fumes

title: Cheap way into town
review: I used the train to get to my hotel in Ploen Chit 45 Baht Plus I think 18 for the BTS Be aware if travelling with heavy luggage There is quite a bit of walking in between the stationsstairs when transferring to the BTS

title: cheap way to Airport especially if you solo traveler
review: Its really a cheap way to Airport especially if you solo traveler You can't share your taxi fee with anyone after all this public transportation really useful and helps you manage your budget Make sure your flight arrive and depart tofrom SUV so you can enjoy your new experience with this service

title: Wow
review: The quickest (especially in rush hour) to get to anywhere in Bangkok Cheap and hassle free Buy your ticket from the platform machines and get on and enjoy the ride

title: Quick and convenient
review: Easiest way to go to and from the city We still managed to squeeze in at 5pm on a Thursday afternoon rush hour from the airport to the City

title: Easy Rider
review: This was by far the best way to get to or from the airport From now on I will book accommodation near to a station Traveling by car can take forever but this was hassle free

title: Airport link to bangkok city
review: Airport link is very well connected to Bangkok city and you have to change at Phaya Thai to any location in bangkok Announcements are made in both in Thai and English

title: the easiest and cheapest way to get to the center of Bangkok
review: train is really fast (just 2530 minutes from the airport) also it is quiet cheap (4045 BAT per person) Also all trains are equipped with airconditioning so you are not suffering from heat Comfortable and easy way to get to the city center

title: Skytrain
review: Take this to get to the city It's much better than a taxi only 70 baht Air conditioned and easy to navigate It's on the bottom floor of the airport

title: Way to AIrport
review: That was a great experience travelling to Airport without any traffic congestion Thats really good to have a Direct Rail Link to Airport as it saves time and also provides a perfect journey

title: Easy way of travelling and cheap too
review: The connection to the last stop (starting from the airport) costs 45 THB per person This is so much cheaper than a taxi

title: Very easy to use
review: The rail link was 5 minutes walk from our hotel Indra Regent and we used it frequently to connect us to phaya thai where we could catch the sky trains on the other lines Though we did not use it to go to the airport we saw that it's very much used by tourists and has all facilities needed like lifts for luggage and staff to guide people the right way Very clean and user friendly I would recommend to ensure that staff understands english as its an airport rail link and they come across tourists all day long Staff not knowing English are not helpful to foreigners

title: Amazing fast transit! Easy to use
review: I have used this many times  Coming from the Bangkok airport you go to the lowest level and follow the signs pretty easy it is just around the corner from the escalator  Pay for a token at the booth where they have live people  Price depends on where you go  The line is pretty straight but it does have stops  I take it all the way to the end  Phaya Thai  It is air conditioned and fast  Before you board at the airport they do have transit police that search the train when it arrives before they let anyone board then they let people in  You use the token to enter the station area where you descind to the platform area  The trains run very frequently This part is handicapped friendly a lot of the stations are not however  Depends on where you go  some have elevators to the ground (or escalators) many stations only have stairs though Phaya Thai station does have an elevator to the street

title: Best way to reach the city
review: Take the Airport Rail Link instead of a taxi It's easy to book cheap and fast and you have perfect connection to the Skytrain for further destinations in the city

title: Train from the airport
review: So easy and simple to use  Asked tourist police for guidance only cost around  £2 each for the train from the airport to the nearest station to our hotel  We then got a tuktuk straight to our hotel door for 100 bht

title: Best way for airport transportation
review: The airport rail link is cheap airconditioned clean and very userfriendly I'd definitely recommend this over the taxi drivers who are overcharging you Our ticket was only 70 baht and taxi drivers began negotiating at 800 baht and with the traffic jams you never know exactly how long it would take with a taxi

title: Excellent Airport Link
review: The services are comprised of 2 lines nonstop Express services and City Train services Both lines operate from 0600 am – midnight  Facilitating the tourists and commuters to travel to other parts of Bangkok both lines have interchange station at Makkasan Station for MRT (Underground train) at Phetchaburi Station

title: Best way to travel into the city!
review: If you just arrived at Bangkok Thailand(BKK) or plan to go to use the Airport Rail Link It is the BEST method of transportation to go to the city The Airport Rail Link stations are very close to other train lines so you can mount and dismount easily and keep on moving through the city It's way cheaper than taxis and way faster Remember that traffic is insane in Bangkok

title: Quick and easy way back and forth to Suvarnabhumi
review: The Airport Link is an excellent way if you like to go by yourself and not take a taxi The end station in Bangkok is close and Connected to the BTS system for easy transfer other places in town

title: Affordable Way to get to the city
review: Affordable way to get into the city if you don't have lots of baggage with you the airport link connects BTS in Phaya Thai and then you just have to walk 5 mins to reach the BTS but there are lots of signs to guide you Highest fare would be 42 THB from the Airport to Phaya Thai

title: Very convenient
review: Keeping in view the rates of taxis at the airport airport link is the best option Just takes 45 thb from airport till the last stop from where you can get bts on wards to siam square or anywhere Taxis charge 700thb for this 45 thb trip

title: Good Experience.
review: It was a very good experience on the train from airport to downtown Bankok On time Comfortable Easy exchange from one train to the other Staff were very helpfull and happy to do so Beat getting a taxi and batteling the afternoon peak hour traffic

title: Cheap Airport Rail Link (CITY LINE) to Bangkok
review: The Chaepest way from the Airport is to take the Airport Rail link (City Line) to Phaya Thai Station Cost is about 120 bath Here is a row of seats on each side of the Train so you have plent of Room for your Suitcase It takes about 30 minutes to Phaya Thai Station Here You can change and go on the BTS Train to where you want to go or go to the bottom and take a Taxi to Your Destination

title: Cheap and easy to use
review: Last time I used the rail link was two months ago from the airport into town I found it clean fast easy to use and efficient The service is regular and just can't imagine from the times that I've used it anyone could find fault with it unless they had an enormous amount of luggage

title: Easy, cheap and fast
review: Easy cheap safe and fast Excellent frequency Better than taxi highly recommended Go for it you'll not regret

title: Best mode of transport for quick transfer from airport to city, inexpensive
review: Fantastic quick clean service inexpensive easy to get a ticket from the machineand easy mode of transportation

title: Fast and Economical way to reach Swarnabhumi Airport
review: The highest ticket price is 50 THB from Phaya Thai to Swarnabhumi Airport Its fast and efficient  Note  It does not go to Don Muaeng Airport

title: lucky didnt miss my flight.
review: when you are late to catch your plane you only have this train no traffic no delay relax you will be on time

title: Would catch it again
review: Caught the train from the airport to bangkok Very fast clean and modern I found it not that costly and very comfortable

title: Easy to use, don't be afraid
review: Easy to navigate if you know where you are going SO very cheap and easy to get around You can buy tickets off ticket master or use ThaiEnglish machines Most use token system

title: Just great!!!!
review: It took some time to complete but ever since this train is by for the most convenient way to get from the airport to the city It's fast easy to use and cheap Detailed information can be found in the following link httpwwwbangkokcomairportraillink

title: Cheap mode of transport from airport.
review: Very smooth ride from airport to baiyoke(pratunam) Affordable cost The train will be packed during peak hour   City line will start as early as 6am Recommended for tourist who hate traffic jam

title: Convenient, inexpensive and easy to use!
review: I love taking the Airport Rail Link It is a great way to get to downtown Bangkok There are no complications the whole process is simple quick and effective I normally take the link to Makkasan station and then transfer to the MRT line and get off at Asok (Sukhumvit) and I am withing walking distance of where I need to go If you have not yet used the rail link give it a try

title: Fantastic
review: Brilliant service and for 90b for two people from start to terminating station its a real winner The added security checks were reassuring

title: Best economy way to travel inout of Airport
review: the best way to travel from the airport to the cities very safe comfortable and cheap  be prepare an hour for waiting and travelling if you are leaving the contry and need to check in luggages  especially during peak traffic periods

title: Clean, fast, cheap
review: Simply the best way to get from the airport to central Bangkok To the airport catch from Phraya Thai to make sure you get a seat Catching the train is the only way to go as traffic jams in Bangkok are terrible

title: Most reliable transport
review: This is the fastest and cheapest mode of transport to connect to Bangkok city It takes less than 30 minutes to reach Central Bangkok from airport by Airport Rail Link First train starts at 6 in the morning

title: easy and smooth experience
review: Very easy to access the center of the city through the airport rail link will definitely take it again if the taxi queue at arrival is too long

title: Clean, cheap, fast
review: This train is awesome It is so cheap to get to Phaya Thai which is the end of the line at the city center The train is air conditioned clean spacious and fast It takes about 30 mins to each end I got a little confused when I first got on because at the airport it is called Airport City Link and thought there was a different train You need some Thai baht if you're just coming off the plane from the airport and never been to Thailand before You can put bills in the ticket machines There is a line at the token (train ticket) machines where (sometimes) a train police man helps you get your token When you pay your fare you get a token that you can swipe at the sensor at the little turn stiles to get to the trains but you have to keep that token because when you get off the train you have to put the token in the slot of the exit gate

title: Cheap and good to the city
review: Hate taking a cab when you travel light and needs to go to the city hotel Hate to be in a traffic jam Airport rail link is the best option Airport to my hotel in silom including transfer is only 45mins  It's Clean fast and easy

title: Avoid the traffic
review: What a great way to get to and from the airport Bangkok traffic just gets worse and worse More roads have led to more cars and more time stopped on motorways The rail link is fast efficient and a relaxing way to take in the sites Highly recommended

title: Wuhu!
review: Great link to the airport no rushhour beautiful view (when small enough) cheap nice people very safe will come again

title: Amazing and quick travel
review: A very nice quick and easy transport means Safe and pleasurable moments while moving Cosy as well as offering nice views a travel by the rail in Bangkok is a trendy way to get around

title: Go for it, if you are a littleway out get a tuk tuk then it is really cheap but great quality service
review: Fantastic easy to use and cheap They are very clean and the staff (most of them spoke some English) They announce stations in Thai and English Loved it Worth printing out both the MTR and sky train maps before you leave

title: Fast and cheap
review: Goid way of getting to the airport FROM BANGKOK TOWN However unless you are travelling light or on a strict budget when going from SUVARNABHUMI TO TOWN use the Taxi rank From the airport is the rare occasions the drivers WILL use the meters when you say as it is controlled by the airports The fee into Sukhumvit or Pratunam areas is roughly 200thb including tolls and airport fee

title: Wonderful!
review: Trip to Phya Thai station costs ~45Baht Quick clean and convenient Highly recommended if you're travelling with less than 4 persons Otherwise it MIGHT be cheaper to get to town via a taxi (if you're splitting the price by 4)

title: Cheap and easy
review: I was a little intimidated at the idea of taking public transport into the city from the airport instead of a taxi but needn't have been It was incredibly easy to use easy to tell where you were fun views (especially as someone who'd never been to Asia before) No worries in the least

title: super fast for a solo traveller or 2
review: what a wonderful way to get to the city to and from the airportone of the best in the worldbest part is that its very clean and maintainedso cant complain

title: Fast and reliable.
review: Do not even consider using anything else than Airport Rail Link for trips fromto BKK airport Fast (30 minutes) reliable and connect directly to SkyTrain Also very afordable AC works overtime in the train )

title: Efficient and Cheap travel to Suvarnabhumi!
review: I love the Airport rail link for its reliability timeliness comfort cleanliness super views of the cityand most of all for the reasonably priced fares While travelling from Silomi would take the MRT to Petchaburi and transfer to the Makkasan station ( guided throughout by well placed signs) for the airport link The half hour journey costs just 35THB and the price of my entire journey is less than half the cost of getting a taxi from the airport to the city center (Silom) Would highly reccommend if you are travelling solo or in a small group without too much luggage

title: Cheap, easy and efficient way of getting to the city centre
review: 45B and 30 minutes later I arrived at Phaya Thai and was a 2 minute walk to my hostel (via a McDonalds for an ice cream how cultured) Easy to find in the airport although involves a fair bit of walking Organised queuing system when boarding Was able to get a seat most times  Trains are every 10 minutes

title: Fuss free
review: Have used this service a few times to get from the airport to the hotel fuss free and easy and very quick

title: Jump the traffic jam
review: Very convenient especially at peak times when the roads from and to the airport are congested Very clean and very well air conditionedFurthermore you have a nice view of the city from the elevated rails

title: Great service - fast and reliable
review: Fantastic service try to prepare yourself with roller bags as backpacks may be a little difficult on the walk from the BTS metro to the rail link

title: Fast, Easy Travel!
review: I highly recommend taking the Airport Rail Link if you are staying near any BTSMRT Station It is a cheap and easy option that takes you from the airport directly to the City Centre The ride is very pleasant as there are very few stops in between and to me is the fastest way to get to town

title: AIRPORT RAIL LINK
review: Forget to pay for a Taxi if your hotel is near a BTS or MRT station the Airport Rail link is easy to get punctual and fast besides that it cost 90% less than a taxi service

title: Use it to save money on airport taxi
review: If you know your destination in Bangkok then you can use Rail Link save good money on Taxis Be sure about your destination and the closest station otherwise you will end up catching another taxi

title: Good if travelling alone
review: Arrived in to Bangkok and decided to try the Airport Link I might of been tired from the flight but did not find it the easiest to work out where I needed to get off etc to the make connection to Asok area  Would defiantly try it again though

title: AIRPORT GETTING THERE FAST
review: LOVE LOVE LOVE the Airport Rail link  Fast no hassle but if you have a lot of baggage rather use the airport taxi where the fee is 500 baht and you pay the tolls as well which cost approximately 120 baht

title: The best way to commute between the airport and the city
review: Fast and cheap not too crowded and has good connections on the city side Better than taxi and you can always take a taxi at the end station there' even a taxi stand

title: Good to try
review: One of the best way to go to the central of Bangkok What I really liked was the price It's not expensive and no need to worry about overcharged from taxi High recommended

title: Not available during wee hours. :(
review: Best and probbaly the chepsest mode of transport to reach the city centre from Suvarnbhumi  airportbeware its not available during wee hours Starts at 6 am ans last train I guess is between 2339 to 0000 hrs

title: Efficient, fast and reliable
review: Best way to get to the airport from any location or getting to the metro station (Makasan) from any location you are at Not to mention extremely economical

title: Bullet train
review: Hassle free journey ample space for luggage and passengers brings you straight to the city center in the least possible time  However the frequency between trains should be reduced

title: Fast, cheap.
review: This is such a great way to get to town It has a very easy access from the Airport It s cheap compared to Taxis rate to town Shame it doesnt work all night long

title: Good connectivity
review: Takes you directly inside the Suvarnabhumi airport A very good and cheap and speedy alternative to Taxis

title: Good for Avoiding Morning Traffic
review: I'll usually opt to take the airport rail link into the city should my flight arrive early in the morning on weekdays to avoid traffic jams Its a quick short ride However depending on where you want to go and you're planning to connect to the BTS to get to your hotel be prepared for the likelihood of having to lug your luggage down the BTS stairs   But if you're heading to Terminal 21 or its vicinity you could actually get down at the airport rail link's Makkasan stop and hop onto the MRT since the MRT stations always has escalators (get down at Sukhumvit station for Terminal 21) But its about a 7 minutes sheltered walk to the MRT station

title: Fast and efficient!
review: This is the easiest and fastest way to travel from the airport into the city by avoiding traffic jams along the way most likely you will be stuck in jams if you were to take a taxi to the city

title: Excellent transport link
review: Another fantastic service Simple quick and cheap to use  The staff are helpful and the train has air con  It can be busy at times

title: Good Transport
review: Very economical fast easy clean transportation into Bangkok from airport Faster than a taxi or bus Has stations which are very near BTS stations so you can get to many places in BKK

title: Fastest way to and from Bangkok
review: Very fast getting from the airport to center of Bangkok Price is 30 Baht and a taxi would cost at least 500 Baht

title: Great during Heavy Traffic Hours
review: Very clean efficient and air conditioned  If you are traveling alone with many heavy suitcases I would recommend taking a taxi  I have used this system when going to the airport to meet someone arriving from overseas  They are also building an airport link to the old airport Don Muang but that may only be finished in 2 years

title: Perfect to go to and from the airport
review: Our hotel was located in Sukhumvit The fastest way to get there take the airport rail link to Makassan station and grab a taxi from there Cheap and fast

title: Excellent travel option from BKK airport
review: At 45 Baht or just over one Euro this new train linking the Airport with downtown is both fast and convenient after arriving at BKK Make sure you get a seat ie do not enter a train that is already crowded as more people will join at next stops  At the last Station there is a desk assisting you with flagging down a taxi which can be a bit of a challenge depending on the time of the day

title: Easy, cheap and efficient!
review: Highly recommended Take the skytrain or subway to the nearest Airport Rail link Maybe if you are travelling with heavy suitcases and you lack muscle strength to carry them up many stairs you should just take a cab But otherwise it is brilliant

title: Cheap, convenient and easy to use
review: Ticket machines are in English and easy to use Cheap convenient and quick mode of transport into the city Travelled to Phaya Thai station at 8pm Plenty of seats and space for luggage PhayaThai station had a lift to the ground floor so no humping suitcases up and down stairs Would recommend

title: Great way to connect
review: Probably the best easiest and cheapest airport connection I've experienced in the world so faaaaaar

title: Convenient & Low Cost Airport Rail Link
review: It is very convenient there are two lines express and city line Normally people use city line 42 BHT for the longest distance (the more shorten the more lower) to Phyathai which you can connect to sky train (BTS) to anywhere in Bangkok  It is very effective way low cost and convenient  From the Suvannabhum airport go down to B1 level

title: Super easy and no evil taxi drivers
review: I recommend the airport rail It is so easy and you don't have to deal with sketchy taxi drivers Taxi drivers love to rip off tourist and the airport rail will get you to most tourist areas of town at a fixed rate You might need to get a taxi from your rail exit but you avoid the taxi drivers for most of the journey Metered taxis are cheaper than nonmetered and much cheaper than the tuk tuk drivers Explore the rail in general It will make your visit better in BKK

title: Best Airport Rail ever
review: I always take Airport Rail from BKK airport to city It's super convenient and worth taking only 40 Baht and won't take you too much time You don't have to bargain with the taxi driver just drop on the train

title: the only way to go
review: aside from being cheap its fast and hassle free  no more getting in a taxi sitting in traffic and having to be hassled constantly for more money by the taxi conartists of bkk  easy connection to phaya thai bts and the entire bts system  just beware if you are going to the airport the phaya thai stop can be extremely busy going back to airport since it passes many communities that rely on this to go to from bts but not all the way to airport

title: Fantastic and Cheap Connect from Bangkok Airport to Town area
review: fuss free and clean and gets you to town in 20 mins flat Two weird things are  1) why do the security guard always want to spot check the whole train before allowing passengers to board the train 2) why are there so many stairs and no elevators avaiable for travellers with luggage

title: quick cheap and efficient
review: ideal travel from airport to centre of Bangkok cheap quick and convenient if more than one of you cheaper to get a taxi maybe though

title: Clean fast efficient and inexpensive
review: If you are not to heavily laden with luggage the airport rail link is an excellent option from airport to central Bangkok  In our case we exited at Makasan changing to the MRT underground which dropped us close to our hotel near the central rail station Service is clean fast and efficient and not expensive  My journey was 65 baht per person compared with 500 baht I would expect to pay for a taxi

title: Convenient service
review: from the airport the train link is easy to locate and there are personnel who will assist you along the way the train is really convenient and it only took at least 30 minutes for us to transfer to the bts going to Siam

title: Efficient, cost effective.
review: Very fast very efficient very cost effective way to get tofrom the Airport  On departure you're able to check your luggage in hours ahead of your actual check in time so you'll be able to go out and about without being encumbered by your luggage

title: Inexpensive and fast
review: This was a fast inexpensive easy way to get to BKK from the airport Almost empty when we arrived around 9pm and in the city in 15mins

title: Short stopover
review: Great for travel to and from airport Buy a token for 45 Baht for full distance Tokens are only valid for 3 days so if you are in town for longer wait to buy the return

title: Better to take a taxi than this service
review: I say this because taxis are so cheap in Bangkok and convenient vis a vis this service So if two or three persons share a taxi it just makes more commercial sense to take the convenience brave the traffic than to climb up levels of stair cases with your luggage jostle for space with city commuters and be subject to the Airport Links poor frequencies  Having said the above the service is clean and fast15 minutes from Suvarnabhumi to Makkasan on the express There are two servicesone that stops at every station and another that does not Be careful which train you take

title: Really convenient!
review: Bangkok it rather big city and it will cost about 200300 baht to get to the city from the airport  by taxi Airport city link is the best alternative as it costs 2050 baht ( depends on how far yoy need to go to )and has stations in practically all areas of the city Though after Link you will have to take a taxi or BTS (some stations have interchange which is very convenient)

title: Do this
review: Absolutely great way to get to the airport I recommend staying near the Airport Link on your last night Don't take a taxi to the airport You'll stress yourself out with the traffic Do yourself a favor and take this Rail Link

title: Good way to reach downtown from Airport and adjoining areas.
review: Brilliant service quick intervals clear navigational maps and good connectivityBut too much of walking

title: Airport Rail link experience was very goood
review: this was one of the best thing happened in bangkok a rain link direct below the terminal stright to the city we saved alot money for that

title: Beat the traffic into the city
review: Excellent way to get into Bangkok without the stress of traffic jams I stayed at the Sukosol (last stop on the Airport rail link) The only disadvantage to taking the Airport Rail Link is that it is hard to find the elevators and escalators I didn't find them Pack lightlythere are stairs

title: Airport Rail link
review: The airport rail link is a very fast way to travel from the airport to the center and vice versa If you travel by taxi for example it may take you very very long as you probably end up in trafic jams

title: CONVENIENCE
review: Super convenient way to get from SUVANABOON airport into town in around 40 minutes for a fraction of the cost of a taxi but the best thing is that you never get caught in traffic which is often horrendous in BKK

title: Convenient
review: Connected with Sky Train so it allows not to be stuck in traffic Very cheap and well kept We needed to go to Sathorn and it took less than one hour from the airport including waiting

title: Faster with Airport Rail Link takes more security measures
review: 8 station from airport to downtown last station is Phayathai station after that you can continue travelling with skytrain call BTS to get in other side of Bangkok  easy and faster  But a lots of people on rush hour in the morning and evening

title: Aiport Rail Link
review: This is an excellent and not expensive way to get from the aiport to the center of the city You take the train at section B in the terminal and it cost you 42THB (about 115) It is worth it

title: The best option to go to Suvarnabhumi
review: Really cheap from 40 to 55 baths depending on the destination in Bangkok It is fast and punctual less than 30 minutes

title: Good transportation infrastructure from the airport.
review: 45B 30 minute ride to connecting train ride into the city almost not worth getting a taxi from the airport if you know where you are going this is like the kind of train you could expect in Japan from Narita

title: Save money and save time
review: This Airport Link is very convenience for me save money save time and very near my place where i am stay It a short time to the town

title: Save time and easy
review: Good and fast easy and not expensive good for visitor and have good experience to go airport save time and no traffics jams

title: Fastest way to airport
review: The airport Rail link will be your most efficient way to the airport if you are close to a BTS station as we were With luggage in hand we boarded our nearby station of Phrom Phong We stayed at the nearby Double Tree so the walk was less than 5 minutes  Once on we took the BTS to Phaya Thaya where we transfered to the Airport Rail Link There is an express line which does not stop and arrives about 15 minutes faster than the other option which stops like 34 times The cost differential was minimal so we took the express The nicest thing is you end up at the airport and avoid all the traffice and congestion which is Bangkok is pretty much all the time Best way to get to the airport

title: Great, cheap way to reach bangkok center from airport
review: Great way to reach bangkok center from airport it's fast clean and much cheaper than a taxi service  it was crowded when i used it but it's part of the fun to mingle with local people

title: The BEST & FASTEST WAY TO and FROM the Airport
review: The AIRPORT LINK is the CHEAPEST & FASTEST WAY to get to the City By taking the CITY LINE For BAHT 45 you will be at the PHAYA THAI Airport Link Station in 28 Minutes (This was my actual travel time) And from the PHAYA THAI or MAKKASAN STATION take the Metro or BTS to your DESTINATION They also have the Express line which is Faster BAHT 150 but it was unavailable as of JULY 2015

title: Best way to travel to Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: Excellent and cheap way to get to the airport Took about an hour from where we were staying off Suk 11 from door to door The train lets you off in the bottom floor of the airport and it's very easy to navigate your way up the elevatorsescalators to the arrivals area of the airport Would highly recommend over taking a taxi especially with the traffic in Bangkok
